class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/207711145" />    <a title="Inge" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6278820-inge"><img alt="Inge" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471187069p2/6278820.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/207711145?book_show_action=false">Apr 27, 2015</a>      <a title="Inge" class="user" name="Inge" href="/user/show/6278820-inge">Inge</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747584681" href="/book/show/840699.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=laugh-out-loud-funny">laugh-out-loud-funny</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=faeries-fae-and-elves">faeries-fae-and-elves</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=main-character-is-cool">main-character-is-cool</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=magic">magic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=all-time-favourites">all-time-favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=smiles-a-plenty">smiles-a-plenty</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=ghosts">ghosts</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=villain-rocks-my-socks">villain-rocks-my-socks</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=children">children</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6278820-inge?shelf=neat-world-building">neat-world-building</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer207711145" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5494378058380013486"><b>Spoilers for anyone who has never read the books or seen the movies. In which case, have you been living under a rock?!</b><br><br><i>"Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love."</i><br><br>Albus Dumbledore is by far one of my favourite characters. He is clever, kind, badass, but most of all, he is weird. And I like weird. I like the way his first-day-of-the-year speeches make no sense at all. I like how he uses different types of candy for his office passwords. I like how he</span>  <span id="freeText5494378058380013486" style="display:none"><b>Spoilers for anyone who has never read the books or seen the movies. In which case, have you been living under a rock?!</b><br><br><i>"Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love."</i><br><br>Albus Dumbledore is by far one of my favourite characters. He is clever, kind, badass, but most of all, he is weird. And I like weird. I like the way his first-day-of-the-year speeches make no sense at all. I like how he uses different types of candy for his office passwords. I like how he says he sees a new pair of socks in the Mirror of Erised. I like how he believes Harry unconditionally, no matter how farfetched his story may seem. He’s been a guide, a counselor, a friend, not only to Harry, but to everyone Albus cared about. He’s been a shoulder, a rock, some form of hope to everyone who had the privilege to be a part of his life. Everyone looked up to him. The darkest wizard of all time feared him. Yet he never looks dangerous. He is always this calm, serene person with a smile on his face, entertaining us with his wise, often odd sayings. He never put himself first; always thought of others. And even after his death will he be a beacon of hope, of faith, of everything the good side represents.<br><br>Professor Dumbledore, I will always be loyal to you. You will never be forgotten.<br><br>May you rest in peace.<br><br><a href="http://tinypic.com?ref=mvrpd2" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380358779ra/709955.gif" alt="Image and video hosting by TinyPic" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>Even though he was a bit of a dick sometimes.<br><br><a href="http://tinypic.com?ref=167l6w7" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1400835562i/9725969._SX540_.jpg" alt="Image and video hosting by TinyPic" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a></span>  <a bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/28636277-juliana-zapata?shelf=2015">2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1327076357" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7727289109856875726">Un libro tan emocionante como doloroso, me tomaron por sorpresa todos los sucesos que acontecen en este libro. Reí y me emocioné muchísimo con el 90% del libro, pero cuando llegué a las últimas páginas todo fue dolor y sufrimiento.<br /><br />Terminé destrozada <br /><br />Reseña Completa: <a target="_blank" href="http://bastvilard.blogspot.com/2015/08/harry-potter-y-el-misterio-del-principe.html" rel="nofollow">http://bastvilard.blogspot.com/2015/0...</a></span>          </span>        </div>      <div itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1706680822" />    <a title="Markus" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/26681101-markus"><img alt="Markus" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1421952301p2/26681101.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1706680822?book_show_action=false">Jul 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Markus" class="user" name="Markus" href="/user/show/26681101-markus">Markus</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439784542" href="/book/show/49852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=childrens-books">childrens-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1706680822" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8837670720575235440"><i>”And now, Harry, let us step out into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure.”</i><br /><br />In the wake of epic confrontation in the Department of Mysteries, Harry Potter and his friends start their sixth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. It is rather more quiet than the fifth, but contains some incredibly intriguing aspects. An elusive Draco Malfoy, a book containing the scribbles of the enigmatic Half-Blood Prince, and more information on the backstory of a certain Hogwarts</span>  <span id="freeText8837670720575235440" style="display:none"><i>”And now, Harry, let us step out into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure.”</i><br /><br />In the wake of epic confrontation in the Department of Mysteries, Harry Potter and his friends start their sixth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. It is rather more quiet than the fifth, but contains some incredibly intriguing aspects. An elusive Draco Malfoy, a book containing the scribbles of the enigmatic Half-Blood Prince, and more information on the backstory of a certain Hogwarts student of old by the name of Tom Riddle.<br /><br />From a more objective point of view, I would not hesitate to say that this book was not as good as the fifth one, which has been by far the best in the <i>Harry Potter</i> series. Personally however, I may have enjoyed this one more. Mostly because there are few things I enjoy more than backstory. And while this series lacks a lot in many aspects, it does have a bunch of wildly interesting characters. Dumbledore and Snape are definitely among them. But above them all rises Tom Riddle.<br /><br />That being said, Dumbledore was by far my favourite character at the end of the fifth book, and he remains so at the end of the sixth.<br /><br /><b>  <i>”It is the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.”</i></b><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="8837670720575235440" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1706680822">  <td class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_443101397" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/443101397" />    <a title="Mohammed Arabey" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13592557-mohammed-arabey"><img alt="Mohammed Arabey" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1364338486p2/13592557.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/443101397?book_show_action=false">Dec 31, 2012</a>      <a title="Mohammed Arabey" class="user" name="Mohammed Arabey" href="/user/show/13592557-mohammed-arabey">Mohammed Arabey</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439784542" href="/book/show/49852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer443101397" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7046380251168142575">First of all ,It's the less u0026quot;actionu0026quot; book in the series, That's why many may get disappointed, But I see it's one important book for the character development and to wrap up the actual u0026quot;Tasku0026quot; of how Harry should finish Voldemort. as at that book we learn more about his past also we realize secrets that the writer kept hidden-although gave some hints that proved it was there from the beginning-about what Harry's facing, The cleverness of showing the u0026quot;Horcruxesu0026quot; idea was there since the early</span>  <span id="freeText7046380251168142575" style="display:none">First of all ,It's the less "action" book in the series, That's why many may get disappointed, But I see it's one important book for the character development and to wrap up the actual "Task" of how Harry should finish Voldemort. as at that book we learn more about his past also we realize secrets that the writer kept hidden-although gave some hints that proved it was there from the beginning-about what Harry's facing, The cleverness of showing the "Horcruxes" idea was there since the early stage of the books is remarkable. <br /><br />One of the things I adore about Harry Potter that it's set in the real world ,"Our World" ..the beginning of that book implant that concept.. that the events we're reading since book one is happening here in our real world,The Prime Minister scene/chapter is real amazing addition to the series,and it include most of the major events we witnessed happened at the Wizardry world through the previous books and how it affect our world.<br /><br />The characters get more complicated here at that book..as for Snape secrets reveal...shocking for some and relieve those who always mistrust him being in the good side.. Well plotted twist from J K -which won't stop twisting the plot cleverly specially in Snape's character- Also there's a depth in Draco's character that really serve the plot of this and next book.<br />Then the guardian role of Dumbledore at Harry's life start to manifest at that book. <br />Then the atmosphere of the life in the wizardry world -like the Diagon ally scene was darker than ever. <br /><br />And there's also the romance which is increase at that part due to the coming of age. You'll love the Hermione-Ron relation.<br />In short ..... it's the best way to introduce the beginning of the end of a Saga . <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="7046380251168142575" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review443101397">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link443101397" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=443101397u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_443101397'><a id="like_count_review_443101397" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/443101397?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">58 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_443101397" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_443101397" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=58u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=443101397u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_443101397" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 443101397, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1301301331?book_show_action=false">Jun 15, 2015</a>      <a title="Liam" class="user" name="Liam" href="/user/show/34270521-liam">Liam</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747581086" href="/book/show/93124.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34270521-liam?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1301301331" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8853341375900141169">This book has to be one of my favourites in the series, if not my favourite!! There's just something really special about it and it's just such a beautiful book...<br /><br />The plot is so intricately structured and everything falls into place so well! I think this book has the best plot out of the series as it builds up to the end and really does keep you guessing throughout!<br /><br />The character development within this book is fantastic! Everyone is just that little bit sassier and hormonal which is very enterta</span>  <span id="freeText8853341375900141169" style="display:none">This book has to be one of my favourites in the series, if not my favourite!! There's just something really special about it and it's just such a beautiful book...<br /><br />The plot is so intricately structured and everything falls into place so well! I think this book has the best plot out of the series as it builds up to the end and really does keep you guessing throughout!<br /><br />The character development within this book is fantastic! Everyone is just that little bit sassier and hormonal which is very entertaining to read! Romione and Hinny kill me as they're just so "ughhh" and "AHHH" and do things to my heart!!<br /><br />I will never not get emotional when reading or watching this book/film because there's that one death which just simply ruins me!! I will never get over it. Never.<br /><br />One thing that irritates me is the fact that they didn't add all the extra information given in this book about the horcruxes or Voldemort's family etc into the movie! All the little details are so important and really add to the plot! I think that is why these books will always be my favourite, because yes the films are aMAZING but the books just have the little bit more and I will treasure them always...<br /><br />*hugs all my Harry Potter books*</span>  <a data-text-id="8853341375900141169" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter t<a alt="Liam" href="/user/show/34270521-liam"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1415266097p1/34270521.jpg" alt="34270521" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a Oct 14, 2015 04:46PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1301301331' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1301301331, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1529223914" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1529223914" />    <a title="Liza" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/50370792-liza"><img alt="Liza" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468187304p2/50370792.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1529223914?book_show_action=false">Apr 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Liza" class="user" name="Liza" href="/user/show/50370792-liza">Liza</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747581086" href="/book/show/93124.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50370792-liza?shelf=favorites-of-all-time">favorites-of-all-time</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50370792-liza?shelf=finished-series">finished-series</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1529223914" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5056225695790598438">My heart is shattering as I finish this phenomenal book. I was nervous to read it again because as it was my favourite the first time I read the series, I was anxious to see if maybe I would be let down. I completely understand why this was my favourite of the series, and still so far is. I connect the most with the characters and the feelings that they are faced with throughout this book. I am bawling my eyes out as I write this review, and with good reason. The death of Dumbledore is earth</span>  <span id="freeText5056225695790598438" style="display:none">My heart is shattering as I finish this phenomenal book. I was nervous to read it again because as it was my favourite the first time I read the series, I was anxious to see if maybe I would be let down. I completely understand why this was my favourite of the series, and still so far is. I connect the most with the characters and the feelings that they are faced with throughout this book. I am bawling my eyes out as I write this review, and with good reason. The death of Dumbledore is earth shattering, and the grave nature of this situation is delivered perfectly. This book is the darkest, I believe, of the series, as Voldemort's reign begins to take place. The fear, and frustration is eminent throughout every word; however, there is lightheartedness throughout. Delving into Voldemort's past is one of the unique aspects portrayed in this book. It's incredibly fascinating to learn the history of the darkest wizard of all time. There is so much we learn, and so much more we can guess about him, which is the sign of a great writer. J.K. Rowling allows the reader to figure things out on their own and take their own ideas from what she gives. It is impossible to lose interest as you discover more and more of this story. However, the biggest and most prominent reason of why this book speaks to me so deeply is because of Draco Malfoy. This is his story, his book, no matter how many ways one can look at it. He is so complex, very smart, troubled, hurt, confused, misunderstood, but nevertheless, strong in his beliefs. He loves his family and will do anything to protect them. Something that I didn't notice the first time I read the books, which I can see now, is that Draco is skilled at hiding his thoughts from intruders, which means that he is skilled in Occlumency. I adore him and it's crazy how one can learn so many things about their favourite character that they didn't know before just by paying attention to detail. This chills me to my core. I connect with him on so many levels, and although this is odd to many people, because they see him as a villain, he is not, and I truly respect him with everything I have. He knows love, perhaps more than even Harry, as he is willing to do what it takes to protect his family. He deserves a chance, just like so many others, as there are many layers to his character. There is so much that I can say about him, but I will keep it at that. I will always cherish this story with all my might. This book destroys me in the best possible ways.</span>  <a data-text-id="5056225695790598438" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1529223914">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1529223914" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1529223914u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1529223914'><a id="like_count_review_1529223914" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1529223914?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">53 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1529223914" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1529223914" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=53u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1529223914u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1529223914" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1529223914, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">5 comments</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1529223914?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1529223914' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1529223914/comments?reverse=true">View all 5 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_149873738" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Alexandra" href="/user/show/51939827-alexandra"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454442287p1/51939827.jpg" alt="51939827" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/51939827-alexandra">Alexandra</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer11853963397849284922">THIS MADE ME TEAR UP. I love Draco with so much of my heart :'(</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Apr 04, 2016 10:22AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_155777004" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Julia" href="/user/show/54230600-julia"><img onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1529223914, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1622010186" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1622010186" />    <a title="Kate ♡" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15154637-kate"><img alt="Kate ♡" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1450402290p2/15154637.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1622010186?book_show_action=false">Jun 19, 2016</a>      <a title="Kate ♡" class="user" name="Kate ♡" href="/user/show/15154637-kate">Kate ♡</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855706" href="/book/show/22844202-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15154637-kate?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15154637-kate?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15154637-kate?shelf=2016-read">2016-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1622010186" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5500582190762043095"><b>Blog Review: <a target="_blank" href="https://passthefeels.wordpress.com/2016/06/20/harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince-book-review/" rel="nofollow">https://passthefeels.wordpress.com/20...</a></b><br /><br />The Half Blood Prince is yet another incredible installment in the Harry Potter series, but you all knew that already. It may be my favourite so far, in fact yes I believe it is, even though the emotions are so real right now. (I know I said Order was my favourite so far, but this one has overtaken it)<br /><br />I once again, loved every minute of reading this. It was perfect, and also had me lol'ing throughout the whole thing..eh, mostly. <s>not the end.</s><br /><br />Th</span>  <span id="freeText5500582190762043095" style="display:none"><b>Blog Review: <a target="_blank" href="https://passthefeels.wordpress.com/2016/06/20/harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince-book-review/" rel="nofollow">https://passthefeels.wordpress.com/20...</a></b><br /><br />The Half Blood Prince is yet another incredible installment in the Harry Potter series, but you all knew that already. It may be my favourite so far, in fact yes I believe it is, even though the emotions are so real right now. (I know I said Order was my favourite so far, but this one has overtaken it)<br /><br />I once again, loved every minute of reading this. It was perfect, and also had me lol'ing throughout the whole thing..eh, mostly. <s>not the end.﻿</s><br /><br />The school and classes scenes were also amazing, that's weirdly one of the things I love most about these books. Hogwarts just being Hogwarts.<br /><br />If I'm being honest, weirdly again, the Quidditch scenes sometimes ﻿become a little tedious to me sometimes, but I even loved those in this book, they were just so funny. Thankyou Liquid Luck. (﻿﻿that was amazing, hahaha) <br /><br />The Apparition lessons were also a great laugh!<br /><br />J.K. Rowling is brilliant in everything she does; the humour, suspense, mystery... I mean, she even had me guessing and confused even though I've seen the movies a billion times.<br /><br />I loved getting to delve deeper into the motives and life of Voldemort, it was just so interesting to learn about his past, and what makes him such a complex character. As well as seeing the relationships, or lack of, with him and other people.<br /><br />The love aspect of this book, oh the loveeee, was so cute to read about. I mean, between Ron and Hermione, and Harry and Ginny, how could it not be good? You could really see them growing up throughout this novel, which I also enjoyed.<br /><br />The relationship between Harry and Dumbledore grew even more in this book (which made the ending that much harder) I've always loved reading about the dynamic between those two. Such a bond.<br /><br />Malfoy, well he was such an interesting character in this one, right from the moment when he stepped on Harry's nose *wince*, that was intense. It was so cool to be able to read about the mystery behind this guy, and try to figure him out a bit more. Draco has always fascinated me, which is probably half to do with Tom Felton, let's be real.<br /><br />Snape, uhm, I'm still kinda confused where I stand in regards to if I like or don't like him, at the moment it's a bit of both. I guess the Deathly Hallows will help me out, but I do really enjoy reading about Snape, even if he makes some...questionable decisions.<br /><br />Can't forget to mention Slughorn! He was a great addition to the story, I really enjoyed his character, and all that he brought to the novel.<br /><br />Once again, the friendship between Ron/Harry/Hermione warmed my little heart, and also tore at it a bit over the course of the novel *cough* thanks Lavender *cough*. But they never fail to make me smile. I feel like even though there was still a bit of it, the angst levels were much lower in this one, haha.<br /><br />Also, how can you not love Fred and George? I adore those two, they're like me in twin boy form. <br /><br />All-in-All, this was yet another solid addition to this amazing series, and it's just incredible how much more I'm getting out of the books than the movies, I really didn't expect to learn this much. Admittedly, I didn't even truly know what a Horcrux was until this book...oops.<br /><br />Can't believe it's time for the final journey...</span>  <a data-text-id="5500582190762043095" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/47669098?book_show_action=false">Jul 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Manny" class="user" name="Manny" href="/user/show/1713956-manny">Manny</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1713956-manny?shelf=children">children</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1713956-manny?shelf=life-is-proust">life-is-proust</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer47669098" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7440310694267723641">OK. I'm prepared to admit I've read it. As someone once said about Jeffrey Archer novels, it's rather like a packet of stale chips. You keep taking them out and eating them, hoping that the ones at the bottom are little better. But they're not. After a while, you notice that the bag is empty, and you feel rather disgusted with yourself.<br /><br />She claims the whole story was planned from the beginning. Yeah, right. Though, to be fair, she's in good company; Proust said something similar about <i>A La Recher</i></span>  <span id="freeText7440310694267723641" style="display:none">OK. I'm prepared to admit I've read it. As someone once said about Jeffrey Archer novels, it's rather like a packet of stale chips. You keep taking them out and eating them, hoping that the ones at the bottom are little better. But they're not. After a while, you notice that the bag is empty, and you feel rather disgusted with yourself.<br /><br />She claims the whole story was planned from the beginning. Yeah, right. Though, to be fair, she's in good company; Proust said something similar about <i>A La Recherche Du Temps Perdu</i>. He didn't come across as very credible either.<br />_________________________<br /><br />If you still don't believe me about the links between Proust and Potter, look <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/559264105">here</a>. If that doesn't convince you, I give up. There's such a thing as being too sceptical for your own good.<br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="7440310694267723641" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review47669098">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link47669098" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=47669098u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_47669098'><a id="like_count_review_47669098" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/47669098?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">50 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_47669098" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_47669098" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=50u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=47669098u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_47669098" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 47669098, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;);     <span id="reviewTextContainer1526428226" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8108861786259550354">I'M NOT CRYING YOU'RE CRYING </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1526428226">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1526428226" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_5371602" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/5371602" />    <a title="Nightfalltwen" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/326509-nightfalltwen"><img alt="Nightfalltwen" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1269140625p2/326509.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/5371602?book_show_action=false">Jan 17, 2008</a>      <a title="Nightfalltwen" class="user" name="Nightfalltwen" href="/user/show/326509-nightfalltwen">Nightfalltwen</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747581086" href="/book/show/93124.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">no one</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/326509-nightfalltwen?shelf=children-9-12">children-9-12</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer5371602" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13584683729717198341">Well I decided to come back and actually put in a review for this book since all I'd done is give it a star and go on my merry little way.<br /><br />Hated this book. Flat out, this book was the <b>worst</b> of the whole seven-book series.<br /><br />I bought HBP the day it was released and I was very excited to read something new in the series. To my shock, I couldn't believe how bad the story was. Something happened to JKR's editor. I think perhaps foul play was involved because apparently the editor was completely absent.</span>  <span id="freeText13584683729717198341" style="display:none">Well I decided to come back and actually put in a review for this book since all I'd done is give it a star and go on my merry little way.<br /><br />Hated this book. Flat out, this book was the <b>worst</b> of the whole seven-book series.<br /><br />I bought HBP the day it was released and I was very excited to read something new in the series. To my shock, I couldn't believe how bad the story was. Something happened to JKR's editor. I think perhaps foul play was involved because apparently the editor was completely absent. Someone forgot to tell Jo that her book kinda (no actually "really really") sucked.<br /><br />I'm not speaking from a shipping aspect because in the grand scheme of things I don't care who ends up with who. But it was the <i>writing</i> that made baby Jesus cry. The complete and utter abysmal writing. The rate of revelation in this book was appalling. The plot basically sucked and the use of flashback was overdone. The ENTIRE book was a "tell" and not a "show". Cardinal rule of writing. SHOW DON'T TELL.<br /><br />JKR should have gotten some writing lessons before she wrote this one. Someone should have told her on the rough draft read-through that this was bad. Someone should have forced her to stay away from schmoopy romance because GAG.<br /><br />What a complete stinker.<br /><br />***************<br /><br />02/22/12 - four-ish years later and although I still dislike this book, my opinion has mellowed. It's an amazing series, but this is my least favourite. I'm not editing the review as my opinion four years ago is still just as valid.<br /><br />carry on<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="13584683729717198341" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review5371602">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link5371602" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=5371602u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_5371602'><a id="like_count_review_5371602" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/5371602?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">47 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_5371602" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_5371602" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Udhaya s.m" href="/user/show/38083308-udhaya-s-m"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png" alt="U your under an imperius curse</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Oct 18, 2016 11:49AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' class="section">      <div id="review_1792534441" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1792534441" />    <a title="Reynita Maharani ★ The Night Reader ★" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/43850323-reynita-maharani-the-night-reader"><img alt="Reynita Maharani ★ The Night Reader ★" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468676927p2/43850323.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1792534441?book_show_action=false">Nov 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Reynita Maharani ★ The Night Reader ★" class="user" name="Reynita Maharani ★ The Night Reader ★" href="/user/show/43850323-reynita-maharani-the-night-reader">Reynita Maharani ★ The Night Reader ★</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855706" href="/book/show/22844202-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/43850323-reynita-maharani-the-night-reader?shelf=cover-lust">cover-lust</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/43850323-reynita-maharani-the-night-reader?shelf=made-me-cry-like-a-baby">made-me-cry-like-a-baby</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"      <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer1792534441u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1792534441" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18362539776479733089"><s>REVIEW TO COME TOMORROW!</s><br><br><b>4,8 Stars </b><br><br><i> <b>'Dumbledore says people find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right,' said Hermione. 'I heard him telling your mum, Ron.' </b> </i><br><br>I'm really enjoying this series so far but this series gets darker and darker. the first three of this series were so funny and cute even though there were sad scenes on them and the fourth, fifth and sixth books contained so much pain and I even shed more tears for these book than I did for the the first three. I</span>  <span id="freeText18362539776479733089" style="display:none"><s>REVIEW TO COME TOMORROW!</s><br><br><b>4,8 Stars </b><br><br><i>  <b>'Dumbledore says people find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right,' said Hermione. 'I heard him telling your mum, Ron.' </b></i><br><br>I'm really enjoying this series so far but this series gets darker and darker. the first three of this series were so funny and cute even though there were sad scenes on them and the fourth, fifth and sixth books contained so much pain and I even shed more tears for these book than I did for the the first three. I have lost a favorite character that always made me laugh and smile. this character is Sirus Black. I even still can't get over his death. but let's admit it that maybe there's a death of character that we will never get over.<br><br>*takes deep breath* okay let's talk about this book<br><br>・。・゜★・。・。☆・゜・。・゜。・。・゜★・。・。☆・。・゜★・。・。<br><br><u>  <b>PHLEGM</b></u> <br><br>I have never liked Fleur Delacour very much since I first saw her on the book four and then I saw her again on the book four as Bill's girlfriend or Fiancee and I also laughed when Ginny called Fleur Phlegm. I also still don't how Bill fell in love with her but yeah, she is pretty but I thought Bill deserved someone better than her. I like Bill so much. he is so cool with his red long hair. maybe I didn't like Phlegm because I was jealous hahahaha okay it is not maybe, I was jealous. but look at this scene : <br><br><i>''E is always so thoughtful,' purred Fleur adoringly, stroking Bill's nose. Ginny mimed vomiting into her cereal behind Fleur. Harry choked over his cornflakes and Ron thumped him on the back.</i><br><br>ugh ... how could I like her if she acted like that?!?<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1432683085ra/14997917.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br> that was really annoying and Ginny also found it disgusting. Hermione and Ginny didn't even like her. but she changed my mind on the the end of this book because when Bill was attacked by ... that werewolf guy who bit Remus when he was a kid. Bill is no longer as handsome as he used to be but Fleur still loves him. she doesn't care about how he looks and I even thought she would leave him after he was attacked but she didn't and that time I changed my mind about her. She is the right girl for Bill, even though I am a little bit jealous hahaha xD<br><br><u>  <b>Ron and Hermione</b></u><br><br>I ship these two so much and I really really like Ron. Ron and Hermione are always funny. they always bicker about something and I think the first time Ron fell in love with Hermione was on the book four because he was so angry when he knew Hermione went to the Yule Ball with Viktor Krum and in this book Ron hurt me so much. He thought that Hermione kissed Krum and he was so angry and jealous because of this and he kissed Lavender in the common room that was full of people and it also broke Hermione's heart. <br><br><i>Harry looked into the corner she was indicating. There, in full view of the whole room, stood Ron wrapped so closely around Lavender Brown it was hard to tell whose hands were whose.</i><br><br>I remember very clearly that I cried so much till my eyes were red and puffy and that time I kept saying that I hated him and I didn't care about him but saying that seemed useless because I kept crying and crying. That time I wanted to hurt Ron's heart too, I wanted him to feel the exact pain Hermione felt when she saw him kissing Lavender. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1478968368ra/21134967.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><i>'Er - my - nee,' croaked Ron unexpectedly from between them.</i> <br><br>but all my anger was gone when he was poisoned and he said that while he was asleep. I think he was trying to say Hermione, so that meant he dreamt about her and I forgave him that exact time and he also didn't really like Lavender anymore since then. he even pretended to be asleep when Lavender came to visit him in the hospital wing. so that meant he didn't like her anymore and I don't think he actually liked Lavender before he was poisoned. I think he just kissed Lavender because he wanted to make Hermione jealous and feel hurt, which he successfully did. <br><br><u>  <b>Harry And Ginny</b></u><br><br>have you ever thought why Ginny had relationship with quite many guys? wait ... not many guys because she just dated two boys, Dean and Michael. But she always got a boyfriend as soon as she split up with her ex and my thoughs about this is probably right because Ginny said this to Harry on the end of the book <br><br>'I never really gave up on you,' she said. 'Not really. Ialways hoped ... Hermione told me to get on with life, maybe go out with some other people, relax a bit around you, because I never used to be able to talk if you were in the room, remember? And she thought you might take a bit more notice if I was a bit more - myself.' <br><br>I think Ginny always dated a guy as soon as she split up with her ex because she always tried to forget Harry, so maybe if she had a boyfriend, she wouldn't love Harry anymore. But according to what she said she never really gave up on Harry so that means she has always loved him. <br>I was a bit sad when Harry said they can't be together again because Harry was afraid if something would happen to Ginny if they kept seeing each other. he was afraid if Voldemort used Ginny to get him. but I didn't angry with him because this just proved how much Harry loves Ginny and I am sure they will be together again. I hope so ... <br><br><u>  <b>Dumbledore's death</b></u><br><br>I admit that Dumbledore is not one of my top favorite characters in this series but I always found him funny and a bit weird, in a good way, of course. But his death left me in shock because he was actually pleading to Snape but Snape killed him with The Avada Kedavra curse and I thought Snape was on the good side. What will happen now after Dumbledore died?! He is the only one Voldemort is afraid of. <br>I have this feeling that I'll to lose my favorite characters again ... <br><br>thank you so much for reading and liking my review. hope you all have a great weekend, guys! <br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470342060ra/19917253.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="18362539776479733089" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1792534441">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1792534441" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1792534441u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1792534441'><a id="like_count_review_1792534441" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1792534441?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">108 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1792534441" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1792534441" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=108u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1792534441u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1792534441" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1792534441, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1500018592" />    <a title="Christian Guzman" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27310486-christian-guzman"><img alt="Christian Guzman" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477868232p2/27310486.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1500018592?book_show_action=false">Aug 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Christian Guzman" class="user" name="Christian Guzman" href="/user/show/27310486-christian-guzman">Christian Guzman</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1500018592" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9241869132343220562">I didn’t even think twice about the rating I gave this book. As I progress through the series the books exceed my expectations more and more each time. Granted, I have seen all the films prior to reading the series, but I still happen to find the reading experience incredible. This book was filled with so much content about Lord Voldemort, which I happened to find intriguing. I would love to have a Pensieve, that would really come in handy. This novel was necessary as it paves the way for the</span>  <span id="freeText9241869132343220562" style="display:none">I didn’t even think twice about the rating I gave this book. As I progress through the series the books exceed my expectations more and more each time. Granted, I have seen all the films prior to reading the series, but I still happen to find the reading experience incredible. This book was filled with so much content about Lord Voldemort, which I happened to find intriguing. I would love to have a Pensieve, that would really come in handy. This novel was necessary as it paves the way for the huge climax to come. I found the chapter about the multiple Horcruxes fascinating and I actually admired the antagonist (Voldemort) for his genius plotting and dedication to pursue Dark Magic. Even though he is evil, you can’t deny that he is a mastermind. The romance was entertaining and comedic which was a good thing since it put all the seriousness on hold for awhile. It’s incredible seeing how much darker the books and films get since Philosopher’s Stone. I thoroughly enjoyed each minute I spent reading this novel and in no way did I feel as if it was dragged out. Every single chapter was essential to the whole Wizarding World. The characters become much more complex in the Half Blood Prince and J.K. Rowling does an outstanding job in developing them. This was such a detailed novel that I will have to revisit once I start the whole series over. <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="9241869132343220562" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1500018592">  <td      </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1403380188">  <td colspan="2">    <div likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1403380188" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1403380188" ref="like" <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/828646316?book_show_action=false">Jan 31, 2014</a>      <a title="Shelby *trains flying monkeys*" class="user" name="Shelby *trains flying monkeys*" href="/user/show/1053760-shelby-trains-flying-monkeys">Shelby *trains flying monkeys*</a> class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1053760-shelby-trains-flying-monkeys?shelf=read-2014">read-2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" id="reviewTextContainer828646316" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer772979686229131760">These books are breaking me. I admit it. I'm addicted to a children's book series. So sue me. <br>This book isn't as action packed as the other books in the series. It tells more of the back story and it's when I saw Harry truly grow up. My heart is completely broken over this little story. <br>The only fault I could give this book is that it doesn't have as much of my boyfriends George and Fred as the other books. So I'll just add them here. <br><a href="http://imgur.com/dCc0Cth" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1391176737i/8341180._SX540_.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>Really people if you are one of those and yes I was one..tha</span>  <span id="freeText772979686229131760" style="display:none">These books are breaking me. I admit it. I'm addicted to a children's book series. So sue me. <br>This book isn't as action packed as the other books in the series. It tells more of the back story and it's when I saw Harry truly grow up. My heart is completely broken over this little story. <br>The only fault I could give this book is that it doesn't have as much of my boyfriends George and Fred as the other books. So I'll just add them here. <br><a href="http://imgur.com/dCc0Cth" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1391176737i/8341180._SX540_.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>Really people if you are one of those and yes I was one..that had only seen the movies. Run don't walk and get these books.</span>  <a data-text-id="772979686229131760" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review828646316">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link828646316" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=828646316u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_828646316'><a id="like_count_review_828646316" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/828646316?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">44 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_828646316" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_828646316" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=44u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=828646316u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_828646316" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 828646316, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); name="Vaneesha" href="/user/show/23273360-vaneesha">Vaneesha</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23273360-vaneesha?shelf=these-books-have-my-heart">these-books-have-my-heart</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1554020669" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer232297819872523263">You know what is wholly amazing about rereading these books? You pick up on teeny tiny little things, that BRING elements of the whole story together. <br /><br /><blockquote>“The exceptions were two men a little ahead of them, standing just outside the Three Broomsticks. One was very tall and thin; squinting through his rain-washed glasses Harry recognized the barman who worked in the other Hogsmeade pub, the Hog’s Head. As Harry, Ron, and Hermione drew closer, the barman drew his cloak more tightly around his neck an</blockquote></span>  <span id="freeText232297819872523263" style="display:none">You know what is wholly amazing about rereading these books? You pick up on teeny tiny little things, that BRING elements of the whole story together. <br /><br /><blockquote>“The exceptions were two men a little ahead of them, standing just outside the Three Broomsticks. One was very tall and thin; squinting through his rain-washed glasses Harry recognized the barman who worked in the other Hogsmeade pub, the Hog’s Head. As Harry, Ron, and Hermione drew closer, the barman drew his cloak more tightly around his neck and walked away, leaving the shorter man to fumble with something in his arms. They were barely feet from him when Harry realized who the man was.<br />“Mundungus!”</blockquote> <br /><br />THIS SCENE IS MUNDUGUS SELLING SIRIUS' MIRROR TO ABERFORTH HELLO CAN WE APPRECIATE HOW THIS IS TRULY WONDERFUL. <br /><br />Sorry this is a waste of a review, it was too long to post as a general update, and I felt like I had to say it. <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="232297819872523263" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1554020669">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1554020669" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1554020669u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1554020669'><a id="like_count_review_1554020669" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1554020669?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">41 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1554020669" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1554020669" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=41u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1554020669u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1554020669" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1554020669, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_358219219" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/358219219" />    <a title="Amy (shoutame)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10559838-amy-shoutame"><img alt="Amy (shoutame)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477507967p2/10559838.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/358219219?book_show_action=false">Jul 11, 2016</a>      <a title="Amy (shoutame)" class="user" name="Amy (shoutame)" href="/user/show/10559838-amy-shoutame">Amy (shoutame)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747581086" href="/book/show/93124.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10559838-amy-shoutame?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10559838-amy-shoutame?shelf=middle-grade-children">middle-grade-children</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer358219219" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18017884083921024470">Pleasantly surprised by this re-read!<br /><br />I've always considered HP and the Half Blood Prince to be one of my least favourites of the series - but this time I had a completely different experience! I had forgotten how much of Voldemort's past Dumbledore and Harry go into (which is missed out in the film) and found that to be the most engaging part of the story. Brilliant! A real hit of nostalgia!<br /><br />Hermione was also rocking it - she is by far my favourite out of the main three characters. I don't think</span>  <span id="freeText18017884083921024470" style="display:none">Pleasantly surprised by this re-read!<br /><br />I've always considered HP and the Half Blood Prince to be one of my least favourites of the series - but this time I had a completely different experience! I had forgotten how much of Voldemort's past Dumbledore and Harry go into (which is missed out in the film) and found that to be the most engaging part of the story. Brilliant! A real hit of nostalgia!<br /><br />Hermione was also rocking it - she is by far my favourite out of the main three characters. I don't think she gets enough credit for how awesome she is!</span>  <a data-text-id="18017884083921024470" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> id="freeTextContainer3579076096900446233">I can't believe I've only got one book left until the end.. I'm still not over Sirius, and knowing what's ahead just makes me want to put off the end as long as possible..<br /><br />Anyway! For the most part this book wasn't so bad, except for the final few chapters. If Tonks' Patronus had been what I thought it was, I would've cried like a baby. But what it really was is super cute, and I'm so happy for her and her stubborn old man who thinks he can't be loved but is so wrong. Solid 4 stars for this one!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_854591013" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/854591013" />    <a title="Vane J." class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/19590155-vane-j"><img alt="Vane J." src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468102148p2/19590155.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/854591013?book_show_action=false">Feb 01, 2016</a>      <a title="Vane J." class="user" name="Vane J." href="/user/show/19590155-vane-j">Vane J.</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=amazing-characters">amazing-characters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=2014">2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=ate-my-heart">ate-my-heart</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=speshul-snowflake">speshul-snowflake</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=all-the-feels">all-the-feels</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer854591013" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6734300890144824338"><b>If you haven't read this book, don't even attempt to read this review. Honestly, you're just going to regret doing so.</b><br /><br />It's been two years since I read this for the first time. Yes, two years separated tte moment in which I finished book 5 and started book 6. Now, don't ask me why because I don't know.<br /><br />This is a book I particularly like. Well, duh, I like all the HP books, but I mean this is one of my favourite HP books. The reasons are plenty, so I will mention only one: Tom Riddle, or as we knew</span>  <span id="freeText6734300890144824338" style="display:none"><b>If you haven't read this book, don't even attempt to read this review. Honestly, you're just going to regret doing so.</b><br /><br />It's been two years since I read this for the first time. Yes, two years separated tte moment in which I finished book 5 and started book 6. Now, don't ask me why because I don't know.<br /><br />This is a book I particularly like. Well, duh, I like all the HP books, but I mean this is one of my favourite HP books. The reasons are plenty, so I will mention only one: Tom Riddle, or as we knew him from the beginning of this series, Lord Voldemort.<br /><br />From the moment I knew he was Harry's enemy and the one who murdered his parents, a certain curiosity to know why he had done that and to know more about his past was born, yet we didn't fully understand him till this book, in which he was finally given a backstory.<br /><br />And what a backstory it was. One would be even more afraid of him after getting to know bits of his past, and indeed, I was, but I was more intrigued by his character than afraid of him.<br /><br />As for the... <i>death</i> in this book (you know which one I'm talking about)... I don't know if it's the same for you as it is with me, but I found it more shocking than sad. I think that's because of all the things happeing around. There were so many surprises revealed, and the book only got more and more intense.<br /><br />But of course, Dumbledore isn't really gone if there are still loyal people to him, isn't that true? What I sure will miss are his words of wisdom, some of which I carry with me as if they were a treasure, like this one I took from this book:<br /><br /><blockquote>It is the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.</blockquote><br /><br />And with reason I did. I mean, how true is that?<br /><br />Now I will reread the last book. I know what expects me is lots of darkness, death, and even more surprised than the ones revealed previously in the series. I am not prepared, but I will continue as Harry did with the task of the Horcruxes.</span>  <a data-text-id="6734300890144824338" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review854591013">  <td colspan="2">    <div
