comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1290909654" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1290909654" />    <a title="Coos Burton" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21766870-coos-burton"><img alt="Coos Burton" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1434917460p2/21766870.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1290909654?book_show_action=false">Jul 30, 2015</a>      <a title="Coos Burton" class="user" name="Coos Burton" href="/user/show/21766870-coos-burton">Coos Burton</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788478889938" href="/book/show/15872.Harry_Potter_y_el_misterio_del_pr_ncipe">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21766870-coos-burton?shelf=juveniles">juveniles</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21766870-coos-burton?shelf=fantasia">fantasia</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1290909654" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4320221825915719461">Juro que quiero encerrarme en el baño y llorar como por tres meses, dormir una siestita larga y al despertarme leer alguna historia de Winnie the Pooh o algo así. Estoy como traumada por todo lo que estuvo aconteciendo en el libro. No puedo creer que solamente me quede uno para terminar la saga, no entiendo en qué momento pasó y la manera en la que todo se torna tan intenso de un segundo al otro. Las cosas se ponen cada vez más difíciles de afrontar, las situaciones son más dolorosas, más</span>  <span id="freeText4320221825915719461" style="display:none">Juro que quiero encerrarme en el baño y llorar como por tres meses, dormir una siestita larga y al despertarme leer alguna historia de Winnie the Pooh o algo así. Estoy como traumada por todo lo que estuvo aconteciendo en el libro. No puedo creer que solamente me quede uno para terminar la saga, no entiendo en qué momento pasó y la manera en la que todo se torna tan intenso de un segundo al otro. Las cosas se ponen cada vez más difíciles de afrontar, las situaciones son más dolorosas, más tristes y terribles. De momentos paré para darme un recreo y procesar, no pude leerlo de corrido. No estoy segura de querer terminar la saga, siento que voy a tener un vacío increíble en el pecho y que no voy a saber con qué llenarlo, pero me mata la curiosidad. </span>  <a data-text-id="4320221825915719461" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1534872766?book_show_action=false">Feb 20, 2016</a>      <a            <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>, id="reviewTextContainer1534872766" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2168848187923717473"><blockquote> <b>"Killing is not so easy as the innocent believe."</b> </blockquote>I am dead. I can't. . .<br><br>It hurts just as much the second time *cries hysterically*<br>Raise Your Wands for the Greatest wizard known to wizardkind.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1455658549ra/18133084.gif" width="380" height="150" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>I would like to say a few words. And here they are: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!<br>.<br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1525316278">My Review of Harry Potter and Order of the Phoenix</a><br>.<br>.<br>.<br><i> <u>1st read in August 2014</u> </i><br><b>/5 (9.0/10)</b><br><i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i> is an eye-opener. J.K. Rowling lets the reader dive into Voldemort’s past. Harry understands w</span>  <span id="freeText2168848187923717473" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>"Killing is not so easy as the innocent believe."</b></blockquote>I am dead. I can't. . .<br><br>It hurts just as much the second time *cries hysterically*<br>Raise Your Wands for the Greatest wizard known to wizardkind.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1455658549ra/18133084.gif" width="380" height="150" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>I would like to say a few words. And here they are: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!<br>.<br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1525316278">My Review of Harry Potter and Order of the Phoenix</a><br>.<br>.<br>.<br><i>  <u>1st read in August 2014</u></i><br>⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐<b>/5 (9.0/10)</b><br><i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i> is an eye-opener. J.K. Rowling lets the reader dive into Voldemort’s past. Harry understands why Voldemort is who he is and what Voldemort’s principles are. This information is very satisfactory for the reader because by knowing the mystery that is Lord Voldemort, the mystery gets unraveled. <br><br>Harry shows bravery as he has never shown before. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[At the end of the book he chooses to walk into the arena with his head held high, instead of being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death. Harry is not afraid of death. Harry wants Voldemort finished and he wants to be the one who does it. Because one of them must die, one of them is going to end up killing the other. It is the way it is supposed to be.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>Harry’s bravery is the key point of the novel, without it the novel wouldn’t be as exhilarating and exciting. He is a <b>true Gryffindor</b>.<br><br>The novel has a lot of important and surprising turning points. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Finding out that even Dumbledore can make a misjudgment in character is very painful for the whole wizarding world, especially Dumbledore himself. For the mistake resulted in his demise. It comes as a great shock to see him die. The reader might think it was a hoax or a trick, however, when it is eventually realised that it is an ugly truth, all one can do is read on and hope for brighter days. <br><br>I am very sad to see Dumbledore go. Harry now has no mentors to guide him anymore. His parents, his godfather, his headmaster they are all dead. The only people he has left are his friends, Dumbledore’s Army and the Order of the Phoenix. Godspeed, Harry.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>Harry’s loyalty to Dumbledore is awe-inspiring and simply wonderful. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Even after he has been murdered, Harry is loyal to him. Because he knows that Dumbledore will never be truly gone if there are still people who remain loyal to him. This relationship is one which will never be broken, the Dark Lord cannot break the true and faithful hearts of Dumbledore’s Army. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> The relationships between the characters make the novel so worthwhile. They are realistic; there might be disputes but a strong friendship can overcome anything.<br><blockquote> ‘‘Dumbledore says people find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right,’’ - Hermione, p.95</blockquote><blockquote> ‘‘Greatness inspires envy, envy engenders spite, spite spawns lies.’’ - Tom Riddle or as he would love to be called Lord Voldemort, p.415<blockquote><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">["You are protected, in short, by your ability to love!" said Dumbledore loudly. "The only protection that can possibly work against the lure of power like Voldemort’s! In spite of all the temptation you have endured, all the suffering, you remain pure of heart," - Dumbledore, p.477-478  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><blockquote>‘‘age is foolish and forgetful when it underestimates youth’’ - Dumbledore, p.528</blockquote></blockquote></blockquote></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1678651651" />    <a title="Rümeysa Beyde" class="left imgcol" uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1678651651?book_show_action=false">Jun 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Rümeysa Beyde" class="user" name="Rümeysa Beyde" href="/user/show/42175845-r-meysa-beyde">Rümeysa Beyde</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9789750809958" href="/book/show/11128691-harry-potter-ve-melez-prens">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1678651651" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13286649192303844892">Her seferinde daha acı kayıplar yaşanıyor ve ben kitap bittikten sonra resmen dağılıyorum..<br />Yine çok güzeldi, çok severek okudum Melez Prensi de.<br />Sadece ben ikili ilişkilerde nedense boğulacak gibi oluyorum.<br />Ne Ron ve Hermonie'yi ne de Ginny ile Harry'i yakıştıramıyorum bir türlü.<br />Ciddi anlamda yakışmayan iki çift benim için.<br />Hiç bir zamanda sevmeyeceğim, bu kesin yani.<br />Onun dışında yine bir Harry Potter klasiği olarak 5 puanı yapıştırıp, son kitaba başlıyorum :)</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1678651651">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1678651651" title="Flag this review as elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1672093690" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1672093690" />    <a title="sweet jane" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/47263528-sweet-jane"><img alt="sweet jane" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479606071p2/47263528.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1672093690?book_show_action=false">Jun 19, 2016</a>      <a title="sweet jane" class="user" name="sweet jane" href="/user/show/47263528-sweet-jane">sweet jane</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1672093690" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5093580921374749829">*Τώρα που συνήλθα, ας γράψω και μια κριτική*<br /><br />Ίσως ο ημίαιμος Πρίγκιψ να είναι το αγαπημένο μου της σειράς. Πιο σκοτεινό, πιο σπαρακτικό και πιο δυνατό από τα υπόλοιπα, είναι ιδανικό προπύργιο του τέλους μιας μαγειρικής ιστορίας. Δεν θα γράψω κάτι άλλο, ελπίζω μόνο να υπάρχει κάποια εξήγηση γύρω από την πράξη του Σνειπ και ένα χέρι ξύλο για τον αχαρακτηριστο Μαλφοι.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1672093690">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1672093690" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1672093690u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1672093690'><a id="like_count_review_1672093690" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1672093690?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">37 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1672093690" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1672093690" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=37u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=3u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1672093690u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1672093690" href="#" class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1672093690/comments?reverse=true">View all 4 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1672093690' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1672093690, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_60028613" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/60028613" />    <a title="Stuart Douglas" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2429001-stuart-douglas"><img alt="Stuart Douglas" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442500051p2/2429001.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/60028613?book_show_action=false">Jun 17, 2009</a>      <a title="Stuart Douglas" class="user" name="Stuart Douglas" href="/user/show/2429001-stuart-douglas">Stuart Douglas</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer60028613" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6458154318202811783">There is an popular school of thought which says that as soon as an author becomes very successful (in the sense that people might actually buy their books rather than the Guardian Review section stating the author has a narrative voice reminiscent of early Banana Yoshimoto), it is pure intellectual snobbery to claim that he or she is nowhere near as talented as is generally suggested and that other, far more obscure writers are considerably better and more worthy of adulation.<br /><br />This is, of course</span>  <span id="freeText6458154318202811783" style="display:none">There is an popular school of thought which says that as soon as an author becomes very successful (in the sense that people might actually buy their books rather than the Guardian Review section stating the author has a narrative voice reminiscent of early Banana Yoshimoto), it is pure intellectual snobbery to claim that he or she is nowhere near as talented as is generally suggested and that other, far more obscure writers are considerably better and more worthy of adulation.<br /><br />This is, of course, sometimes true, but in general it's just so much hot air, designed to help people avoid any actual thinking about whatever it is that they're reading and to instead continue to believe that high book sales are a sure fire sign of literary quality.<br /><br />In fact, extremely popular authors tend to fall into two categories.<br /><br />First and best, are those writers who are genuinely very good at all levels of what they do (Terry Pratchett for the fantasy/sf crowd; Marian Keyes for the chick-litters and so on) - their writing is solid and well-done, their ideas are witty and original; their characters, within the scope of their chosen genre, rounded and believable. In general, no-one tends to come out and say 'Terry Pratchett is a very poor writer of dialogue', for the simple reason that evidently he isn't.<br /><br />The second group are those authors who really aren't very good at writing, but who can churn out intriguing, if often illogical, plots which hold the attention in much the same way that soap operas do. Jeffrey Archer although apparently a self-serving ex-criminal, is the most obvious example of this second breed (as a teenager I once read Archer's Kane and Abel whilst on a family holiday in a Bu0026amp;B in Fort William and it was perfectly acceptable stuff - certainly much more attention-grabbing than the pile of Zane Grey westerns which were the place's only other literary offerings). People frequently do come out and say things like 'Jeffrey Archer is a very poor writer of dialogue' which is fair enough comment because equally evidently he is exactly that. Which is not to say that he can't tell a story - and that is an accusation not often levelled at him.<br /><br />All of which apparent digression brings me to JK Rowling's penultimate Harry Potter book, "Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince". One in three hardbacks sold in the UK are written by Ms Rowling and, if the papers are to be believed, she made £20 million in the first day of sale of this novel. The series regularly tops reader polls as best children's books ever and Ms Rowling is now the richest woman in Britain (possibly the Universe). She was even, it is rumoured, invited by Russell T Davies to write a story for the rebirth of smsh hit tv series, "Doctor Who". To suggest that Ms Rowling is a less than stellar writer and that - for instance - Ursula K LeGuin's "Earthsea" trilogy is so far above Harry Potter as to be invisible is presumably just the type of intellectual snobbery mentioned above.<br /><br />And yet her new book is - and apologies in advance for the profanity - bloody awful.<br /><br />So awful that it would never have been published had it been written by anyone other than JKR.<br /><br />So awful that even the sycophantic drone at Bloomsbury who...ahem...edits the Rowling manuscripts must have winced.<br /><br />So awful that even the author appears to recognise that she's putting no effort in any more.<br /><br />So awful that everyone involved should be throughly ashamed of themselves.<br /><br />"The Half-Blood Prince" has the story's hero spending much of his time (several hundred pages in fact) doing something which does not need doing, simply in order (a) to have him doing anything at all and (b) waste some time. Dumbledore clearly already knows what has passed between Professor Slughorn and Lord Voldemort, so there is no need for Harry to spend so much time on the subject, other than artificially boosting the pagecount. What makes this particuarly galling is that Rowling knows that what she's doing is rubbish - there's even an explicit reference to the fact that the hero need not have been Harry but could just as easily have been the ineffectual Neville.<br /><br />We should, however, really be glad that Rowling's third-rate rip-off of the Origins of Gollum section of Lord of the Rings (which makes up much of the 'plot' and which is the supposed reason for Harry's enquiries of Slughorn) does take up such an incredibly large part of the book as it at least prevents Rowling shoe-horning in yet more tedious, badly written and shallow bits of teenage love and snogging. This is a book bought mainly by ten to fourteen year olds after all, and if they want romantic teen angst they can presumably go out and buy a Jacqueline Wilson book, rather than this hand-me-down tat.<br /><br />In any case, once the 'Lord Voldemort is Smeagol' and 'Harry meets Ginny' sections are over, there's only about 150 pages left of the 607 page book and we're heading helter-skelter for the Obligatory Dead Hero section of the book - by my count this is the third book in a row where one of the good guys is killed.<br /><br />Surprisingly perhaps, given the emotional impact Rowling managed to put into the death of Sirius Black in the last book, the O.D.H here is just as poorly done as the rest of the book, and although you can easily conjecture ways in which the scene might make more sense and have a greater impact in light of the final book in the series, it's very hard to care enough to try. Which is something of an achievement in itself when you're talking about the death of a key and sympathetic character the reader has been following for five previous books.<br /><br />Which leaves the mystery of just who is the Half-Blood Prince? Who cares? The solution in the end is a Pull-the-Never-Mentioned-Previously-Rabbit-Out-the-Hat affair that you couldn't possibly have guessed given the available evidence, but it doesn't matter because you won't care. The character of the Half-Blood Prince, once revealed, is neither believable, nor interesting, nor even very necessary. It's just more page-filler, saying in fifty thousand words what a good writer could have said in fifteen (not 15 thousand, just 15).<br /><br />'Harry is tempted to cut corners and can be a little bit bad sometimes' - there you go, that's only 14 and I'm not a writer of any description.<br /><br />As someone recently mentioned on one of the mailing lists I frequent, the whole 'Harry thinks Snape is up to no good, Ron and Hermoine aren't sure, and Dumbledore isn't saying' shtick is now well past its sell-by date and increasingly seems to be the only idea Rowling has for a Potter book. Here that idea reaches a potential conclusion and, frankly, I was bored stupid by just how lacklustre, lazy and badly done it all was.</span>  <a data-text-id="6458154318202811783" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review60028613">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link60028613" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=60028613u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_60028613'><a id="like_count_review_60028613" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/60028613?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">19 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_60028613" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_60028613" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=19u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=3u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=60028613u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_60028613" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 60028613, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">8 comments</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/60028613?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=3">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_60028613' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/60028613/comments?reverse=true">View all 8 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_137057184" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Maisie" href="/user/show/38279353-maisie"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_25x33-ccd24e68f4773d33a41ce08c3a34892e.png" alt="U 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/38279353-maisie">Maisie</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer7616306169050186703">I luv harry potter!!! The only bad part about this one is the ending. It wasn't the happy ever after ending lots of storys have.</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jul 18, 2015 03:29PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_144929443" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Skye" href="/user/show/25474807-skye"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1383928833p1/25474807.jpg" alt="25474807" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/25474807-skye">Skye</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer6699583003162579955">Wait. Jaqueline Wilson books are the tat.</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Dec 28, 2015 02:33AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1579669868" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1579669868" />    <a title="Nina Rapsodia" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6561375-nina-rapsodia"><img alt="Nina Rapsodia" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1317851989p2/6561375.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1579669868?book_show_action=false">Jun 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Nina Rapsodia" class="user" name="Nina Rapsodia" href="/user/show/6561375-nina-rapsodia">Nina Rapsodia</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855706" href="/book/show/22844202-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">HP fans y Snape Fans</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Nina by: </span>      Todo el mundo  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6561375-nina-rapsodia?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6561375-nina-rapsodia?shelf=english">english</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6561375-nina-rapsodia?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1579669868" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5168599356243704920">He agregado el libro con ésta portada porque esta sexta parte la he comprado y leído en inglés. <br><b>¿Por qué lo hice si tengo los otros cinco en español? Pues...</b><br><br>a) por el cambio de portadas la edición antigua esta CARÍSIMA<br>b) yo lo quería tapa dura y por eso en español está CARÍSIMO<br>c) en español estaba casi al mismo precio que en inglés <b>#fucklogic</b><br><br>Entonces me decidí por la edición de Bloomsbury <b>y resultó ser muy bonita con tacto de terciopelo y otros detallitos bien interesantes. </b>Ya por eso me decidí</span>  <span id="freeText5168599356243704920" style="display:none">He agregado el libro con ésta portada porque esta sexta parte la he comprado y leído en inglés. <br><b>¿Por qué lo hice si tengo los otros cinco en español? Pues...</b><br><br>a) por el cambio de portadas la edición antigua esta CARÍSIMA<br>b) yo lo quería tapa dura y por eso en español está CARÍSIMO<br>c) en español estaba casi al mismo precio que en inglés <b>#fucklogic</b><br><br>Entonces me decidí por la edición de Bloomsbury <b>y resultó ser muy bonita con tacto de terciopelo y otros detallitos bien interesantes. </b>Ya por eso me decidí a hacerme la colección en esta edición en un futuro próximo. Pero ya acabamos el parloteo y empecemos la reseña propiamente.<br><br><b>RESEÑA<br>o mejor dicho, porque este libro es tan bueno</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1465161348ra/19321546.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Vamos a ver, la experiencia de leer Harry Potter <b>en inglés es MUY diferente y especial </b>porque no sólo podemos ver como hablan de parecido los hermanos Weasley, como habla de distinto Hagrid y además, se pueden apreciar todos los nombres que te acostumbras a escuchar en español y en inglés son tan distintos. Que ha sido fantástico.<br><br>Pero como tantos de ustedes saben de qué va el libro y qué pasa hagamos un resumen hiper pequeño:<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1465161410i/19321548.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Harry ya es un adolescente de dieciséis años y va en su sexto año a Hogwarts. Pero esta vez las circunstancias son muy distintas. El Señor oscuro ya ha salido de las sombras y todos saben que ha vuelto. Entonces todos tienen miedo y están usando extra protección para sus casas y sus familias. Pero Harry tiene el año en el que debe conocer mejor a su enemigo y Dumbledore le ayudará a desvelar un poco el misterio del pasado de Voldemort.<br><br>Tengo una cosa y es que la sexta película es la que menos he visto por eso leer el libro me trajo muchas cosas buenas para refrescarme la memoria. <b>Suena raro siendo éste el material original.</b> Pero bueno, que el asunto es que este libro es la novela donde más profundización se da a muchas decisiones de los personajes y claro está, la razón por la que el señor tenebroso es quien es. <b>En una parte se alterna el pasado con el presente en la que Harry va entendiendo la forma de proceder del mayor enemigo del mundo mágico y con los pasos de Dumbledore van ententiendo qué deben hacer contra él.</b><br><br>Pero la novela siempre alterna los momentos más oscuros <b>con otras cosas de la vida como la rutina estudiantil, los peligros que existen fuera del colegio y la vida de los adolescentes propia de la edad. </b> Harry, Ron y Hermione están en plenas hormonas y pelean bastante, además de que surgen amoríos y demás situaciones muy divertidas como incómodas. La llegada del profesor Horace Slughorn para ser el nuevo maestro de Pociones y la llegada de cierto libro de pociones a Manos de Harry, <b>lleno de garabatos de un tal Príncipe Mestizo le da un toque a todo el asunto porque su presencia será de vital importancia. </b><br><br><b>Reseña completa:</b> <a target="_blank" href="http://rapsodia-literaria.blogspot.com.co/2016/06/harry-potter-and-half-blood-prince-de.html" rel="nofollow">http://rapsodia-literaria.blogspot.co...</a></span>  <a data-text-id="5168599356243704920" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr There's little action compared with previous books but the flashbacks and the intensity of the ending always made me feel like this is the saddest of all seven. <br><br>Moments like this:<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1394315500ra/8835372.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>that really creep me out, even if Draco was a very nasty little thing. <br><br>I'm also so impressed with Harry. The character development is extraordinary. I think after <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix__Harry_Potter___5_" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (Harry Potter, #5) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a>'s angry and depressed Harry, I love this Harry so much better.<br><br><b>  <i>"I am a Dumbledore's man through and through."</i></b><br><br>Exploring Voldemort's memories and origin is such a great insight in order to understand how Tom Riddle became Lord Voldemort. It's kinda difficult for for to see Tom as this evil creature he becomes in the end, like I forget they are the same person sometimes.<br><br>I don't think this is my favorite, but it surely is one of the best of the series.</span>  <a data-text-id="8860678720455606429" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; I had braced myself but I wasn't really expecting the bottom to drop out from under us until the 7th book. Arghhhhh.<br /><br />There's more of the same here ie. heartbreak and betrayal but this may just be the most terrifying and complex of the series. In fact, there is so much plot advancement that it makes me want to crawl into a ball (while I wish for simpler times when Harry was just an orphan who finds out he's a wizard and there was still lots of fun to b</span>  <span id="freeText9903738504869487721" style="display:none">I have three words for you: oh - holy - hell. I had braced myself but I wasn't really expecting the bottom to drop out from under us until the 7th book. Arghhhhh.<br /><br />There's more of the same here ie. heartbreak and betrayal but this may just be the most terrifying and complex of the series. In fact, there is so much plot advancement that it makes me want to crawl into a ball (while I wish for simpler times when Harry was just an orphan who finds out he's a wizard and there was still lots of fun to be had. Remember? Evil was evil and good was good. Sigh.)<br /><br />And then there was Snape. Oh Snape, dark and brilliant... and despite all the mounting evidence to the contrary, I'm just not ready to fully give up on you yet. My brain is surely still in shock, just trying to make sense of it... somehow. But ya know this completely illogical hope of mine? Yeah, it's hanging by a thread... one very weak, quickly unraveling thread.<br /><br />So far I'm not in love with the set up for the final book but then what choice do we have? There are insurmountable challenges ahead... death, destruction, mayhem. Eek. Ok, let's do this thing...</span>  <a data-text-id="9903738504869487721" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review6027075">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link6027075" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=6027075u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_6027075'><a id="like_count_review_6027075" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/6027075?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">20 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_6027075" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_6027075" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=20u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=3u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=6027075u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_6027075" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 6027075, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_582892724" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/582892724" />    <a title="Angela" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4255477-angela"><img alt="Angela" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1398251387p2/4255477.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/582892724?book_show_action=false">Mar 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Angela" class="user" name="Angela" href="/user/show/4255477-angela">Angela</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/13563646-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=kindle">kindle</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2014-read">2014-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2016-read">2016-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer582892724" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1746867967967800534">You know, Harry's not always right, but I do wish that sometimes people would just give what he has to say a bit more credence. He does actually look past his own biases quite often before making pronouncements. He understands the consequences of falsely accusing someone quite well.<br /><br />I love this book for many reasons, partly because we get to spend so much time with Dumbledore - I know it doesn't seem like a lot when you actually count out the time we're with him, but it feels like a lot while exp</span>  <span id="freeText1746867967967800534" style="display:none">You know, Harry's not always right, but I do wish that sometimes people would just give what he has to say a bit more credence. He does actually look past his own biases quite often before making pronouncements. He understands the consequences of falsely accusing someone quite well.<br /><br />I love this book for many reasons, partly because we get to spend so much time with Dumbledore - I know it doesn't seem like a lot when you actually count out the time we're with him, but it feels like a lot while experiencing the book. Another, large, part of the reason I love it so much is that you can see just how much Harry has matured and grown. <br /><br />I won't say too much here, because I don't want to spoil anything (for all two of you that haven't read the series yet). I remember the HUGE disappointment I felt for people that were spoiled about the BIG end before they'd been able to read it. I remember waiting in line to buy this book, and starting to read it on the way home (I wasn't driving - don't worry). I remember the tenterhooks that I was on while I read, trying to imagine how things were going to play out.<br /><br />And I have to say, this is probably one of the top two most satisfying books to re-read in this series (the other being Prisoner of Azkaban). There's so much nuance that you can catch after having finished the series. PoA shows you things almost immediately; HBP needs the last book to fully appreciate all the groundwork and clues and story laid down.<br /><br />Immediately upon finishing this book I thought: This is my favorite! I love it so much! But then I realized that I've said that about nearly every book in this series. So. There you have it. Another fabulous installment in the Harry Potter series. And now...the finale. The one that I anticipated like no other and dreaded just as much.<br /><br />Deathly Hallows here I come.</span>  <a data-text-id="1746867967967800534" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review582892724">  <td class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9789544469306" href="/book/show/7377871">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1431340430" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13947223140830974421">Хари Потър мами в ученето, но печели в любовта: <a target="_blank" href="http://knigolandia.info/book-review/harry-potter-i-nechistokruvniya-princ/" rel="nofollow">http://knigolandia.info/book-review/h...</a><br /><br />Като цяло “Хари Потър и Нечистокръвния принц” също е с доста поразтеглено действие като предния том, но ми харесваше какво се случва, не знам къде се крие тайната и разликата между двете книги, но просто се четеше леко и с наслада, постоянно по нещо дребно се случваше и поддържаше напрежението. Определено този том е подготвителен за grande finale и в него е отредено Потър окончателно да бъде изваден от релси,</span>  <span id="freeText13947223140830974421" style="display:none">Хари Потър мами в ученето, но печели в любовта: <a target="_blank" href="http://knigolandia.info/book-review/harry-potter-i-nechistokruvniya-princ/" rel="nofollow">http://knigolandia.info/book-review/h...</a><br /><br />Като цяло “Хари Потър и Нечистокръвния принц” също е с доста поразтеглено действие като предния том, но ми харесваше какво се случва, не знам къде се крие тайната и разликата между двете книги, но просто се четеше леко и с наслада, постоянно по нещо дребно се случваше и поддържаше напрежението. Определено този том е подготвителен за grande finale и в него е отредено Потър окончателно да бъде изваден от релси, извън зоната си на комфорт, да му бъде отнета каквато и да е възможност да не поеме към финалния сблъсък с Волдемор. И сега остава да видя как ще стане тая работа точно.<br /><br />Егмонт България<br /><a target="_blank" href="http://knigolandia.info/book-review/harry-potter-i-nechistokruvniya-princ/" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1271370412" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1271370412" />    <a title="Steve" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2314568-steve"><img alt="Steve" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463021489p2/2314568.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1271370412?book_show_action=false">May 11, 2015</a>      <a title="Steve" class="user" name="Steve" href="/user/show/2314568-steve">Steve</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/16356129-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=ya">ya</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1271370412" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17636032630357465547">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is the most complex, multi-layered, and emotional book of series so far. After a slow start, the momentum picks up like a snow ball rolling down an icy cliff until a the breathtaking, unnerving, and unflinching climax. Rowling stays true to form the entire ride. The characters become deeper and more thoughtful in a well-written book of imagination and originality. Rowling doesn't dumb down her characters; she illustrates them as they should be... as real,</span>  <span id="freeText17636032630357465547" style="display:none">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is the most complex, multi-layered, and emotional book of series so far. After a slow start, the momentum picks up like a snow ball rolling down an icy cliff until a the breathtaking, unnerving, and unflinching climax. Rowling stays true to form the entire ride. The characters become deeper and more thoughtful in a well-written book of imagination and originality. Rowling doesn't dumb down her characters; she illustrates them as they should be... as real, complicated teenagers. As such, Harry, Ron, and Hermione (and to some extent, Ginny) have matured considerably since the previous book. They are now older teenagers and are developing strong ties to the opposite sex.<br /><br />Ultimately, the central theme is discovering who Lord Voldemort really is. Much is learned about Voldemort in this novel, a brilliant setup for what will most likely be a spectacular showdown in the final novel . There are other subplots galore, of course, that I’m guessing will tie up the various loose ends in book 7.<br /><br />This book is not rushed; it has no rushed ending. It is filled with insight and emotion. It is a much darker and much more “adult” book, especially the last quarter of the book. Obviously, the novel is a setup for the final showdown. It leaves the reader hanging off of a cliff, but it is written with beauty and flawless description. Rowling gives her audience a realistic portrait of human souls in a fantasy world. I felt more character depth in this novel than any of the others.<br /><br />Besides all the beauty and imagination, this book is relentless, transcending the level mere entertainment. It gives depth and wonder. It expands on the characters, not just the events. It has the usual mind-boggling wonders and creative new inventions. The ending was incredibly moving and sets up questions in the reader's mind as to what’s coming in the final volume.<br /><br />It could be argued that “Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince” is the best of the series so far. Given what has come before, that is saying a lot. Harry is growing up before the reader’s eyes, and one can't help rooting for him to prevail. Regardless of what the future holds, the present holds many rich wonders for readers and the hints of the possibilities to come are tantalizing.</span>  <a data-text-id="17636032630357465547" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1271370412">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1271370412" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1271370412u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1271370412'><a id="like_count_review_1271370412" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1271370412?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">17 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1271370412" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1271370412" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=17u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=3u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1271370412u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1271370412" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1271370412, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">7 comments</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1271370412?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=3">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1271370412' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1271370412/comments?reverse=true">View all 7 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_119145892" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Ashley *Hufflepuff Kitten*" href="/user/show/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471208025p1/29787548.jpg" alt="29787548" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten">Ashley *Hufflepuff Kitten*</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer6351362853754850748">Fantastic review Steve! I hope you're loving Deathly Hallows just as much :)</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      May 13, 2015 06:16AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_119160942" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Dustin" href="/user/show/4268487-dustin"><img May 13, 2015 12:34PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1271370412' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_36731237" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/36731237" />    <a title="Will Byrnes" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1526851-will-byrnes"><img alt="Will Byrnes" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1291462190p2/1526851.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/36731237?book_show_action=false">Jul 16, 2009</a>      <a title="Will Byrnes" class="user" name="Will Byrnes" href="/user/show/1526851-will-byrnes">Will Byrnes</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer36731237" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5759486517151291522">I re-read this in anticipation of seeing the film.<br /><br />What can one say. The saga continues. The best aspect of this for me was the characterization of adolescence. I thought she hit a home run with that. Harry is a flawed hero, more than willing to take a short cut to help his grades, even if that means possible corruption. Ron and Hermione play sexual tennis, both wanting the other but neither able to take a direct approach. Harry is interested in Ginny, but takes a very Peter Parker role at the en</span>  <span id="freeText5759486517151291522" style="display:none">I re-read this in anticipation of seeing the film.<br /><br />What can one say. The saga continues. The best aspect of this for me was the characterization of adolescence. I thought she hit a home run with that. Harry is a flawed hero, more than willing to take a short cut to help his grades, even if that means possible corruption. Ron and Hermione play sexual tennis, both wanting the other but neither able to take a direct approach. Harry is interested in Ginny, but takes a very Peter Parker role at the end in rejecting her for her own safety. The identity of the Half-blood prince is revealed at the end and provides a nifty twist. We are also strung along with the question of whether Snape is or isn’t working for the dark side. <br /><br />Is Dumbledore really gone, or has he found a way to preserve a portion of his soul by arranging his own death? There are talismans that are left unanalyzed that will no doubt provide the roots of the final book. It was a very enjoyable ride in the classic series of our time.<br /><br />A small pet peeve is that I think poor Ron deserves better than to be the ever-present comic relief.</span>  <a data-text-id="5759486517151291522" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review36731237">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link36731237" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_697304164" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/697304164" />    <a title="Shandra" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/23160533-shandra"><img alt="Shandra" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1431557913p2/23160533.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/697304164?book_show_action=false">Jul 07, 2015</a>      <a title="Shandra" class="user" name="Shandra" href="/user/show/23160533-shandra">Shandra</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer697304164" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5749658360881472635"><b>Initial thoughts:</b> My anger at what happened towards the end of this book is overshadowing how I feel about it as a whole. Review to come when the rage dies down. <br><br><b>Review:<br><br>Actual rating: 4 Never-Have-I-Ever-Felt-So-Much-Rage stars. No spoilers. </b><br><br>I'm not even going to attempt to write a full review for this book. Why? There's a bazillion other detailed reviews out there. Instead, I will share with those of you that are reading this my feelings on this book. <br><br>I reached a poignant section towards the en</span>  <span id="freeText5749658360881472635" style="display:none"><b>Initial thoughts:</b> My anger at what happened towards the end of this book is overshadowing how I feel about it as a whole. Review to come when the rage dies down. <br><br><b>Review:<br><br>Actual rating: 4 Never-Have-I-Ever-Felt-So-Much-Rage stars. No spoilers. </b><br><br>I'm not even going to attempt to write a full review for this book. Why? There's a bazillion other detailed reviews out there. Instead, I will share with those of you that are reading this my feelings on this book. <br><br>I reached a poignant section towards the end, and found myself yelling at the book. <br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/Raging" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1436322763ra/15447054.gif" alt="Raging photo: what? WHAT? WhatWHAT.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>I was on the other side of the country at the time I read this. I'd just gone to Harry Potter World at Universal Studios Orlando with my fellow book nerd friend Annette and our husbands. So I got the itch to read this one. I borrowed her hardback copy of it. If it hadn't been for that, I would've taken my rage out on the book. <br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/Raging" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1436322763ra/15447055.gif" alt="Raging photo: suck it suckit.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>I sent some very hateful and rage-filled messages to my friend Annette. Not directed at her, of course. I needed to vent. I hated Rowling for what she did. <br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/Raging" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1436322763ra/15447056.gif" alt="Raging photo: i literally could not hate you more iliterallycouldnothateyoumore.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>I said I wasn't even going to finish this book after that part. I walked away from it. I wouldn't have finished it or even completed the series if Annette hadn't twisted my arm and convinced me to. <br><br>I calmed down. I finished the book. I finished the series. And I haven't written Rowling off my list of authors I will read. However, I don't agree with what she did. Annette tells me it's necessary for the story. But that doesn't mean I have to like it. The rest of the book was sooooo good, I can't avoid giving it less than 4 stars. My rage almost put this on the DNF shelf with 1 star though...</span>  <a data-text-id="5749658360881472635" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> Ú¯Ø±ÙââÙØ§Û Ø¯Ø§Ø³ØªØ§Ù ÙÙÙâØ§ÙØ¹Ø§Ø¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯Ø Ø°ÙÙ Ø¢Ø¯Ù Ø±Ù Ø®ÙØ¨ Ø¨Ù Ø¨Ø§Ø²Û ÙÛâÚ¯Ø±ÙØª Ù Ø¹ÙØ§ÙÙ Ø¨Ø± Ø§ÛÙâÙØ§ Ø§Ø­Ø³Ø§Ø³Ø§Øª Ø¢Ø¯ÙâÙØ§ Ø±Ù Ø®ÛÙÛ Ø®ÙØ¨ ØªÙØµÛÙ Ú©Ø±Ø¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯. Ø´Ø§ÛØ¯ Ø¯ÙÛÙ Ø§ÛÙÚ©Ù Ø¬ÙØ¯ Ø´Ø´Ù Ø±Ù Ø§ÛÙÙØ¯Ø± Ø¨ÛØ´ØªØ± Ø§Ø² Ø¨ÙÛÙ Ú©ØªØ§Ø¨Ø§ Ø¯ÙØ³Øª Ø¯Ø§Ø±ÙØ Ù¾Ø± Ø±ÙÚ¯ Ø¨ÙØ¯Ù Ø¯Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¯ÙØ± Ø¨ÙØ¯. Ø¯Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¯ÙØ± ÛÚ©Û Ø§Ø² Ø¨ÙØªØ±ÛÙ Ø´Ø®ØµÛØªâÙØ§Û Ø¯Ø§Ø³ØªØ§ÙÛ Ø¨ÙØ¯ Ú©Ù Ø´ÙØ§Ø®ØªÙ Ù Ø±ÙÙÛÙÚ¯ Ø±Ù Ø¨Ù Ø®Ø§Ø·Ø± ØªÙØ§Ø´Û Ú©Ù Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ø² Ø§ØªÙØ§Ù ÙØ¬ÙÙØ¹Ù Ø¨Ø±Ø§Û ØªØ®Ø±ÛØ¨ ÙØ¬ÙÙ Ø¯Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¯ÙØ± Ú©Ø±Ø¯ ÙÛÚâÙÙØª ÙÙÛâØ¨Ø®Ø´Ù.<br /><br />ÙÙØªÛ Ú©ØªØ§Ø¨ ÙÛØ®ÙÙÙ Ø¬Ø§ÙØ§ÛÛ Ú©Ù Ú©ØªØ§Ø¨ Ø¯Ø§Ø±Ù Ø¨Ù Ø®ÙØ§ÙÙØ¯Ù Ø§Ø·ÙØ§Ø¹Ø§Øª Ø²ÛØ§Ø¯Û ÙÛØ¯Ù Ø±Ù Ø®ÛÙÛ Ø¯ÙØ³Øª Ø¯Ø§Ø±Ù. Ø§ÛÙØ¬Ø§ Ø§ÛÙ Ø§ØªÙØ§Ù ØªÙÛ Ø¯ÛØ¯Ø§Ø±ÙØ§Û ÙØ±Û Ù Ø¯Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¯ÙØ± Ù Ú¯Ø±Ø¯Ø´Ø´ÙÙ ØªÙÛ ÙØ¯Ø­ Ø§ÙØ¯ÛØ´Ù Ø§ÙØªØ§Ø¯. ÛÙ Ø¬ÙØ±Û Ø¨Ù Ø³Ø±Ø¹Øª Ø§ÛÙ Ø¨Ø®Ø´âÙØ§ Ø±Ù ÙÛØ®ÙÙØ¯Ù ØªØ§ Ø³Ø±ÛØ¹âØªØ± Ø§Ø·ÙØ§Ø¹Ø§Øª Ø±Ù Ø¨Ø¨ÙØ¹Ù Ú©Ù ÙØ¬Ø¨ÙØ± ÙÛØ´Ø¯Ù Ø¨Ø±Ú¯Ø±Ø¯Ù Ù Ø¯ÙØ¨Ø§Ø±Ù Ø¨Ø¹Ø¶Û ØªÛÚ©ÙâÙØ§ Ø±Ù Ø¨Ø®ÙÙÙ! Ø¯Ø±Ø³Øª ÙØ«Ù ÙÙØªÛ Ú©Ù Ø§ÙÙÙØ¯Ø± Ú¯Ø´ÙÙâØ§Û Ú©Ù ÙÙÙÙâÙØ§Û ØºØ°Ø§ Ø±Ù ØªÙØ¯ ØªÙØ¯ ÙØ±Ù ÙÛØ¯Û Ù ÛÙÙ Ú¯ÙÙØª Ø¯Ø±Ø¯ ÙÛÚ¯ÛØ±Ù!<br /><br />ÙØµÙâÙØ§Û Ø¢Ø®Ø± Ú©ØªØ§Ø¨ Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ù ÙØ§ÙØ¹Ø§ ØºÙÙØ§Ú© Ø¨ÙØ¯. ÛØ§Ø¯ÙÙ Ø­ØªÛ Ø¯ÙØ± Ø§ÙÙ ÙÙÛØªÙÙØ³ØªÙ Ø§ÙÙ ÙØ§ÙØ¹Ù Ø±Ù Ø¨Ø§ÙØ± Ú©ÙÙ Ù Ø§ÙØªØ¸Ø§Ø± Ø¯Ø§Ø´ØªÙ ØªÙÛ Ø¬ÙØ¯ ÙÙØª ÙØ¹ÙÙÙ Ø¨Ø´Ù Ú©Ù Ø­ÙÙâØ§Û Ø¯Ø± Ú©Ø§Ø± Ø¨ÙØ¯Ù Ù Ø§ÙÙ Ø³ÙÙØ· Ø§Ø² Ø¨Ø±Ø¬ ÙØ¬ÙÙ ÙÛÚâÙÙØª Ø§ØªÙØ§Ù ÙÛÙØªØ§Ø¯Ù. Ø´Ø§ÛØ¯ Ø´Ø§ÙØ²Ø§Ø¯Ù Ø¯ÙØ±Ú¯Ù ÛÚ©Û Ø§Ø² ØªØ§Ø«ÛØ±Ú¯Ø°Ø§Ø±ØªØ±ÛÙ Ú©ØªØ§Ø¨âÙØ§ÛÛ Ø¨ÙØ¯ Ú©Ù Ø®ÙÙØ¯ÙâØ§Ù. Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ø² ØªÙÙÙ Ú©Ø±Ø¯ÙØ´ Ø­Ø¯ÙØ¯ ÛÚ© ÙÙØªÙ Ø­Ø§ÙÙ Ú¯Ø±ÙØªÙ Ø¨ÙØ¯ Ù Ø¯Ø§Ø´ØªÙ Ø¨Ù Ø²ÙØ¯Ú¯Û Ù ÙØ±Ú¯ Ù ÙØ³ÛØ±Û Ú©Ù ØªÙÛ ÙØ§ØµÙÙ Ú©ÙØªØ§Ù Ø¨ÛÙ ØªÙÙØ¯ Ù ÙØ±Ú¯ Ø·Û ÙÛâÚ©ÙÛÙ ÙÚ©Ø± ÙÛâÚ©Ø±Ø¯Ù. ÙÙÛÙ Ø§ÙØ§Ù Ø¯ÙØ³Øª Ø¯Ø§Ø±Ù Ø¨Ø±Ø§Û Ø§ÙÙ ÙØµÙââÙØ§Û Ù¾Ø§ÛØ§ÙÛ Ú¯Ø±ÛÙ Ú©ÙÙ...<br /><br />ÙØ±Û Ù¾Ø§ØªØ± Ù Ø´Ø§ÙØ²Ø§Ø¯Ù Ø¯ÙØ±Ú¯Ù ÛÚ© Ú©ØªØ§Ø¨ Ø¬Ø°Ø§Ø¨Ø Ù¾Ø± Ú©Ø´Ø´Ø Ø®ÙØ¯ÙâØ¯Ø§Ø±Ø ØºÙÙØ§Ú© Ù Ø¯Ø± Ú©Ù ØªØ±Ú©ÛØ¨Û Ø§Ø² Ø¹Ø´Ù Ù ØªÙÙØ± Ø¨ÙØ¯. ÙÙÛÙ<br /><br />" Ø³Ø§ÙØªÙØ±ÙØ§ ÙÛØ² Ø¨Ø±Ø§Û Ø§Ø¯Ø§Û Ø§Ø­ØªØ±Ø§Ù Ø¢ÙØ¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯ÙØ¯. Ø¢ÙâÙØ§ ÙØ§Ø±Ø¯ ÙØ¶Ø§Û Ø¨Ø§Ø² ÙØ´Ø¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯ÙØ¯ Ø§ÙØ§ ÙØ±Û Ø¢ÙâÙØ§ Ø±Ø§ ÙÛâØ¯ÛØ¯Ø Ø³Ø§Ú©Øª Ù Ø¨Û Ø­Ø±Ú©ØªØ ÙÛÙÙ Ù¾ÙÙØ§Ù Ø¯Ø± Ø³Ø§ÛÙââÙØ§ Ø§ÛØ³ØªØ§Ø¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯ÙØ¯ Ù Ú©ÙØ§ÙâÙØ§ÛØ´Ø§Ù Ø§Ø² Ø´Ø§ÙÙ Ø¢ÙÛØ²Ø§Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯. ÙØ±Û ÛØ§Ø¯ Ø§ÙÙÛÙ Ø³ÙØ± Ú©Ø§Ø¨ÙØ³ ÙØ§ÙÙØ¯Ø´ Ø¨Ù Ø¯Ø§Ø®Ù Ø¬ÙÚ¯Ù Ø§ÙØªØ§Ø¯Ø Ø¨Ø±Ø§Û Ø§ÙÙÛÙ Ø¨Ø§Ø± Ø¨Ø§ ÚÛØ²Û Ø±Ù Ø¨Ù Ø±Ù Ø´Ø¯ Ú©Ù Ø¯Ø± Ø¢Ù Ø²ÙØ§ÙØ ÙÙØ¯ÙÙØ±Øª Ø¨ÙØ¯ Ù Ø¨Ù ÛØ§Ø¯ Ø¢ÙØ±Ø¯ Ú©Ù ÚÚ¯ÙÙÙ Ø¯Ø± Ø¨Ø±Ø§Ø¨Ø± Ø§Ù Ø§ÛØ³ØªØ§Ø¯Ú¯Û Ú©Ø±Ø¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯ Ù ÚÚ¯ÙÙÙ Ø¨Ø§ Ø¯Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¯ÙØ± Ø¯Ø±Ø¨Ø§Ø±Ù Ø¬ÙÚ¯ ÙØ­Ú©ÙÙ Ø¨Ù Ø´Ú©Ø³Øª Ø§ÙØ¯Ú©Û Ù¾Ø³ Ø§Ø² Ø¢ÙØ Ú¯ÙØª Ù Ú¯Ù Ú©Ø±Ø¯Ù Ø¨ÙØ¯. Ø¯Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¯ÙØ± ÙÛâÚ¯ÙØª Ø¨Ø³ÛØ§Ø± ÙÙÙ Ø§Ø³Øª Ú©Ù Ú©Ø³Û Ø¨Ø¬ÙÚ¯Ø¯Ø Ù Ø¯ÙØ¨Ø§Ø±Ù Ø¨Ø¬ÙÚ¯Ø¯ Ù Ø¨Ù Ø¬ÙÚ¯ÛØ¯Ù Ø§Ø¯Ø§ÙÙ Ø¨Ø¯ÙØ¯ Ø²ÛØ±Ø§ ÙÙØ· Ø¯Ø± Ø§ÛÙ ØµÙØ±Øª Ø§Ø³Øª Ú©Ù ÙÛâØªÙØ§ÙØ¯ Ù¾ÙÛØ¯Û Ø±Ø§ Ø¯ÙØ± ÙÚ¯Ù Ø¯Ø§Ø¯Ø Ú¯Ù Ø§ÛÙÚ©Ù ÙÛÚÚ¯Ø§Ù Ø¨Ù Ú©ÙÛ Ø±ÛØ´ÙâÚ©Ù ÙÙÛâØ´ÙØ¯... "<br /><br />Ø³ÙÙ ÙØ±ÙØ±Ø¯ÛÙ 1395<br />--------<br />ÙÙØ´ØªÙ Ø´Ø¯Ù Ø¨Ø³ÛØ§Ø± Ù¾ÛØ´âØªØ±:<br /><br />ÙØ§Û Ø§ÛÙ Ú©ØªØ§Ø¨ ÙØ±Û Ù¾Ø§ØªØ± Ø®ÛÙÛ Ø®ÙØ¨ Ø¨ÙØ¯ !  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_103779" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/103779" />    <a title="Jake" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/12045-jake"><img alt="Jake" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1174509843p2/12045.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/103779?book_show_action=false">Jul 27, 2007</a>      <a title="Jake" class="user" name="Jake" href="/user/show/12045-jake">Jake</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer103779" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7600113051563874034">The first time I read it at camp, I was bored and taken aback by what I saw as worthless and superfluous backstory. I openly mocked the counselors and campers who cried as a result of the famous murder.<br /><br />I reread it this past week in anticipation of the final chapter and am embarassed to say that I came close to spilling tears on the Metro as I finished it. This book is better than I remembered, and the history IS significant. It sets up the seventh perfectly and escalates the war and plot in ways</span>  <span id="freeText7600113051563874034" style="display:none">The first time I read it at camp, I was bored and taken aback by what I saw as worthless and superfluous backstory. I openly mocked the counselors and campers who cried as a result of the famous murder.<br /><br />I reread it this past week in anticipation of the final chapter and am embarassed to say that I came close to spilling tears on the Metro as I finished it. This book is better than I remembered, and the history IS significant. It sets up the seventh perfectly and escalates the war and plot in ways no one could have guessed.<br /><br />The character development is astounding, and truly makes you take notice of how little you knew until this book. Dumbledore and Voldemort are fleshed out to an extent we hadn't seen before, and if possible, makes Dumbledore even more likable. He represents all that is good and loving and warm in the world, and Tom Riddle is his total opposite in every way. Voldemort is pure evil, but he never crosses the line of becoming a caricature of the villain. His torture of small children, his charm of the teachers, his murder of his own family, his desperation to achieve immortality at the expense of innocent lives, it almost overwhelms the reader to see such a character thrive in the wizarding world. Furthermore, Slughorn was one of the best additions to the books and his likable smarm added humor and warmth to an occasionally chilling book. He wasn't loathsome like Umbridge, annoying like Lockhart, conflicted like Lupin. He knew exactly what he wanted and had no qualms using the kids to do it, and for some reason, it was highly enjoyable to watch his antics unfold.<br /><br />And, of course, more Ginny means more joy. She's by far one of the best characters in the entire series. Ginny represents strength and bravery arguably more than any other character in the series, and constantly looks after those that are bullied and belittled. In short, she's perfect.</span>  <a data-text-id="7600113051563874034" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review103779">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" id="review_4709501" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/4709501" />    <a title="Mark" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/273793-mark"><img alt="Mark" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1187069328p2/273793.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/4709501?book_show_action=false">Aug 17, 2007</a>      <a title="Mark" class="user" name="Mark" href="/user/show/273793-mark">Mark</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/273793-mark?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer4709501" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6254764597630407718">Although not a bad book, I found this to be the weakest book in the series. But that's beside the point isn't it? If you're reading the whole series you can't very well skip this one.<br /><br />The main stream running through this installment is a sloooow recounting of how Lord Voldemort came to be like his is. To make room for that history lesson, most of the usual crowd (Hagrid, Neville, Luna, McGonagall, Remus, Fred, George, etc) have smaller parts. There is a side plot for Ron dealing with teen age rom</span>  <span id="freeText6254764597630407718" style="display:none">Although not a bad book, I found this to be the weakest book in the series. But that's beside the point isn't it? If you're reading the whole series you can't very well skip this one.<br /><br />The main stream running through this installment is a sloooow recounting of how Lord Voldemort came to be like his is. To make room for that history lesson, most of the usual crowd (Hagrid, Neville, Luna, McGonagall, Remus, Fred, George, etc) have smaller parts. There is a side plot for Ron dealing with teen age romance, but since that boils down to the standard "Ron is a useless git" theme it isn't very satisfying.<br /><br />This is also a book of lost opportunities to mature Harry. In book 5 Harry had to become a leader, but this book generally allows Harry to duck out of making hard choices. As Quidditch captain, fortunate events twice let him avoid choosing between team members. In romance, fortunate events lead him to a girl basically falling into his arms. In school, fortunate events let him slide through potions class with little effort. Symptomatically, in one scene where Harry needs his own blood for magic, he fortunately scrapes himself just moments before. Maybe I'm missing the point and we are supposed to understand that Harry isn't anyone special, he's just very very lucky.</span>  <a data-text-id="6254764597630407718" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class="section">      <div id="review_1241471384" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1241471384" />    <a title="Reza Mardani" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21030932-reza-mardani"><img alt="Reza Mardani" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470406698p2/21030932.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1241471384?book_show_action=false">Apr 09, 2015</a>      <a title="Reza Mardani" class="user" name="Reza Mardani" href="/user/show/21030932-reza-mardani">Reza Mardani</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1241471384" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5588537151831664008">توی این جلد به وضوح شیوه نوشتن خانم رولینگ تغییر کرده و از رمان به یه جور نمایش نامه در اومده. یا لااقل احساس من که اینطوریه.<br />یه نکته ای که خیلی وقته توجه منو به خودش جلب کرده شباهت عجیب داستان هری پاتر با مانگا و انیمه ژاپنی به اسم ناروتو ئه. جفتشونم به فاصله کوتاهی از هم تو سال  شروع شدن و داستان هاشون عینا مثل همه فقط یکی در فضای ژاپنی و جادو ها و تکنیک های ننیجایی و یکی در فضای خرافاتی انگلیسی و جادوگری و الخ<br />در هر دو داستان پسری پدر و مادرش رو از دست میده و از دشمن قدرتی میگیره که با استفاده</span>  <span id="freeText5588537151831664008" style="display:none">توی این جلد به وضوح شیوه نوشتن خانم رولینگ تغییر کرده و از رمان به یه جور نمایش نامه در اومده. یا لااقل احساس من که اینطوریه.<br />یه نکته ای که خیلی وقته توجه منو به خودش جلب کرده شباهت عجیب داستان هری پاتر با مانگا و انیمه ژاپنی به اسم ناروتو ئه. جفتشونم به فاصله کوتاهی از هم تو سال ۹۷ شروع شدن و داستان هاشون عینا مثل همه فقط یکی در فضای ژاپنی و جادو ها و تکنیک های ننیجایی و یکی در فضای خرافاتی انگلیسی و جادوگری و الخ<br />در هر دو داستان پسری پدر و مادرش رو از دست میده و از دشمن قدرتی میگیره که با استفاده از اون قدرت انتقامش رو میگیره در نهایت، استادی که در اواسط داستان میمیره، پسری که استعداد به خصوصی نداره و فقط با سعی و تلاش پیروز میشه. پدر و مادری که نخبه بودن و جابجای داستان ظاهر میشن به طور جادویی و در نهایت هم شکست دادن دشمن و پایان خوش و بی نهایت شباهت دیگه ...</span>  <a data-text-id="5588537151831664008" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/48538637-mehar-bahl?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1435415164" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14304033512564640112">Oh Rowling, Rowling, Rowling...........I know this was a reread but that doesn't mean I can't rant about a book again , okay?<br /><br /><br />Well, alryt I am not going to rant. Just say few simple words.<br /><br />The moment I was finished I was in uncontrollable streams of tears.........that continued for at least 20 minutes<br /><br />after that I have had too equally painful outbursts....<br /><br /><br /><br /><br />do I need to say anything else?<br /><br />Perhaps one.......I love you with all my heart Rowling.............I swear i won't die before I have met you in pe</span>  <span id="freeText14304033512564640112" style="display:none">Oh Rowling, Rowling, Rowling...........I know this was a reread but that doesn't mean I can't rant about a book again , okay?<br /><br /><br />Well, alryt I am not going to rant. Just say few simple words.<br /><br />The moment I was finished I was in uncontrollable streams of tears.........that continued for at least 20 minutes<br /><br />after that I have had too equally painful outbursts....<br /><br /><br /><br /><br />do I need to say anything else?<br /><br />Perhaps one.......I love you with all my heart Rowling.............I swear i won't die before I have met you in person, that is the aim of my life....<br /><br /><br />I think I am done.</span>  <a data-text-id="14304033512564640112" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>
