           swapContent(lessLink);          }        });      });//]]></script>  <script type="text/javascript">  //<![CDATA[      var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');      var $copy;      if ($ratingGraph.length > 0) {          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');          $copy.find('script').remove();          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);      }  //]]>  </script></div><div id="bookReviews">    <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1353344890" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1353344890" />    <a title="Jesica" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/44637869-jesica"><img alt="Jesica" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469336667p2/44637869.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1353344890?book_show_action=false">Oct 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Jesica" class="user" name="Jesica" href="/user/show/44637869-jesica">Jesica</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1353344890" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10531191335032678765">Well, I actually don’t have many things to say about this book. What I can say is this book makes me so eager to read the next book. I have noticed that the ending got sadder with every book in this series but this is the ultimate sad ending. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[How I feel when I read about Dumbledore’s funeral. Sniff. The atmosphere was really sad. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> I have to say I don’t like it as much as the other books, I don’t know why, but I think this book is quite important in the series becaus</span>  <span id="freeText10531191335032678765" style="display:none">Well, I actually don’t have many things to say about this book. What I can say is this book makes me so eager to read the next book. I have noticed that the ending got sadder with every book in this series but this is the ultimate sad ending. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[How I feel when I read about Dumbledore’s funeral. Sniff. The atmosphere was really sad. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> I have to say I don’t like it as much as the other books, I don’t know why, but I think this book is quite important in the series because a lot of mysteries revealed here. Things were fundamentally changed in this book. As for Harry, I kind of miss the younger Harry. I think he had became more arrogant than when he first came in the magical world. He’s not too grumpy like I think he was in the previous book, but I don’t really like something about him in this book. I especially despise his suspicious of Snape and Malfoy. He seemed so determined to think Snape and Malfoy were bad even though all evidence said otherwise. His suspicion was only based on dislike and I have to say (Harry Potter fans please don’t hate me) that it was pretty low. But Harry also showed his best quality here too. His love and selflessness toward his friends is wonderful. But I think he ought to listen to Hermione more. It’s been six book for his six years in Hogwarts and Hermione was usually right about almost everything in every year. Well, I’m not sure what else to say so I’ll end this review here and grab my Harry Potter and The Deadly Hallows copy :p</span>  <a data-text-id="10531191335032678765" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3063888853517473431">Again...wonderful, amazing book.<br /><br />My wife however (and she was 60 at the time)never got over this book and was hesitant to read the last book. I can't go on without a spoiler other than to say we get another tragedy and it really jarred her. So again I can only say these are amazing books! The very quality makes them so real to many readers. Same advice...read the book and decide if your child is old enough. But be assured the quality is here.<br /><br />I do recommend these books and believe that "you" will</span>  <span id="freeText3063888853517473431" style="display:none">Again...wonderful, amazing book.<br /><br />My wife however (and she was 60 at the time)never got over this book and was hesitant to read the last book. I can't go on without a spoiler other than to say we get another tragedy and it really jarred her. So again I can only say these are amazing books! The very quality makes them so real to many readers. Same advice...read the book and decide if your child is old enough. But be assured the quality is here.<br /><br />I do recommend these books and believe that "you" will find yourself reading them over and over. I picture someone in an attic years after their childhood, coming across these books again and sitting down to get absorbed in them all over again. <br /><br />Review to be expanded. </span>  <a id="freeTextContainer12822501417742188226">I have always loved Harry and Hagrid relationship<br /><br />This book is the funniest and most hilarious but also the most devastating one<br /><br />I couldn't help but crying, though I've already read it more than 15 times. <br /><br /><br />First time read: February 2006 (Spanish/Latinoamerican edition)<br />Rereads in Spanish: Lost count a long time ago<br /><br />First time read in English: July 2015<br />Rereads in English: June 2016<br /><br /><br />Siempre amé la relación que tienen Hagrid y Harry. Este libro es el más gracioso y divertido de toda la saga pero también</span>  <span id="freeText12822501417742188226" style="display:none">I have always loved Harry and Hagrid relationship<br /><br />This book is the funniest and most hilarious but also the most devastating one<br /><br />I couldn't help but crying, though I've already read it more than 15 times. <br /><br /><br />First time read: February 2006 (Spanish/Latinoamerican edition)<br />Rereads in Spanish: Lost count a long time ago<br /><br />First time read in English: July 2015<br />Rereads in English: June 2016<br /><br /><br />Siempre amé la relación que tienen Hagrid y Harry. Este libro es el más gracioso y divertido de toda la saga pero también el más devastador. No puedo evitar llorar una y otra vez, aunque ya haya releído la saga más de 15 veces</span>  <a data-text-id="12822501417742188226" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1587432918" />    <a title="María Angélica" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/18217719-mar-a-ang-lica"><img alt="María Angélica" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478908599p2/18217719.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1587432918?book_show_action=false">Mar 28, 2016</a>      <a title="María Angélica" class="user" name="María Angélica" href="/user/show/18217719-mar-a-ang-lica">María Angélica</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/18217719-mar-a-ang-lica?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1587432918" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16499159932258556851">J.K Rowling definitivamente no sabe que son los sentimientos ni mucho menos como tratar con ellos. Este libro me ha dejado un vacío existencial tan grande que no se como haré para llenarlo.. Las ultimas 5 paginas las leí dos veces porque a la primera vi solo letras borrosas debido a mi llanto. <br />Mi amor a cada uno de los personajes se multiplico por mil con esta lectura y este libro va a un lugar hermoso en mi corazón.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/921644230" />    <a title="KostasAt" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25638423-kostasat"><img alt="KostasAt" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474186008p2/25638423.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/921644230?book_show_action=false">Jun 02, 2016</a>      <a title="KostasAt" class="user" name="KostasAt" href="/user/show/25638423-kostasat">KostasAt</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9789602749661" href="/book/show/4593529">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25638423-kostasat?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25638423-kostasat?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/25638423-kostasat?shelf=all-time-favorite">all-time-favorite</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer921644230" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1333944964806277638">9.5/10<br /><br />Μετά από ένα λίγο κουραστικό και περίεργο πέμπτο βιβλίο η Rowling καταφέρνει να κάνει και πάλι μια ανάλαφρη και διασκεδαστική ιστορία γεμάτη με περιπέτεια, χιούμορ και έναν υπέροχα απολαυστικό Dumbledore. Από την άλλη όμως έχει κάνει ένα αρκετά σκληρό φινάλε (ίσως το σκληρότερο σε όλη τη σειρά) που θα φέρει τα πάνω κάτω όχι μόνο στον Harry και των φίλων του αλλά και σε όλο το Hogwarts.<br /><br />ΥΓ: Η Luna σε ρόλο ομιλητή αγώνων Quidditch νομίζω ήταν ότι καλύτερο έχω δει. Πέθανα στα γέλια!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review921644230">  <td itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/421011708?book_show_action=false">Jun 21, 2016</a>      <a title="Arielle Walker" class="user" name="Arielle Walker" href="/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker">Arielle Walker</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747581086" href="/book/show/93124.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=fantasy-unusual">fantasy-unusual</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=children">children</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=over-500-pages">over-500-pages</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer421011708" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12263564564495769605">I don't think that anything can quite compare to the excitement of a new Harry Potter book. Waiting in line at the bookshop for my very own (pre-ordered, of course) copy, rushing home to lie prone in my room for hours on end, barely moving til every single word was devoured.<br /><br />The funny thing is, every time I re-read these I get a shadow of that same joy, and it's wonderful.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr id="reviewTextContainer1401472623" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10907490081495135649">THE FEELS!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1401472623">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1401472623" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1401472623u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1401472623'><a id="like_count_review_1401472623" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1401472623?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">11 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1401472623" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1401472623" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=11u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1401472623u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1443371682" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1443371682" />    <a title="Liam Gardner" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/38154660-liam-gardner"><img alt="Liam Gardner" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451864455p2/38154660.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1443371682?book_show_action=false">Feb 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Liam Gardner" class="user" name="Liam Gardner" href="/user/show/38154660-liam-gardner">Liam Gardner</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1443371682" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11270192482142467288">I CAN'T BELIEVE I'M ONTO THE FINAL BOOK! AHHHHHHH.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince was fantastic, as expected! There wasn't as much action in this book as there was in previous books (until the very end) BUT J.K Rowling definitely made up for that with the character development which was needed, especially for characters we knew little about, like Voldemort. <br /><br />Harry is no longer spending his time feeling down but moving on from his previous year at Hogwarts, growing up and dealing with his s</span>  <span id="freeText11270192482142467288" style="display:none">I CAN'T BELIEVE I'M ONTO THE FINAL BOOK! AHHHHHHH.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince was fantastic, as expected! There wasn't as much action in this book as there was in previous books (until the very end) BUT J.K Rowling definitely made up for that with the character development which was needed, especially for characters we knew little about, like Voldemort. <br /><br />Harry is no longer spending his time feeling down but moving on from his previous year at Hogwarts, growing up and dealing with his situation that little bit more in an adult way. He's feeling much better in himself, more accepted by his friends/teachers. But the rage and fear still continues in Harry throughout this book, determined to get through this wreck. <br /><br />Voldemort's history was written in so so SO well, using the pensive for this was genius. Here we saw how Tom Riddle came to become Lord Voldemort. His character development was greatly needed. I thoroughly enjoyed Dumbledore's lessons. <br /><br />This book also has my most favorite chapter in the series so far. 'The cave' chapter was so different and refreshing, Harry and Dumbledore having an adventure together? And outside Hogwarts grounds too? It was awesome! The events of this chapter was described so well. Dumbledore drinking the potion and going through alllll that pain was heartbreaking, also the Inferi were absolutely terrifying!!!<br /><br />Okay, so. It is really hard for me to talk about this book without dropping spoilers. Half Blood Prince was full of shocks!! So SPOILER ALERT!!! <br /><br />I have to mention Dumbledore's death. Even though I knew this was going to happen, and I saw the movies it still saddened me! Dumbledore was so great in this book, he made loads of appearances which really makes a difference to The Order Of The Phoenix where we had little to no scenes with him. The funeral was just so depressing. UGHHH! :(<br /><br />I was a tiny bit sceptical about Harry and Ginnys relationship at first but I really do enjoy them together, the same as Ron and Hermione (although not officially together) they are just adorable, all the jealousy was both cute and hilarious to read! I can't wait to read on and watch all the characters relationships flourish.<br /><br />Now something I was really shocked by. I found myself feeling so sorry for Draco. He was raised to believe he was superior to everyone else from a young age so he doesn't really know much better i guess. He hasn't really had the chance to think for himself to become either good or bad because of his parents/voldemort expected so much. I believe he was driven to be the way he is now by fear his whole life. Sirius wasn't a coward so he was able to stand up to what he believed in with his family being the way they were, whereas I feel like Draco is too much of a coward break free from it all. I still think that he's an evil piece of work but I can't help but feeling some sympathy. Also I really don't think he would have killed Dumbledore.<br /><br />Overall, I loved The Half-Blood Prince so surprise surprise I give it a 5/5 :) :) </span>  <a data-text-id="11270192482142467288" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1443371682">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1443371682" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1443371682u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1443371682'><a id="like_count_review_1443371682" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1443371682?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">10 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1443371682" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1443371682" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_27743681" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/27743681" />    <a title="Ashley" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1343864-ashley"><img alt="Ashley" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1254118403p2/1343864.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/27743681?book_show_action=false">Aug 16, 2010</a>      <a title="Ashley" class="user" name="Ashley" href="/user/show/1343864-ashley">Ashley</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439784542" href="/book/show/49852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1343864-ashley?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1343864-ashley?shelf=addictive">addictive</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1343864-ashley?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1343864-ashley?shelf=bildungsroman">bildungsroman</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1343864-ashley?shelf=anglophilia">anglophilia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1343864-ashley?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer27743681" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15467363460884898729">In the summer of 2003, the Arizona Diamondbacks went on a crazy intense winning streak, due mostly to the fact that they had something like eleven to thirteen rookies playing at any given time, all of whom were unknown quantities (and thus harder to beat). They were calling them the u0026quot;Baby Backsu0026quot; (future Cy Young winner Brandon Webb among them). As of June 30, 2003, the team had won eleven consecutive games, one away from beating their record. My sister, Melissa, likes baseball in an unnatural</span>  <span id="freeText15467363460884898729" style="display:none">In the summer of 2003, the Arizona Diamondbacks went on a crazy intense winning streak, due mostly to the fact that they had something like eleven to thirteen rookies playing at any given time, all of whom were unknown quantities (and thus harder to beat). They were calling them the "Baby Backs" (future Cy Young winner Brandon Webb among them). As of June 30, 2003, the team had won eleven consecutive games, one away from beating their record. My sister, Melissa, likes baseball in an unnatural obsessive fashion (much the way I like TV) and got us tickets to the game. Naturally this concerned me due to the midnight release part of <i>Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</i>, which I was supposed to be attending that night. <br /><br />(Bear with me, this story does eventually relate to <i>Half-Blood Prince</i>.)<br /><br />So it's like the bottom of the 8th inning and we're losing and I'm really worried at this point that we're going to be late so I make my entire family get up and leave. My sister put up a little bit of a fight, but as we were losing by at least three runs, she eventually shut up and we left. But as we were walking back to the car, the stadium EXPLODED. And kept exploding. Fireworks went off (not a euphemism). And my sister turned to me and knifed my bowels into ribbons with just the power of her angry eyes. I tried to explain to her that you don't fuck around with Harry Potter, but not five minutes later when we'd reached the car and turned on the radio and she learned that we'd won that 12th consecutive game and that we'd been there and left, I really thought she might murder me. She hadn't read Harry Potter yet, you see. She didn't understand.<br /><br />Fast forward two years. She was right there with me at the midnight release of <i>Half-Blood Prince</i>, dressed as Draco Malfoy. We raced home together and read the book late into the night, waking up early to finish. I finished first and she was mad when I started crying and she had to wait to find out why. And of course, later in the shower, when I remembered what happened and started crying AGAIN (is there anything more pathetic than crying in the shower over a dead fictional character?), after I got out she couldn't resist making fun of me. Apparently I'd been crying so loud that she'd heard the sobs through the walls and over the sound of the running water. But FUCK, man! That shit is sad! Served her right ten minutes later when it was her turn to cry.<br /><br />But anyway, the point is that none of you should be in doubt: Harry Potter is way more important than baseball. And football. And soccer. And Hockey. And that is a lesson everybody should learn.</span>  <a data-text-id="15467363460884898729" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3065234-virgodura?shelf=novel-novella">novel-novella</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3065234-virgodura?shelf=sff-etc">sff-etc</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3065234-virgodura?shelf=2014">2014</a>,               <a href="/review/list/3065234-virgodura?shelf=childrens-ya">childrens-ya</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer852266380" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3813721085785055269">In which Draco Malfoy has better priorities (gives up on quidditch and prefect activities whereas Harry spends half the book agonizing over sports and house points as if they matter) and more of an independent intellect (he learned occulmency over the summer to protect his privacy re: his ally Snape whereas Harry wouldn't even to protect himself from Voldemort u0026amp;amp; in general, continues to show a complete disinterest in learning magic) than Harry Potter, the world learns that JKR has some very</span>  <span id="freeText3813721085785055269" style="display:none">In which Draco Malfoy has better priorities (gives up on quidditch and prefect activities whereas Harry spends half the book agonizing over sports and house points as if they matter) and more of an independent intellect (he learned occulmency over the summer to protect his privacy re: his ally Snape whereas Harry wouldn't even to protect himself from Voldemort u0026amp; in general, continues to show a complete disinterest in learning magic) than Harry Potter, the world learns that JKR has some very odd ideas about romance (Tonks, Hermione and Merope all losing their minds and personalities over lost love and it being framed as such, not to mention the dread Ginny-sue) and Tom Riddle, a really potentially interesting character who was set up as a counter to Harry, becomes an abnormal psychology 101 case study in sociopathy.<br /><br />Torn between one and two stars, really. Maybe it should get two because it was relatively short and Snape made me laugh:<br /><blockquote><br />“I thought you could start,” said Snape, a malicious smile on his lips, “with boxes one thousand and twelve to one thousand and fifty-six. You will find some familiar names in there, which should add interest to the task. Here, you see…”<br />He pulled out a card from one of the topmost boxes with a flourish and read, “‘<i>James Potter and Sirius Black. Apprehended using an illegal hex upon Bertram Aubrey. Aubreys head twice normal size. Double detention</i>.’” Snape sneered. “It must be such a comforting thing that, though they are gone, a record of their great achievements remains.”</blockquote></span>  <a itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/26033366" />    <a title="Jessika" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1166992-jessika"><img alt="Jessika" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445122165p2/1166992.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/26033366?book_show_action=false">Nov 28, 2009</a>      <a title="Jessika" class="user" name="Jessika" href="/user/show/1166992-jessika">Jessika</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439784542" href="/book/show/49852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=series">series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1166992-jessika?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer26033366" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10688258483444665262">Even though I already knew what was going to happen, no thanks to a friend who spoiled it for me, that didn't stop the tears from flowing as I read the end of this book. J.K. Rowling continued to take the series down a deeper and much darker road with this book. This particular book seems to focus quite a bit on emotions--fear, love, hatred, grief. As a reader, this book was the most gripping out of all of them. Within the first chapter or two, I was already ready to start throwing punches left</span>  <span id="freeText10688258483444665262" style="display:none">Even though I already knew what was going to happen, no thanks to a friend who spoiled it for me, that didn't stop the tears from flowing as I read the end of this book. J.K. Rowling continued to take the series down a deeper and much darker road with this book. This particular book seems to focus quite a bit on emotions--fear, love, hatred, grief. As a reader, this book was the most gripping out of all of them. Within the first chapter or two, I was already ready to start throwing punches left and right. And that amount of emotion was there throughout the entire book--especially the ending. Now, I know that these are works of fiction, but for Harry Potter fanatics, the death of someone who has become very real to us and who is a favorite character of many, the ending was as painful as can be. I definitely have to give props to Rowling for her control over her readers' emotions in this book. We've reached very frightening times in Harry's world...I can only imagine what the next book is going to bring...</span>  <a data-text-id="10688258483444665262" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1359558078" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1359558078" />    <a title="Drew The Reviewer" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25599529-drew-the-reviewer"><img alt="Drew The Reviewer" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451757668p2/25599529.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1359558078?book_show_action=false">Jul 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Drew The Reviewer" class="user" name="Drew The Reviewer" href="/user/show/25599529-drew-the-reviewer">Drew The Reviewer</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582995" href="/book/show/17347380-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1359558078" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7892003871930189679">*RE-READ*<br /><br />The emotions I get from this book will feel new to me every time I read it. I'm not gonna bother with a spoiler warning since the whole world knows the story of Harry Potter.<br /><br />One of the most amazing scenes in this entire series is when Snape kills Dumbledore. It is so fucking heartbreaking every single time. It is the biggest game-changer out of all the books. The only wizard Voldemort ever feared was murdered by his own friend. Snape and Dumbledore are two of my all time favorite charac</span>  <span id="freeText7892003871930189679" style="display:none">*RE-READ*<br /><br />The emotions I get from this book will feel new to me every time I read it. I'm not gonna bother with a spoiler warning since the whole world knows the story of Harry Potter.<br /><br />One of the most amazing scenes in this entire series is when Snape kills Dumbledore. It is so fucking heartbreaking every single time. It is the biggest game-changer out of all the books. The only wizard Voldemort ever feared was murdered by his own friend. Snape and Dumbledore are two of my all time favorite characters, so that scene just blows my mind.<br /><br />Learning about Voldemort through Dumbledore and Slughorn's memories was amazing. <br /><br />I just love this book so fucking much. It is so emotional, game-changing, and absolutely genius.</span>  <a data-text-id="7892003871930189679" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1359558078">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks"> id="reviewTextContainer1385138017" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7683969217973919422">"Silente avrà veramente lasciato la scuola solo quando non ci sarà più nessuno che gli sia fedele."<br /><br />Che male al cuore. Questo libro è indescrivibile.<br /><br />"Andrà tutto bene, signore" ripetè ancora e ancora, più preoccupato del mutismo di Silente di quanto lo fosse stato dalla sua voce indebolita. "Ci siamo quasi... Posso farci materializzare tutti e due... non si preoccupi."<br />"Non sono preoccupato, Harry" rispose Silente, la voce un po' più forte nonostante l'acqua gelata. "Sono con te".</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1385138017">  <td        <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788498384482" href="/book/show/29813332-harry-potter-y-el-misterio-del-pr-ncipe">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31676961-diana-torales?shelf=2016-reads">2016-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1612547319" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4621202310830572632">4.5<br />Este libro me gustó muchísimo más que el anterior, a ver ahora cuando leo el último. Todavía no logro entender como no lloré u0026gt;.u0026lt;</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer1352025075" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5772774104001815770">OH MY CLARK GABLE I CANNOT EVEN RIGHT NOW, NO ONE TALK TO ME.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1352025075">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1352025075" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1352025075u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1352025075'><a id="like_count_review_1352025075" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1352025075?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">11 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1352025075" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1352025075" ref="like" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=11u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1352025075u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1352025075' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1352025075, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1204116779" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1204116779" />    <a title="Jonathan" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6313408-jonathan"><img alt="Jonathan" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478230200p2/6313408.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1204116779?book_show_action=false">Feb 24, 2015</a>      <a title="Jonathan" class="user" name="Jonathan" href="/user/show/6313408-jonathan">Jonathan</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408810583" href="/book/show/8723736-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=children-s-literature">children-s-literature</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=favourite-series">favourite-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=favourites">favourites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=worldbuilding">worldbuilding</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1204116779" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6382733305953980394">These books continue to get better and better as they go along. It might surprise some reading this that I was tempted to give this book five stars for pure enjoyment, but objectively I do not believe it was quite as good as many other five star novels. <br /><br />The story in this novel should be familiar to anyone with any knowledge of popular culture (that of Harry Potter, the boy wizard who must fight and defeat the dark lord Voldemort). Indeed, there has been an entire subculture of pop culture (akin</span>  <span id="freeText6382733305953980394" style="display:none">These books continue to get better and better as they go along. It might surprise some reading this that I was tempted to give this book five stars for pure enjoyment, but objectively I do not believe it was quite as good as many other five star novels. <br /><br />The story in this novel should be familiar to anyone with any knowledge of popular culture (that of Harry Potter, the boy wizard who must fight and defeat the dark lord Voldemort). Indeed, there has been an entire subculture of pop culture (akin to other franchises like Marvel, DC, Game of Thrones, Doctor Who etc) which has developed alongside these books, and initially made me very skeptical of the series. I was particularly skeptical with the first three books (the third book improved on the first two admittedly) with the poorly defined magic systems, the childish characters, the writing that was still quite rough-around-the-edges and actually only was attracted to the worldbuilding and the overall charm of the novels. However, as Rowling has continued to write her quality of plotting, character-development and worldbuilding has also improved. In short her novels have transformed into typical children's fiction and become something more worthwhile.<br /><br />Let me explain why these books become more worthwhile. For instance, the first few novels were so singularly focused on the schooling at Hogwarts that any reference to the overall villains seemed like some cheap side-story. However, this novel (and the previous two) adopt more mature tones and a clearer focus on where the entire story is headed. The novels also reveal heightened levels of political subtext and references to how education systems and government systems are run (forming a kind of fascinating analysis of real life despite featuring a magical world - something more fantasy books should undertake). <br /><br />Character building further improves. These books are perhaps, the most famous coming-of-age stories in the world at the moment, and they are with the overall character development, prime examples of this. Harry, though involved in helping the adult world, must deal with the pressures of being treated like a child - albeit a special child - and these later novels expose these pressures with writing full of emotion, charm and greater wit. It's somewhat manipulative of Rowling, but her novels are written in a way that the expected audience can grow alongside the characters and find that they themselves can identify strongly with what the characters feel. Children and teenagers certainly understand what it is to feel special, powerless, weak, inadequate, intelligent and awkward. These are emotions that Rowling exposes and uses in useful ways as a writer.<br /><br />Admittedly, as fantasy books these are far from the greatest examples. They are nice children's novels - although I place far greater importance on <i>The Chronicles of Narnia</i>, <i>Alice in Wonderland</i>, <i>The Hobbit</i> and gems like <i>Little House in the Woods</i> or <i>Little Women</i>. And this importance is only because those were novels which defined part of my childhood reading experience (add in some Roald Dahl or other classics of course). <br /><br />I almost forgot to mention the prose itself. It's a nice, charming style which Rowling has fine-tuned by the time of this book: casual enough, simple, but with nuance and sophistication hidden in the word-choices it's certainly a very sympathetic type of writing and one suitable for her audience. I would state that the best and most recognizable technique of Rowling's is her use of foreshadowing and asides together. Some of her foreshadowing is very neat and clever and though some of it in the earlier books is very obvious, by the stage of this book it is reached a stage where it becomes more intriguing rather than apparent.<br /><br />As for the plot of this book, well it focuses on the terror that the return of Voldemort has brought to the wizarding world and the discovery of an important textbook owned by a mysterious Half-Blood Prince (a textbook which provides all kinds of secret tips for Harry in his potions class). The interesting Snape and the fatherly Dumbledore have greater roles again in this novel and the resolution leads to something of a cliff-hanger (but not quite). In short it's an interesting novel where the 'devil is in the details' as they say.<br /><br />To me I think that a lot of the reputation of these novels is undeserved. They are nice books and certainly enjoyable (much like Hunger Games or Divergent is to me) and I appreciate that they lead a lot of children into the greater world of reading. I also feel that the whole 'evil books' side of the reputation (with some parents not allowing their children to read them) is also undeserved. There are some great themes and lessons in here - although I dislike the harsh punishments handed out by teachers and the casual use of hexes and curses in the books at times. The biggest draw is, of course, the wizarding world and the idea of having a school for wizards which I don't think is something seen in western literature in this way. Either way, I certainly am enjoying reading these books like I enjoy the other books. They're mostly unique, charming and get better as they continue. </span>  <a data-text-id="6382733305953980394" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1204116779">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1204116779" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1204116779u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1204116779'><a id="like_count_review_1204116779" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1204116779?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1204116779" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1204116779" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=9u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1204116779u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1204116779" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1204116779, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">comment</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1204116779?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1204116779' style='display: none;'></div><div comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1052011469" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1052011469" />    <a title="Tiff at Mostly YA Lit" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4163146-tiff-at-mostly-ya-lit"><img alt="Tiff at Mostly YA Lit" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1448295560p2/4163146.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1052011469?book_show_action=false">Jan 10, 2016</a>      <a title="Tiff at Mostly YA Lit" class="user" name="Tiff at Mostly YA Lit" href="/user/show/4163146-tiff-at-mostly-ya-lit">Tiff at Mostly YA Lit</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1052011469" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5060493960563519188">4 stars. Second read. Spoilers EVERYWHERE.<br /><br />Unlike the other mega-large Harry Potter books (aka 4, 5, and 7), I ended up liking Half-Blood Prince a little less the second time around. The full-steam-ahead feeling that characterized Books 4 and 5 seemed to lose a little bit of momentum here. If Order of the Phoenix is the book where things get real in the Harry Potter world, then Half-Blood Prince is a quieter book, the moment when Rowling is really planning for the ending, building the story and b</span>  <span id="freeText5060493960563519188" style="display:none">4 stars. Second read. Spoilers EVERYWHERE.<br /><br />Unlike the other mega-large Harry Potter books (aka 4, 5, and 7), I ended up liking Half-Blood Prince a little less the second time around. The full-steam-ahead feeling that characterized Books 4 and 5 seemed to lose a little bit of momentum here. If Order of the Phoenix is the book where things get real in the Harry Potter world, then Half-Blood Prince is a quieter book, the moment when Rowling is really planning for the ending, building the story and background for the last part of the story and the inevitable battle between Voldemort and Harry. <br /><br />On my first read of Half-Blood Prince, I was enthralled by the backstory. Finally, after years, we were getting to the "heart" of Voldemort and how he became the way he is. Only by understanding him could Harry beat him. On my second read, though, I felt like the book dragged a bit - Voldemort doesn't even really play a role in the battle at the end - and even though the actions that happen in this book are necessary to get us to book 7, it really didn't feel like a big payoff in the end. I was desperate to get to certain moments in the book the second time around - I wanted Harry to get the damn memory from Slughorn immediately, I wanted to get to the moment where Harry and Dumbledore discuss choices, I wanted to see the cave again, and even though it hurt, I wanted to re-read that moment when Snape kills Dumbledore. Because there were so many important bits of backstory, and a lot of them occur at the end of the book, my second read was characterized by a bit more impatience, especially with the Malfoy subplot, which I found to be a bit of a retread of book 5, in that Harry believes something that no one else does.<br /><br />What IS interesting is how much more pronounced that obsession with catching Malfoy was to me on this second read. I feel like that obsession is a bit of a foreshadowing for Harry's obsession with the Deathly Hallows in book seven, and also shows Harry's stubborn belief in his own ideas without basis and the way he rushes into action (also characterized by his disastrous attempts at Occlumency and his constant dreams about the Department of Mysteries in book 5). While it's good to stand up for your beliefs, I think the stubbornness makes Harry reckless, a lot like Sirius, and it makes Harry's choices of Hallows vs. Horcruxes that much smarter in book 7. <br /><br />Harry continues to be a very angsty teenager - with good reason, but nevertheless, there's a lot of anger and resentment at his predicament. This was the first time in reading where I felt like I wouldn't necessarily want to be Harry's friend - he's a bit scary in his anger. That said, I still very much enjoyed seeing the advanced magic in Harry, Ron, and Hermione's NEWT classes, the Quidditch games, and yes, the romance. Half-Blood Prince is definitely the book of teenage hormones, where Ron finally realizes that girls exist, and thus spends quite a lot of time making out with Lavender Brown before realizing that he might actually like someone else a bit more. <br /><br />Meanwhile, Harry's realization that Ginny exists as a girl and not just his best friend's sister was so satisfying, even the second time around. Because Ginny is my favourite character, I was grateful that we got so much more of her in this book, and got to see how, unlike Harry's "relationship" with Cho, which was really based on her looks, Harry and Ginny already had a rapport, they've known each other for a long time, and his feelings grew naturally out of his gradual knowledge of her as a smart, funny, talented, and headstrong girl who isn't afraid to fight back. Even the scenes when they're together are so different from Harry's date with Cho, where he was stuck in Madam Puddifoot's - right after Harry and Ginny get together, they're sitting casually in the Gryffindor common room laughing with Ron and Hermione. It's clear that this is a relationship that is real. <br /><br />It's not a perfect read, but nevertheless, the second time around, the scenes at the end of the book with Harry and Dumbledore still made me cry. I knew the first time around that Dumbledore would have to die - there's a reason why that cliche about the old mentor dying before the hero can move on exists - but even knowing all that did not stop me from feeling the poignancy of the funeral, of Harry and Ginny's break-up, and the moment when Hermione and Ron step up and insist on going with Harry on his mission. </span>  <a data-text-id="5060493960563519188" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1347276813" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1347276813" />    <a title="Rebecca (whymermaids)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4713345-rebecca-whymermaids"><img alt="Rebecca (whymermaids)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1347213351p2/4713345.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1347276813?book_show_action=false">Jul 27, 2015</a>      <a title="Rebecca (whymermaids)" class="user" name="Rebecca (whymermaids)" href="/user/show/4713345-rebecca-whymermaids">Rebecca (whymermaids)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582995" href="/book/show/17347380-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1347276813" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14399252012759951991">Half-Blood Prince makes me cry bit, fat, hot tears for like three entire chapters; it grabs me emotionally and wrings me with so much hurt (an ominous sign for Deathly Hallows, which I avoid reading/watching because of the emotional wreckage). It's painful and beautiful and tragic.<br /><br />I was never a fan of the romance angle of HBP, and the Penseive Dance, while really interesting, is basically the main plot and drama of the story, which kind of falls flat in comparison to the Triwizard Tournament and</span>  <span id="freeText14399252012759951991" style="display:none">Half-Blood Prince makes me cry bit, fat, hot tears for like three entire chapters; it grabs me emotionally and wrings me with so much hurt (an ominous sign for Deathly Hallows, which I avoid reading/watching because of the emotional wreckage). It's painful and beautiful and tragic.<br /><br />I was never a fan of the romance angle of HBP, and the Penseive Dance, while really interesting, is basically the main plot and drama of the story, which kind of falls flat in comparison to the Triwizard Tournament and the growing darkness and hostility of Order of the Phoenix. While the adventure with Dumbledore at the end is exciting and intriguing, and the Battle is terrifying and heart-pounding, I don't think it lives up to the previous books. Not that it isn't interesting, and the end isn't heartbreaking, but overall, the plot falls a little flat for me. Mind you, my eyes are still red and puffy from all the crying.<br /><br />Let it be said, however, and despite my personal feelings about the pairing, book Ginny Weasley is so much better than movie Ginny. She has spunk and is a nice counter to Hermione's intellect and brains-first attitude. Ginny is popular and pretty and dates around, and doesn't let her brothers give her crap for it! And there's something to be said of that. She holds her own with Harry and his friends, and with Fred and George, when she needs to, and that's so much cooler than the movie Ginny who has no personality.<br /><br />That being said, I'm not a Harry-Ginny fan. To me, it feels rushed (look at the Ron-Hermione, 7 book long setup!), and Ginny seems to be too much of a replacement for his mother. He doesn't notice her for years, and then all of a sudden his "monster" is upset she's kissing Dean? I just don't buy it. I also feel like Harry needs someone outside the realm of his group of friends, if anyone at all. Why does Harry need a girlfriend? He will never be happy at home, and while I get that part of the Ginny relationship works because she's okay with him off battling battles, because that's what he does, it just never felt right to me.<br /><br />HBP also has the ultimate betrayal (or does it!?) and I remember being SO. ANGRY. and confused. WHY!?<br /><br />One of my least favorites of the series, but it still has some really great moments (Felix Felicis!) and is, ultimately, still Harry Potter.<br /><br />I'm starting Deathly Hallows with a box of tissues next to me. </span>  <a data-text-id="14399252012759951991" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1347276813">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1347276813" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1347276813u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1347276813'><a id="like_count_review_1347276813" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1347276813?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">10 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1347276813" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1347276813" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=10u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=5u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1347276813u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1347276813" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1347276813, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); Element.update("reviews", "<div class="right bookMeta darkGreyText">    <span class="smallText">(showing 151-180)</span></div><div id="bookReviewControls" data-book-reviews-page="6">  <a class="uitext" id="span_class_actionlink_filter_span_tip_721" style="cursor: pointer; " href="#" onclick="return false"><span class="actionLink">filter</span></a><script>//<![CDATA[      var newTip = new Tip($('span_class_actionlink_filter_span_tip_721'), "      <div class="greyText smallText" style="white-space:nowrap">        <span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="actionLinkLite greyText loadingLink" rel="nofollow" data-keep-on-success="true" data-remote="true" href="/book/reviews/1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince?rating=">all <span class="greyText">(2017225)</span></a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span>            <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;|u0026nbsp;</span>            <span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="greyText">(1052706)</span></a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span>            <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;|u0026nbsp;</span>            <span class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1517903337" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1517903337" />    <a title="Alycia (aly_reads)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/51744742-alycia-aly-reads"><img alt="Alycia (aly_reads)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476441179p2/51744742.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1517903337?book_show_action=false">Sep 10, 2016</a>      <a title="Alycia (aly_reads)" class="user" name="Alycia (aly_reads)" href="/user/show/51744742-alycia-aly-reads">Alycia (aly_reads)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408855942" href="/book/show/22037471-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1517903337" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7943019008491080274">I just finished reading Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince and I literally loved it! So far, my favorite novel from the Harry Potter series was Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban but now, it is on an equal footing with this one. <br />I love how this novel was about Harry and Dumbledore's relationship. I have always admired Dumbledore and this was a good think to dedicate one book to his character. As I said in my updates, I love his stories and how he shared them with Harry and with us. Obv</span>  <span id="freeText7943019008491080274" style="display:none">I just finished reading Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince and I literally loved it! So far, my favorite novel from the Harry Potter series was Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban but now, it is on an equal footing with this one. <br />I love how this novel was about Harry and Dumbledore's relationship. I have always admired Dumbledore and this was a good think to dedicate one book to his character. As I said in my updates, I love his stories and how he shared them with Harry and with us. Obviously, I am so sad about the end of this novel, but Dumbledore will always be in our hearts.<br />I also liked the fact that there were lots of actions in this novel. It was much more interesting to read than when there are only describing passages and no actions to bring the story forward. When books are so long, I really need to be involved in the story, like I was in the research of the horcruxes.<br /><br />To conclude, I definitely had to give a 5 stars to this novel because I really loved it!</span>  <a data-text-id="7943019008491080274" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1018369994" />    <a title="Yukino" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9489799-yukino"><img alt="Yukino" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1337156750p2/9489799.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1018369994?book_show_action=false">Oct 16, 2015</a>      <a title="Yukino" class="user" name="Yukino" href="/user/show/9489799-yukino">Yukino</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788884516374" href="/book/show/3399930-harry-potter-e-il-principe-mezzosangue">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9489799-yukino?shelf=miei">miei</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/9489799-yukino?shelf=2015">2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer1018369994u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1018369994" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10068896599231557519">"E' L'IGNOTO CHE TEMIAMO QUANDO GUARDIAMO LA MORTE E IL BUIO...NIENT'ALTRO..."<br /><br />"SILENTE AVRà VERAMENTE LASCIATO LA SCUOLA SOLO QUANDO NESSUNO GLI SARà PIù FEDELE"<br /><br />L'ho finito stanotte  stamattina alle 3.14. non sono riuscita a staccarmi.<br />l'ho centellinato perchè volevo gustarmelo e l'ho alternato ad altre letture, ma Harry è Harry. A metà libro non ce l'ho fatta (non so neanche come ho fatto a resistere) e ieri (stanotte) l'ho finito.<br />Questo libro è un crescendo. Inizia così, ti lancia quasta bomba</span>  <span id="freeText10068896599231557519" style="display:none">"E' L'IGNOTO CHE TEMIAMO QUANDO GUARDIAMO LA MORTE E IL BUIO...NIENT'ALTRO..."<br /><br />"SILENTE AVRà VERAMENTE LASCIATO LA SCUOLA SOLO QUANDO NESSUNO GLI SARà PIù FEDELE"<br /><br />L'ho finito stanotte  stamattina alle 3.14. non sono riuscita a staccarmi.<br />l'ho centellinato perchè volevo gustarmelo e l'ho alternato ad altre letture, ma Harry è Harry. A metà libro non ce l'ho fatta (non so neanche come ho fatto a resistere) e ieri (stanotte) l'ho finito.<br />Questo libro è un crescendo. Inizia così, ti lancia quasta bomba su Piton e poi tutto tranquillo la solita vita ad Hogwarts (più o meno) ma poi..non sono riuscita fisicamente a staccarmi dal libro fino all'ultima pagina.<br />Ho cercato di trattenermi, di non piangere perchè in fondo speravo che non fosse vero, che Silente sbucasse da qualche parte, un piccolo indizio che lui fosse ancora vivo e invece. Così quando al funerale Harry si gira verso Ginny e le dice che la lascia ho inziato un fiume di lacrime fino alla fine. Ron ed Hermione..oh cavoli sto per rimettermi a piangere! non riesco a fare una recensione decente!<br />Questo volume è tutto. E' la svolta. I personaggi crescono, si innamorano, affrontano l'abbandono, e la caccia adesso ha inizio. Non so se posso resistere a non leggere il seguito. Sto male. Scusate la recensione da matta..ma..non ce la faccio. Ho il cuore a pezzi. <br /><br />"HARRY POTTER L'UOMO DI SILENTE FINO ALLA FINE" e non solo lui, anche io.<br /><br />Datemi l'ultimo volumeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee ç_ç</span>  <a data-text-id="10068896599231557519" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/945944036" />    <a title="Rita Carvalho" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27483008-rita-carvalho"><img alt="Rita Carvalho" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1440942311p2/27483008.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/945944036?book_show_action=false">Jun 12, 2015</a>      <a title="Rita Carvalho" class="user" name="Rita Carvalho" href="/user/show/27483008-rita-carvalho">Rita Carvalho</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27483008-rita-carvalho?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27483008-rita-carvalho?shelf=i-read-because-i-saw-the-movie">i-read-because-i-saw-the-movie</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27483008-rita-carvalho?shelf=5-stars-books">5-stars-books</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer945944036" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13497069545536012866">I loved this book and yet it was so sad... I still want to cry, ugh. <br /><br />This is probably my favorite book from Harry Potter so far. It is the more romantic and I liked that a lot. I totally ship Ron and Hermione. I think they're really cute (and stupid, half of the time) and I can't wait for them to be together! I also like Harry and Ginny and I think their relationship is so much better in the book than in the movie. I mean, they don't actually have a relationship in the movie... that sucks. And,</span>  <span id="freeText13497069545536012866" style="display:none">I loved this book and yet it was so sad... I still want to cry, ugh. <br /><br />This is probably my favorite book from Harry Potter so far. It is the more romantic and I liked that a lot. I totally ship Ron and Hermione. I think they're really cute (and stupid, half of the time) and I can't wait for them to be together! I also like Harry and Ginny and I think their relationship is so much better in the book than in the movie. I mean, they don't actually have a relationship in the movie... that sucks. And, of course, Lupin and Tonks. Awww, they are just so sweet. Also a lot different from the movies, because there I didn't even understand what was happening (I wasn't even sure she was Tonks, oh God).<br /><br />But of course, Dumbledore... I already knew he was going to die, but I'm still very sad. This book is where he is more important, he appears a lot, and then... bum! IT'S SO NOT FAIR. DUMBLEDORE WAS AN AWESOME CHARACTER, HE WAS SO KIND AND INTELLIGENT AND... I DON'T KNOW, BUT THIS DOESN'T MAKE SENSE. HARRY POTTER DOESN'T MAKE SENSE WITHOUT HIM. IT JUST DOESN'T. I'M SO SAD AND PISSED OFF RIGHT NOW. WHY???<br /><br />Anyway... I loved this book, but I could still kill it. I love it and I hate it. It's a complicated relationship.</span>  <a data-text-id="13497069545536012866" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div
