class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18200946400965568030">The penultimate novel of Harry Potter's saga distills darkness for all its four sides. At this point of the plot, J.K. Rowling uses all her vast resources as a writer to plunge into a darker and much more mature story, preparing the reader for the final climax in which the famous magician will face life and death with his archenemy "Lord Valdemort".<br /><br />Spanish version: <br />La penúltima novela de la saga de Harry Potter destila oscuridad por todos sus cuatro costados. Llegados a este punto de la saga, J.</span>  <span id="freeText18200946400965568030" style="display:none">The penultimate novel of Harry Potter's saga distills darkness for all its four sides. At this point of the plot, J.K. Rowling uses all her vast resources as a writer to plunge into a darker and much more mature story, preparing the reader for the final climax in which the famous magician will face life and death with his archenemy "Lord Valdemort".<br /><br />Spanish version: <br />La penúltima novela de la saga de Harry Potter destila oscuridad por todos sus cuatro costados. Llegados a este punto de la saga, J. K. Rowling utiliza todos sus grandes recursos de escritora para sumergirnos en una historia cada vez más asfixiante, tenebrosa y sobretodo madura, preparando al lector para el clímax final en el que el famoso mago deberá enfrentarse a vida o muerte con su archienemigo "Lord Valdemort".<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="18200946400965568030" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1113640241">  <td itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1488713414?book_show_action=false">Jan 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Sana" class="user" name="Sana" href="/user/show/5862550-sana">Sana</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855706" href="/book/show/22844202-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5862550-sana?shelf=maps-maps-everywhere">maps-maps-everywhere</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"          <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5862550-sana?shelf=characters-who-are-everything-to-me">characters-who-are-everything-to-me</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1488713414" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12742738149706178489">Aahhhh!<br /><br />The insight into how Tom Riddle operated and what drove him to the Dark Arts is just fascinating stuff. What Dumbledore said to Harry about the similarities between him and Riddle and the one thing that differentiates them is so simple and just as brilliant in its reality.<br /><br />I just love all the Ron/Hermione and Harry/Ginny parts of the book.<br /><br />Knowing the whole Draco/Snape fiasco, it's so plain to see why it was important that it happens the way it did but fuck, it hurt anyway.<br /><br />Dumbledore is my</span>  <span id="freeText12742738149706178489" style="display:none">Aahhhh!<br /><br />The insight into how Tom Riddle operated and what drove him to the Dark Arts is just fascinating stuff. What Dumbledore said to Harry about the similarities between him and Riddle and the one thing that differentiates them is so simple and just as brilliant in its reality.<br /><br />I just love all the Ron/Hermione and Harry/Ginny parts of the book.<br /><br />Knowing the whole Draco/Snape fiasco, it's so plain to see why it was important that it happens the way it did but fuck, it hurt anyway.<br /><br />Dumbledore is my favorite character after Harry in the series and it's because of him that I love this book as much as I do.</span>  <a data-text-id="12742738149706178489" href="#" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1149132752" />    <a title="Niina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/11898921-niina"><img alt="Niina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469811518p2/11898921.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1149132752?book_show_action=false">Oct 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Niina" class="user" name="Niina" href="/user/show/11898921-niina">Niina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9789513135072" href="/book/show/943082.Harry_Potter_ja_puoliverinen_prinssi">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11898921-niina?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11898921-niina?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1149132752" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3763746919324145071">Puoliverinen prinssi oli tosiaankin parempi kuin Feeniksin kilta, niin kuin olin 10 vuotta sitten lukupäiväkirjaan kirjoittanut. Toisella lukukerralla tämä ei yltänyt ihan kakkoseksi Liekehtivän pikarin jälkeen, mutta kolmas sija heti Azkabanin vangin perään tuntuu oikeudenmukaiselta. <br /><br />Puoliverinen prinssi jatkaa Potter-sarjaa synkkänä ja surullisena, mutta koska Harry on kasvanut paljon edellisen kirjan jälkeen, ja hänen puheensa Voldemortin paluusta otetaan vihdoin vakavasti, ei lukeminen ollut</span>  <span id="freeText3763746919324145071" style="display:none">Puoliverinen prinssi oli tosiaankin parempi kuin Feeniksin kilta, niin kuin olin 10 vuotta sitten lukupäiväkirjaan kirjoittanut. Toisella lukukerralla tämä ei yltänyt ihan kakkoseksi Liekehtivän pikarin jälkeen, mutta kolmas sija heti Azkabanin vangin perään tuntuu oikeudenmukaiselta. <br /><br />Puoliverinen prinssi jatkaa Potter-sarjaa synkkänä ja surullisena, mutta koska Harry on kasvanut paljon edellisen kirjan jälkeen, ja hänen puheensa Voldemortin paluusta otetaan vihdoin vakavasti, ei lukeminen ollut niin raskasta. Sivumäärä on myös edeltäjää inhimillisempi. </span>  <a data-text-id="3763746919324145071" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div id="reviewTextContainer1476539432" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10785728490093492219">Chorei rios e oceanos no final apesar de já saber o que ai vinha, foi 20 vezes mais doloroso. Acho que digo isso de cada vez que termino um livro de Harry Potter...xD<br />Mas este realmente fez-me ficar de coração cheio e vazio ao mesmo tempo, tanta montanha russa de emoções num livro!!!  <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/56590438-beyza-y-ld-r-m?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1698009011" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14026971332479812782">Nasıl denir bilmiyorum ama, bir kitap için en fazla bu kadar gözyaşı dökülür. Bu serinin neden hayatımın serisini olduğunu bir kez daha farkettim ve anladım. Bitmesini istemedim ama elimden de düşüremedim. Önceden filmlerini izlemesem Snape'e karşı büyük bir kin duyardım ama onu da yapamıyor olmam çok daha dayanılmaz. Evet, yasımı tutacağım. Çünkü bir sonraki kitapta en sevdiğim ve her sözünün altını çizerek okuduğum adam olmayacak. <br />Serinin sonuna geçeceğiz artık.<br />#Lumos</span>          </span>        </div>      <div href="/book/show/17347380-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a             <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4988733-alexa?shelf=i-rec-it">i-rec-it</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4988733-alexa?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1710779521" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14907248867345233386">Once the ball gets rolling at the end of the fourth book, more and more things start to happen. In this sixth part of Harry Potter's story, the stakes are higher than ever, new revelations come to light and there are great emotional upheavals - good and bad. Still as compelling as it was the very first time I read it!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/70428115?book_show_action=false">Sep 14, 2009</a>      <a title="Stephen" class="user" name="Stephen" href="/user/show/1413439-stephen">Stephen</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=potteresque">potteresque</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=2000-2005">2000-2005</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1413439-stephen?shelf=comfort-food">comfort-food</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer70428115" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5294132477460893007">4.5 stars. As with the previous novels, this series continues to grow up, just like its central character. While still very much apporpirate for myounger readers, the themes and issues addressed and the reactions of the characters to events in the story have a much more adult feeling to them. Oh yeah, it is also a ton of fun and I highly recommend it. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"     <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8253900-latasha?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer296407650" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14414005121702814353">damn it, Hagrid's heartbreak is so soul shattering. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review296407650">  <td colspan="2">    <div elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_922798558" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/922798558" />    <a title="Riley Blue" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15728062-riley-blue"><img alt="Riley Blue" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1430502657p2/15728062.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/922798558?book_show_action=false">Apr 28, 2014</a>      <a title="Riley Blue" class="user" name="Riley Blue" href="/user/show/15728062-riley-blue">Riley Blue</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15728062-riley-blue?shelf=really-really-love-it">really-really-love-it</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15728062-riley-blue?shelf=blow-my-mind">blow-my-mind</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15728062-riley-blue?shelf=five-stars">five-stars</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/15728062-riley-blue?shelf=read-reviewed">read-reviewed</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer922798558" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer446981690065275325">¡Uf, qué libro!<br>Emocionante, revelador y triste: todo al mismo tiempo.<br>En esta oportunidad Harry se enfrentará a los peligros del pasado de su enemigo más grande, Lord Voldemort, acompañado de nuevo por sus fieles amigos Hermione Granger y Ron Weasley y también de los infaltables miembros de La Orden del Fénix.<br><br>Harry ha crecido muchísimo, no sólo en edad sino como personaje. Me ha encantado verlo luchar y sin rendirse sobre lo que él creía que estaba pasando, aún si todo el mundo le decía que era u</span>  <span id="freeText446981690065275325" style="display:none">¡Uf, qué libro!<br>Emocionante, revelador y triste: todo al mismo tiempo.<br>En esta oportunidad Harry se enfrentará a los peligros del pasado de su enemigo más grande, Lord Voldemort, acompañado de nuevo por sus fieles amigos Hermione Granger y Ron Weasley y también de los infaltables miembros de La Orden del Fénix.<br><br>Harry ha crecido muchísimo, no sólo en edad sino como personaje. Me ha encantado verlo luchar y sin rendirse sobre lo que él creía que estaba pasando, aún si todo el mundo le decía que era un poco paranoico. <br>Fue alucinante la manera que tuvo Harry de enfrentarse a Rufus Scrimgeour, Harry nunca la buscado ser el héroe ni recibir elogios, pero la verdad es que se lo merece todo. <br><br>Hasta ahora este es el libro en el que Dumbledore ha tenido más protagonismo, y claro que eso me emociona muchísimo. Es un gran hombre, mago y aparte muy inteligente y bondadoso, en pocas palabras Dumbledore es un personaje muy pero que muy virtuoso que ha hecho el libro más interesante al contar un poquito de todo lo que él sabe. Todos los flashbacks que Dumbledore le muestra a Harry son super absorbentes y originales y ni hablar de todas las conclusiones que Dumbledore saca al respecto, es sencillamente increíble. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ No me podía creer la muerte de Dumbledore ¡y por la mano de Snape! En Snape nunca confíe del todo, la verdad era que no sabía qué pensar de él hasta que en el segundo capítulo de este libro por fin nos esclarecen su verdad y es que siempre estuvo del lado de Lord Voldemort, fingió y se ganó la confianza de Dumbledore y así logró pasar desapercibido. Dumbledore fue un hombre brillante, pensé que iba a ser uno de los que llegara al final de la historia pero lamentablemente no fue así. Creo que es una de las muertes –de todas las que he leído- que más me ha sorprendido y afectado. Ya van tres, Dumbledore, Sirius y Cedric. No creo que lo supere nunca.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>Otro aspecto que me sobrecogió fue el hecho de que en este libro nos dan el privilegio de conocer mucho más sobre Tom Ryddle y el por qué es cómo es, su pasado, sus ambiciones, cómo piensa e incluso cómo lucía antes de convertirse en el Señor Tenebroso.<br><br>¿Y qué me dicen de los horrocruxes? Simplemente fantástico, de nuevo nunca te imaginarías algo así; indicador de que J.K Rowling no perdía para nada el factor sorpresa con cada una de las entregas de esta estupenda saga.<br><i>  <b>” La grandeza inspira envidia, la envidia engendra rencor y el rencor genera mentiras.”</b></i><br><br>Hablando de Harry y Ginny: no me gustan mucho juntos y a veces Ginny no era muy de mi agrado por sus actitudes pedantes. Y por otro lado Hermione y Ron ¿hasta cuándo van a esperar? ¡Ya quiero verlos juntos! Es evidente que se quieren muchísimo y no exactamente sólo como amigos. <br><br>Resumiendo este es un libro lleno de momentos que te ponen el corazón a mil y te hacen sufrir pero también momentos para reírse con las ocurrencias de los personajes, es sensacional en todo el sentido de la palabra.<br>Tengo miedo de leer el último libro. Por un lado no quiero que la historia llegue a su fin porque los echaré mucho de menos a todos y por otro lado me da pánico todo lo que pueda llegar a pasar, no quiero ni imaginarme quiénes pueden morir ni cómo va a concluir esta historia tan espectacular.<br><br><i>¡Papanatas! ¡Llorones! ¡Baratijas! ¡Pellizco!</i></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="446981690065275325" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review922798558">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link922798558" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_362649570" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/362649570" />    <a title="Rob" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10743961-rob"><img alt="Rob" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1422270416p2/10743961.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/362649570?book_show_action=false">Feb 03, 2015</a>      <a title="Rob" class="user" name="Rob" href="/user/show/10743961-rob">Rob</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=harry-potter">harry-potter</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=audio-book">audio-book</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=read-before-goodreads">read-before-goodreads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=read-2012">read-2012</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=not-a-bookclub-club">not-a-bookclub-club</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=read-2014">read-2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10743961-rob?shelf=author-female">author-female</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer362649570" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14410988594963891885"><b>Executive Summary:</b> I've gone back and forth on bumping my rating up from 4 to 5. The ending of this book is one of the best in the series but as a whole, I find this book just isn't quite as good as <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a> or <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a>. It's very though, as it's another excellent book.<br /><br /><b>Jim Dale Audio Book:</b> I really want to try the Stephen Fry versions to compare, but Jim Dale has me firmly in his corner as THE way to enjoy these books.<br /><br /><b>Stephen Fry Audio B</b></span>  <span id="freeText14410988594963891885" style="display:none"><b>Executive Summary:</b> I've gone back and forth on bumping my rating up from 4 to 5. The ending of this book is one of the best in the series but as a whole, I find this book just isn't quite as good as <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a> or <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a>. It's very though, as it's another excellent book.<br /><br /><b>Jim Dale Audio Book:</b> I really want to try the Stephen Fry versions to compare, but Jim Dale has me firmly in his corner as THE way to enjoy these books.<br /><br /><b>Stephen Fry Audio Book:</b> Now that I have tried the Stephen Fry versions, I'm still torn. I'll simply revise my opinion at this point to be you can't really go wrong with either narrator in my opinion.<br /><br /><b>  <u>Full Review</u></b><br />I have to start with the end. Possibly one of the largest spoilers of all time. At least in terms of people being upset finding it out before reading it. I remember being at a convention the year this came out and people seemed to be making it a point of yelling <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Snape kills Dumbledore <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. I put that in tags on the very slim chance you either haven't read the book, or somehow avoided that. If you did, I'm impressed. Tell me what your secret is please!<br /><br />People got really creative about this too. I remember someone did a mashup with castaway where Tom Hanks was keeping a copy of the book in that unopened package and then someone flew by the island with the spoiler on a banner behind the plane.<br /><br />I also recall just before the final book came out, people who preordered from Walden books had their choice of bookmark one saying <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Trust Snape <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>, and the other: <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Snape is a very bad man <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. I think I was more in the former camp, than the latter, but it's hard for me to remember anymore.<br /><br />Above all I think this division among readers during what felt like a very long waiting time until <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows__Harry_Potter___7_" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (Harry Potter, #7) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a> came out, is what is best about this book. It is certainly THE cliffhanger of the series.<br /><br />Also, in this book, Ms. Rowling finally starts to reveal some of the deeper secrets of the series as Harry and Dumbledore explore memories of the past.<br /><br />As a grown adult, I find the descriptions of <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Harry's feelings toward Ginny <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> both amusing and nostalgic. I remember having similar feelings when I was I was high school. I don't miss that "monster" as Harry calls it.</span>  <a data-text-id="14410988594963891885" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780747584681" href="/book/show/840699.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17391904-ameliaaxavier?shelf=my-physical-books">my-physical-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17391904-ameliaaxavier?shelf=all-time-favorites">all-time-favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17391904-ameliaaxavier?shelf=fantasy-world">fantasy-world</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17391904-ameliaaxavier?shelf=fav-authors">fav-authors</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17391904-ameliaaxavier?shelf=wrecked-my-soul">wrecked-my-soul</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer741071047" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15325907188628719004"><b>First read: 2006<br>Re-read: Every year I think<br>Readalong: #MYPotteheadsReadathon on January, 2016.</b><br><br>Actual Rating: <u>NO AMOUNT OF STARS CAN RATE HOW AMAZING THIS BOOK IS</u><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1453056025ra/17777199.gif" width="400" height="170" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><s>*a very angsty review below do not read if you're not ready*</s><br><br>I remember when I first read this book. I was such a rebellious teenager keep trying out all my silly phases I want to be u0026amp; it was hilarious! Also, when I first finished this book, I appreciate it a little more because we have a 600 bloody pages of Harry Potter book where Ha</span>  <span id="freeText15325907188628719004" style="display:none"><b>First read: 2006<br>Re-read: Every year I think<br>Readalong: #MYPotteheadsReadathon on January, 2016.</b><br><br>Actual Rating: <u>NO AMOUNT OF STARS CAN RATE HOW AMAZING THIS BOOK IS</u><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1453056025ra/17777199.gif" width="400" height="170" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><s>*a very angsty review below do not read if you're not ready*</s><br><br>I remember when I first read this book. I was such a rebellious teenager keep trying out all my silly phases I want to be u0026amp; it was hilarious! Also, when I first finished this book, I appreciate it a little more because we have a 600 bloody pages of Harry Potter book where Harry focused more on Slytherin characters u0026amp; it made my entire year! The mourning period when I finished this book was so excruciating that I took a day off school because I was busy crying my heart out (the night before) for everything that had happened u0026amp; what about to happened in the last book with all those theories u0026amp; questions keep circling around my mind for so long.<br><br>This year when I finally decided to join the read-along, I never imagined that it'll be more hurtful that previous years.. From the start, I was so excited to re-read this book u0026amp; the moment I was reading it, I never thought of losing one of the casts who portrayed a HUGE u0026amp; IMPORTANT character in my favourite book will be leaving us. A really tragic news for The Potterheads family including JK Rowling. I was clutching the book when I heard about the news u0026amp; it hit me hard. The book used to make me hate Snape so much but after all this years, I understood what he stood for u0026amp; why he did what he did but that didn't mean that I hate Alan himself. He's such a talented person u0026amp; wonderful human being. He brought what Snape really should be to life u0026amp; I will always be grateful for that.<br><br>My 1st memory of Alan Rickman was when I was six (15 years ago). My dad brought me to the Philosopher's Stone screening then we bought the book u0026amp; I ended up reading it that night. The scene I remember most was Snape's potion class u0026amp; I think the reason is because of how scary (at that age) I though Snape was but Alan portrayed his part u0026amp; character amazingly well. It might not seem much to people, but it's my first HP memory u0026amp; it happened to include Alan.<br><br>Gone.. but never forgotten. You'll be remembered as the bravest man we've ever known. You made my childhood more imaginative u0026amp; magical. My thoughts are with his family u0026amp; friends. Rest in peace, Sir Alan Rickman. The world will miss you. Always. Rest, Dear Half-Blood Prince for your soul is amongst the brightest stars in the sky!<br><br>#RIPAlanRickman ♡</span>  <a data-text-id="15325907188628719004" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review741071047">  <td elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1301098177" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1301098177" />    <a title="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm"><img alt="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1364999103p2/7436809.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1301098177?book_show_action=false">Jun 30, 2015</a>      <a title="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" class="user" name="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" href="/user/show/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm">Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747581086" href="/book/show/93124.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=review">review</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1301098177" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13488525089989438484">Warning, this review has spoilers for this book and the entire series.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is the penultimate book and one of my favourite in the series. This book has more romance than any the rest of the Harry Potter series and has a teenage soap opera feel to it. When I first read this book I never guessed that Snape was the Half-Blood Prince and he had such a big role in this book and the next book. <br /><br />Hermione says that love potions are not that dangerous but in the wrong han</span>  <span id="freeText13488525089989438484" style="display:none">Warning, this review has spoilers for this book and the entire series.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is the penultimate book and one of my favourite in the series. This book has more romance than any the rest of the Harry Potter series and has a teenage soap opera feel to it. When I first read this book I never guessed that Snape was the Half-Blood Prince and he had such a big role in this book and the next book. <br /><br />Hermione says that love potions are not that dangerous but in the wrong hands it can be used very unethically and even as a date rape drug. I really liked learning more about Voldemort’s past and how young Tom Riddle became Voldemort. I love the Weasley family as they are kind and warm and the family that Harry had never had. <br /><br />I did find it odd that Harry mourned more for Cedric, an acquaintance and kind of friend, than Sirius, his Godfather and someone he saw as a father figure. But I did like how Harry and Hermione’s friendship grows closer in this book as it always felt Harry was closer to Ron than Hermione. This is the one book which you can tell it was written by a woman, this is because the way Rowling wrote Hermione’s action and reactions to Ron fit perfectly to how most girls would act. <br /><br />One thing is that Harry likes dull chicks, as while Ginny is described as being fun and feisty I just never saw it, and it felt I was told this, not shown it. Also Dumbledore is such a liar as he said he had told Harry everything about Voldemort and Harry, but he really didn’t, and it shows that even after all those years he still believes in The Greater Good (“The Greater Good”). Is it just me or does Professor Slughorn with his bald head and walrus moustache remind you of Jamie from Mythbusters? <br /><br />I love Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince and I would recommend it to anyone who likes this series. <br /><br />This and my other reviews can be found at <a href="http://amethystbookwyrm.blogspot.co.uk/" rel="nofollow">Amethyst Bookwyrm</a><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="13488525089989438484" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1301098177">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1301098177" class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1301098177' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1301098177, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_7691153" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/7691153" />    <a title="Annalisa" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/542037-annalisa"><img alt="Annalisa" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1226336540p2/542037.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/7691153?book_show_action=false">Oct 26, 2007</a>      <a title="Annalisa" class="user" name="Annalisa" href="/user/show/542037-annalisa">Annalisa</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/542037-annalisa?shelf=movies">movies</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer7691153" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5448724250525488828">This has got to be the best cliffhanger ever. There is such power in this book. It is my favorite in the series for one very important reason: since book one, Severus Snape has been my favorite character and this is his book, albeit not his story yet. His power, his intelligence, his confusing range of emotions and allegiance, finally come to full attention. I argued with many a doubter about his motives, and yet in my wildest imagination, I could not have justified him as well as Rowling does</span>  <span id="freeText5448724250525488828" style="display:none">This has got to be the best cliffhanger ever. There is such power in this book. It is my favorite in the series for one very important reason: since book one, Severus Snape has been my favorite character and this is his book, albeit not his story yet. His power, his intelligence, his confusing range of emotions and allegiance, finally come to full attention. I argued with many a doubter about his motives, and yet in my wildest imagination, I could not have justified him as well as Rowling does is book 7. <br /><br />Even knowing the ending beforehand, I still found myself wanting more in the inadequate moments between Harry and Dumbledore. The sense of longing was perfectly planted for our heightened frustration and sadness in the end. I figured it was going to happen anyway, but it still got me. Rowling pulls you into these characters' lives. You are at Hogwarts mourning, afraid, alone with the lot of them. Even the emotional conclusion of book 7 did not affect the same power of emotion in readers you find in book 6. But more than wishing for more time for Harry, I wanted (needed) to understand the anger and sadness in Snape's verbal attack. That is the beauty of book 6 is the ambiguity of it.<br /><br />Initially I was frustrated between the summarizing instead of detailed accounts Rowling uses in every other book, but it correlates perfectly with the ambiguity of the story. This one got people talking (all I wanted to do after reading it was discuss). It left room for interpretation. Most importantly it left us impossibly waiting for a series conclusion. I reread book 6 a week before the release of book 7 and my anticipation was so high even those few days of waiting were agony. </span>  <a data-text-id="5448724250525488828" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review7691153">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link7691153" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=7691153u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_7691153'><a id="like_count_review_7691153" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/7691153?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">7 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_7691153" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_7691153" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=7u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=7u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=7691153u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/7691153?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=7">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_7691153' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/7691153/comments?reverse=true">View 1 comment</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div></div><div class="uitext" style="float: right; + encodeURIComponent(u0026#39;Y++P4xbrEF2D8ArQpDN/yWdcvySGqsyNV+MTqklLL7PpGrrw5QV/0/+eWZAfR2h0TH7ub5tJ5zFIJ6J2DsutAg==u0026#39;)}); return false;">6</a> <em class="current">7</em> <a rel="next" href="#" onclick="new Ajax.Request(u0026#39;/book/reviews/1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince?authenticity_token=349RwwmhiZp8XweSUEJo1FghwB1Td7dUX00L3fi5lktVemTQ%2Bk%2FmFAAxVNLrNn9pcwORVk6UnOhAiboBvzkU%2Bg%3D%3Du0026amp;amp;hide_last_page=trueu0026amp;amp;page=8u0026#39;, {asynchronous:true, evalScripts:true, method:u0026#39;getu0026#39;, parameters:u0026#39;authenticity_token=u0026#39; class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_973810244" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/973810244" />    <a title="Mohammad Mahdi" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22346919-mohammad-mahdi"><img alt="Mohammad Mahdi" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1409298453p2/22346919.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/973810244?book_show_action=false">Apr 09, 2015</a>      <a title="Mohammad Mahdi" class="user" name="Mohammad Mahdi" href="/user/show/22346919-mohammad-mahdi">Mohammad Mahdi</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22346919-mohammad-mahdi?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22346919-mohammad-mahdi?shelf=%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%AA%D8%B2%DB%8C">فانتزی</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22346919-mohammad-mahdi?shelf=epic">epic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22346919-mohammad-mahdi?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22346919-mohammad-mahdi?shelf=translated">translated</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer973810244" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14410369481021503045">با این که کلی کتاب نخونده داشتم یهو هوس کردم این جلدو بخونم . این جلدو از همه کمتر خونده بودم واسه همین دوباره خوندمش :)<br />انقدر خوشحال بودم که دوباره میتونستم توی هاگوارتز بپلکم و سر کلاسای درس حاضر بشم :)<br />متاسفانه من هیچ وقت اونقدری که نویسنده میخواست از اسنیپ متنفر نشدم چون جلدا رو به ترتیب نخوندم ، جلد هفتو خیلی زود خوندم واسه همین جلد شیش واسم قابل فهم بود همه مسایل گنگش . با این حال بازم فرقی برام نمیکرد همین که تونستم بازم یه گشتی تو دنیای جادویی بزنم برام کافی بود . من هیچ وقت این مجموعه رو</span>  <span id="freeText14410369481021503045" style="display:none">با این که کلی کتاب نخونده داشتم یهو هوس کردم این جلدو بخونم . این جلدو از همه کمتر خونده بودم واسه همین دوباره خوندمش :)<br />انقدر خوشحال بودم که دوباره میتونستم توی هاگوارتز بپلکم و سر کلاسای درس حاضر بشم :)<br />متاسفانه من هیچ وقت اونقدری که نویسنده میخواست از اسنیپ متنفر نشدم چون جلدا رو به ترتیب نخوندم ، جلد هفتو خیلی زود خوندم واسه همین جلد شیش واسم قابل فهم بود همه مسایل گنگش . با این حال بازم فرقی برام نمیکرد همین که تونستم بازم یه گشتی تو دنیای جادویی بزنم برام کافی بود . من هیچ وقت این مجموعه رو واسه این نخوندم که ببینم آخرش هری چیکار میکنه با ولدمورت ، برای هاگوارتز خوندم برای راهرو های پیچ در پیچو تابلو های متحرکو جو رازآلودشو کلاس های جادوییش <br />هنوزم هروقت حوصلم سر میره یکی از جلداشو بر میدارم همینطوری از وسط باز میکنم شروع میکنم به خوندن و فرقی نمیکنه از کجا شروع کنم چون اغلب سکانسا و دیالوگا رو به خوبی یادمه و میدونم برای چی گفته شدن <br />بدون شک کار خانم اسلامیه هم فوق العاده بود . من کار چند مترجم دیگه هم دیده بودم هیچ کسی به روونی خانم اسلامیه ترجمه نکرده بود بقیه فقط بهش به چشم یه کار ترجمه نگاه میکردن ولی خانم اسلامیه خود داستان براش جالب و مهم بود اینو میشد از توضیحاتی که اول یا آخر بعضی کتابا میداد متوجه شد . همچنین از معادل سازی خیلی از کلمات که تو فارسی به همون شکل بی معنی بودن و خیلی از مترجما خود همونا رو به کار میبردن .</span>  <a data-text-id="14410369481021503045" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="/user/show/14698204-gazella"><img alt="Gazella" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454760565p2/14698204.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1133195408?book_show_action=false">Dec 28, 2014</a>      <a title="Gazella" class="user" name="Gazella" href="/user/show/14698204-gazella">Gazella</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14698204-gazella?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1133195408" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1308308644135470789">Just finished reading <i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i>. Wow! Loved it! Excellently paced. The characters, as usual, are amazing and perfectly written. This is a much darker and more mature book. It had moments of intense drama and I would also say a bit of comedy. I was left wondering the entire time <i>who</i> the Half-Blood Prince is?! I never would have guessed! I found all that teenage angst and agonizing over relationships -albeit accurately portrayed- a bit tedious and tiresome. Voldemort's</span>  <span id="freeText1308308644135470789" style="display:none">Just finished reading <i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i>. Wow! Loved it! Excellently paced. The characters, as usual, are amazing and perfectly written. This is a much darker and more mature book. It had moments of intense drama and I would also say a bit of comedy. I was left wondering the entire time <i>who</i> the Half-Blood Prince is?! I never would have guessed! I found all that teenage angst and agonizing over relationships -albeit accurately portrayed- a bit tedious and tiresome. Voldemort's backstory was very intriguing. <br /><br />That said, the sixth book is not the best in the series in my opinion, but it's very, very good in its own right. So far, I like <i>The Prisoner of Azkaban</i> and <i>The Goblet of Fire</i> best. But still, <b>The Half-Blood Prince</b> is a terrific book and the rest are excellent. I cannot wait to read the finale. However, it won't be my next read because I don't want the series to end just yet. They've been insanely entertaining and enchanting reads.</span>  <a data-text-id="1308308644135470789" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1530449213" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11888302989872104834">Rating: 5 stars<br /><br />After finishing this book for the second time, I'm in tears. Everything that happened in this book was wonderfully written, and everything which was left hanging in previous books has been wrapped up nicely in preparation for the final installment. The characters were amazing as always, and the ending was satisfactorily saddening. I can't really put my feelings into words.<br />If you haven't read Harry Potter yet, I strongly advise it. This series will make you feel warm, make you incr</span>  <span id="freeText11888302989872104834" style="display:none">Rating: 5 stars<br /><br />After finishing this book for the second time, I'm in tears. Everything that happened in this book was wonderfully written, and everything which was left hanging in previous books has been wrapped up nicely in preparation for the final installment. The characters were amazing as always, and the ending was satisfactorily saddening. I can't really put my feelings into words.<br />If you haven't read Harry Potter yet, I strongly advise it. This series will make you feel warm, make you incredibly sad, make you laugh out loud, think about the plot, reexamine your goals and relationships, and make you unbelievably glad you've read it.</span>  <a data-text-id="11888302989872104834" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1705517238" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5146631166857230258">This was the first time I had read this particular book in the series, and honestly I have to say that it's my favorite so far! <br /><br />Despite everything that happened in the book (specifically at the end, of course), for some reason I seemed to enjoy this one above the others. I think Ron and Hermione's bickering and back-and-forth banter helped though ;) And of course the more of Dumbledore that we got to see! <br /><br />All in all I loved this book! (I did feel that Harry and Ginny's relationship, though I kne</span>  <span id="freeText5146631166857230258" style="display:none">This was the first time I had read this particular book in the series, and honestly I have to say that it's my favorite so far! <br /><br />Despite everything that happened in the book (specifically at the end, of course), for some reason I seemed to enjoy this one above the others. I think Ron and Hermione's bickering and back-and-forth banter helped though ;) And of course the more of Dumbledore that we got to see! <br /><br />All in all I loved this book! (I did feel that Harry and Ginny's relationship, though I knew it was coming, did pop up sort of out of nowhere...did anyone else feel this way?) </span>  <a data-text-id="5146631166857230258" bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"      <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc?shelf=read-in-2015">read-in-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer932194026" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16750674502808022877">feels. that's all i can say.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review932194026">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link932194026" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=932194026u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_932194026'><a id="like_count_review_932194026" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/932194026?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_932194026" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_932194026" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=9u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=932194026u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_932194026' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 932194026, true, '')">Write a elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_106727820" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/106727820" />    <a title="Apokripos" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1662951-apokripos"><img alt="Apokripos" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1441699987p2/1662951.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/106727820?book_show_action=false">Jun 28, 2010</a>      <a title="Apokripos" class="user" name="Apokripos" href="/user/show/1662951-apokripos">Apokripos</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439784542" href="/book/show/49852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Potter Fans, who else?!</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Apokripos by: </span>      the "Voice"  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=action">action</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=fiction-contemporary">fiction-contemporary</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=award-winning-books">award-winning-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=from-book-to-film">from-book-to-film</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=adventure">adventure</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1662951-apokripos?shelf=dark-chest-of-wonders">dark-chest-of-wonders</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer106727820u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer106727820" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5379196935314441949"><blockquote> <b>Dark Times Ahead<br>(A Book Review of <i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i> by J.K. Rowling)</b> </blockquote><br><br><br><b>**Read at your own risk**</b><br><br><br>All is not going pretty well in the wizarding world.<br><br>As dark forces gather, no one and no place is safe. Wizards and witches are being kidnapped, attacked at every turn and some murdered in cold blood. The obituary pages of the <i>Daily Prophet</i> are browsed with as much frequency as the headlines. Nasty turns of events are also felt by the Muggle government as Lord Voldemort and his coh</span>  <span id="freeText5379196935314441949" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <b>Dark Times Ahead<br>(A Book Review of <i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i> by J.K. Rowling)</b></blockquote><br><br><br><b>**Read at your own risk**</b><br><br><br>All is not going pretty well in the wizarding world.<br><br>As dark forces gather, no one and no place is safe. Wizards and witches are being kidnapped, attacked at every turn and some murdered in cold blood. The obituary pages of the <i>Daily Prophet</i> are browsed with as much frequency as the headlines. Nasty turns of events are also felt by the Muggle government as Lord Voldemort and his cohorts wreak havoc on the non magical population. The Ministry of Magic, on the contrary, is doing one hell of a bad job from preventing these and doing all it can to cover up their inadequacies — much to the chagrin of the wizarding community.<br><br>However, for Harry, Ron and Hermione, life must go on. In their sixth year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, on the prospect of choosing a future career path, they will learn how to Apparate; will have their (yet again) new Defense Against the Dark Arts, as well as, Potions teacher; and like any regular teens undergoing adolescence will learn to fall in and out of love — flirtations and stalkers included. Still, there are far more that Harry is preoccupied with. For one, there’s Dumbledore’s badly injured hand which he declines to explain and his frequent absences from Hogwarts. Moreover, Harry receives helpful advices from a battered Potions book annotated by someone enigmatically named as the Half-Blood Prince.<br><br>The beauty of the Harry Potter series is in its structure: with every succeeding volume as we follow Harry through his schooling with his bunch of friends, devoted fans and readers grows along with them. Its genius lies in its utterly captivating magical alternate world of wands and flying broomsticks and as the book’s pages and plot alike thickens, it expands our wonder and amazement at J.K. Rowling’s wicked inventiveness. Constantly present in all the six books I’ve read so far is Rowling’s deftness in creating a character-driven story that engagingly melds a coming-of-age narrative with a dash of action-thrilling scenes interwoven with elements of a quest tale and intriguing mystery to boot. To read her books is like tumbling down a rabbit hole of half-remembered childhood delight, of being under a spell akin to discovering the joys of reading such a good book for the first time.<br><br>Taking center stage in the sixth volume is Lord Voldemort’s back story from his infamous predecessors; the circumstances surrounding his birth; how he came about his prodigious capacities; his schooling at Hogwarts; his continuing interest and gravitation toward the dark arts; up to how he ultimately reinvented himself as the Dark Lord, whom everyone fears, that Harry discovers via the magical device called the Pensieve, a repository for people’s memories, with Dumbledore as his guide. Right now I’m still marveling how cleverly Rowling used this enchanted tool, fusing it as a narrative contrivance to tell us these flashbacks, which I think was employed rather too much, but with the way she teases our minds with tidbits of clues makes me forgive her at that.<br><br><i>Prince</i> is definitely treading on darker grounds and, being one with others who noticed earlier, the occurrences depicted in the book do strike some resemblances to our paranoid times besieged with constant threats of terrorism. Students pass through a sensor (which Rowling called a “Probity Probe”) upon entering or leaving school grounds. Stan Shunpike, a character introduced in the third book as the Knight Bus’s conductor, was arrested in a Guantanamo-style preventive detention on the basis of being a Death Eater without even substantial evidence. Then there’s the Horcruxes which can be made by splitting one’s soul through the act of murder that rendered Lord Voldemort near-immortal and one of the reasons why he’s still alive after the curse trying to kill baby Harry backfired. Well, how more evil can you get than that?<br><br>Of course one of the memorable and saddest parts of the book is Prof. Dumbledore’s untimely demise which makes this installment the most unsettling and emotionally-charged thus far. At first there’s denial, but as the sudden realization sinks in, you really can’t do anything but accept it. It’s such an emotional blow to Harry and the readers that such a noble character, being the most powerful wizard of the age and the only one feared by the Dark Lord, is also susceptible, all too mortal like us.<br><br>Harry is tougher now, in complete control of his temper and emotions and unafraid to challenge authority figures. One of the scenes that I really liked is when he nonchalantly and frankly declines the offer of the new Minister of Magic, Rufus Scrimgeour, to be the Ministry’s poster boy. All too well aware of loss and death, no one can endure such hardships without being altered, and Harry is no exception. His responsibility of being the “Chosen One” coupled with his growing reputation as the symbol of hope tasked to vanquish Lord Voldemort makes him increasingly isolated; causing him to sacrifice his romantic involvement with Ginny Weasley given the dangers he would have to face and the burden of playing the role of a lone hero. More than asserting himself of being a “Dumbledore’s man through and through” he must learn to be his own. Only by seeking his own identity armed and protected by his ability to love, might be his only slim chance to overcome the looming dark tide of war. It’s such a shame that he sees his capacity to show human tenderness as both a distraction and a weakness, though this attribute, in reality, distinguishes him from his evil adversary as Dumbledore pointed out.<br><br>Watching the movie first took most of the fun I could have had derived from reading the book. Actually, this one has become a perfunctory reading for me just to be reminded of the plot points (that the screen adaptation brazenly dispense with) as I prepare myself for the highly-anticipated final book in the series. Yet when I started to speculate, think of what might happen to Harry, of what’s in store for him in his quest to destroy the Hocruxes amd his eventual battle with Lord Voldemort in the seventh book is where, I think, the <i>real</i> fun starts. If, in reading this book review bored you enough, then let me tickle your brains with enough questions that remain and begs to be answered:<br><br><blockquote>· Where does Snape’s loyalty lie? Is he really a Death Eater or in fact acting as a double agent for the Order of the Phoenix? For Snape haters they maybe resigned to the former but as I’ve come to learn from reading this series, nothing and no one is what it seemed to be. I’m hoping that he’ll redeem his character and may have some credible explanation why he did what he has to do in this novel.<br><br>· Is the locket referred to in passing in the fifth book the same as the fake one Harry and Dumbledore found in the cave? If so, then who got it now? Does Kreacher have it since he’s the caretaker of 12 Grimmauld Place or was it stolen by Mundungus Fletcher?<br><br>· And who is this person with the mysterious initials R. A. B. that switched the real locket with a fake one? What is his agenda for doing this? Will Harry be able to speak with him or has he taken his story to the grave?<br><br>· How will Harry proceed now without Dumbledore to guide him and as clueless as it was in the beginning to the whereabouts of the remaining Horcruxes? What were James and Lily Potter were like when tragedy hadn’t befallen them yet? Furthermore, what are the similarities and circumstances that connect Harry to Lord Voldemort that’s left to be uncovered?</blockquote><br><br>More than being an exciting denouement and the penultimate in the series, Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is a good introduction to the last and final book. Like previous books we still hunger to know more about these characters that we’ve grown so much to love, following their fate that’s inextricably tied to the two wizards that will shape wizarding history to come. I’m still clueless how the series will be heading.<br><br>As the story grips us spellbound, I’m sure we’ll still be gaping, enchanted and bracing for more…<br><br><br>_____________<br>Published by Scholastic Inc. (Hardcover First American Edition, July 2005)<br>652 pages<br>Started: June 14, 2010<br>Finished: June 21, 2010<br>My Rating: ♦ ♦ ♦ ♦<br></span>  <a data-text-id="5379196935314441949" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_106727820'><a id="like_count_review_106727820" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/106727820?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">6 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_106727820" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_106727820" ref="like" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=6u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=106727820u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span
