 </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1693736386" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1693736386" />    <a title="Caidyn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13614926-caidyn"><img alt="Caidyn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477630172p2/13614926.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1693736386?book_show_action=false">Jul 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Caidyn" class="user" name="Caidyn" href="/user/show/13614926-caidyn">Caidyn</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582995" href="/book/show/17347380-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=juvenile-fiction">juvenile-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=fantasy-scifi">fantasy-scifi</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13614926-caidyn?shelf=harry-potter-5ever">harry-potter-5ever</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1693736386" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9497638618059152963">Although this wasn't the first Harry Potter book I read on my own, it's the only book I have a memory of reading for the first time. I'm sure I've written about it in a review before, but I'm going to recount it -- briefly -- here. We were in Japan, on a night train. (I already felt pretty magical, being in a foreign place AND being on a night train meant I could pretend I was on the Knight Bus.) Shut myself up with this book, and the only memory I have is of eagerly reading u0026quot;The Caveu0026quot;, vividly</span>  <span id="freeText9497638618059152963" style="display:none">Although this wasn't the first Harry Potter book I read on my own, it's the only book I have a memory of reading for the first time. I'm sure I've written about it in a review before, but I'm going to recount it -- briefly -- here. We were in Japan, on a night train. (I already felt pretty magical, being in a foreign place AND being on a night train meant I could pretend I was on the Knight Bus.) Shut myself up with this book, and the only memory I have is of eagerly reading "The Cave", vividly imagining myself there, too, with Harry and Dumbledore, battling the Inferni.<br /><br />This is my favorite Harry Potter book. The memories, the feeling of it really coming together more, the story and the mystery on two levels. Who is the Half-Blood Prince? What is Malfoy up to? It enticed me as a child, and still gets me to this very day.<br /><br />It's a great book, and it shows JK's real depth of knowledge with this series. I can't imagine the world-building she did for this series, and every time I read it I find it utterly incredible to see little details that show it again and again.<br /><br />Now that I've gotten the gushing out of the way, the rest of my review is going to be focused on a character. I ran a poll for this, because I couldn't decide. The poll results were that I talk about my opinions and feelings about Dumbledore. Aka, this is where I spoil book seven if you haven't read it already, and maybe also make you hate me a bit.<br /><br />I have a real love/hate relationship with Dumbledore's character now that I'm older. When I was younger, I was very much like Harry; I was in awe of Dumbledore, and I thought he could do no wrong. As I grew, I still felt that, but I also could see things that he shouldn't have done. I still thought he was a great character, a trustworthy one. Now, I'm very conflicted. Throughout this series, I've been reading for Dumbledore's character, and I can honestly say I feel more enlightened now that I have. <br /><br />Yet, I'm conflicted. On one hand, I see Dumbledore as an amazing mentor who is flawed, but aren't all adults? He made some bad choices, ones that haunted him for the rest of his life and, again, what adult hasn't done that? Then, on the other hand I see him, again, as very flawed. However, I see him as power hungry. Not in the political sphere, but in another way. Knowledge. Defeating people. And, what we discover about his past in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/136251.Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows__Harry_Potter___7_" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (Harry Potter, #7) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a> doesn't make that feeling go away, merely strengthen it.<br /><br />One of my favorite things, which ties into this, on the internet with theories is about The Three Brothers analogy. Voldemort is the first, power hungry, brother. Snape is the second brother, who pines for the past. Harry is the third brother, who welcomes Death as an old friend. And Dumbledore is Death. It's a great analogy.<br /><br />I can see pieces of Dumbledore in all of them.<br /><br />Voldemort, of course, is extremely power hungry. But, he and Dumbledore are, in a way, alike. As we find out in the final book, we know that Dumbledore was involved with another dark wizard. He agreed that wizards are best and Muggles need to be, slightly, put in their place. He plotted a takeover. The power got to his head, as you see it happen throughout the series in front of you. Dumbledore and finding out that Voldemort has his body back; a new challenge, something new to take down. Dumbledore and the Horcruxes. Dumbledore and the Deathly Hallows. He is <i>drawn</i> to power. Perhaps he doesn't want it for himself, but it entices him. Which makes him somewhat like Voldemort.<br /><br />On the other hand, Dumbledore is incredibly like Snape. Snape will have a whole review dedicated to him, don't worry. He pines for the past, which people know if you've read the whole series. Dumbledore does as well. He never forgives himself for involving himself with a dark wizard and the terrible outcome of that: His sister's death. In "The Cave" chapter, you see that so vividly, and it honestly hurts to read it. You can imagine that anguish, that deep hatred for yourself. And... it hurts.<br /><br />And, finally, there's Harry. Dumbledore welcomes death. He is not afraid of it, seeing it as an inevitable end and the next great adventure. After so many years of escaping it, he finally meets it because there's no other way.<br /><br />Dumbledore is one of the most complex characters I've met in a children's book. When you're young, you can see him as perfect. The older you get, the more flaws you see. It's incredible what JK Rowling created, and I don't ever think I'll be able to put a finger on exactly how I feel about him.</span>  <a data-text-id="9497638618059152963" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1693736386">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1693736386" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1693736386u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1693736386'><a id="like_count_review_1693736386" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1693736386?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">7 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1693736386" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1693736386" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=7u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1693736386u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1693736386" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1693736386, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">2 comments</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1693736386?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=8">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1693736386' style='display: none;'><div id="comment_154241973" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Charlie Fenton" href="/user/show/32247950-charlie-fenton"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442515132p1/32247950.jpg" alt="32247950" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/32247950-charlie-fenton">Charlie Fenton</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer10986520472728711248">You know its only just clicked for me as to why Snape was so hard on Neville. You said previously thats why you didn't like him, despite his</span>  <span id="freeText10986520472728711248" style="display:none">You know its only just clicked for me as to why Snape was so hard on Neville. You said previously thats why you didn't like him, despite his redemptions with Harry in the end. He probably was hard on Neville because he could have been the chosen one, which meant Lily could have been spared, and resented him for that. I know its not right as it isn't Neville's fault, but that has just kinda clicked for me haha</span>  <a data-text-id="10986520472728711248" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jul 15, 2016 02:44AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_154243292" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Caidyn" href="/user/show/13614926-caidyn"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477630172p1/13614926.jpg" alt="13614926" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/13614926-caidyn">Caidyn</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer18033233976558894304">Yes, that's one of the reasons. class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1376668821" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1376668821" />    <a title="Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat"><img alt="Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1458308353p2/6759885.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1376668821?book_show_action=false">Jul 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)" class="user" name="Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)" href="/user/show/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat">Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat?shelf=made-me-cry">made-me-cry</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat?shelf=5-star">5-star</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1376668821" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15989191291495987722"><a href="http://novelheartbeat.com" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1422374869i/13493565.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><p> CAUTION: SPOILERS <br>I actually can't believe I'm on the last book already. I was always intimidated by the size of this series (and the size of the books in it), but it has flown by! So fast in fact that I don't want it to end. I am in awe at how much this series has gotten under my skin! I've tried to read other things in between, instead of just binge reading, but I've found that I have trouble getting into anything else because all I can think about is continuing the series. And I know I'm go</p></span>  <span id="freeText15989191291495987722" style="display:none"><a href="http://novelheartbeat.com" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1422374869i/13493565.png" width="400" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><p>  CAUTION: SPOILERS  <br>I actually can't believe I'm on the last book already. I was always intimidated by the size of this series (and the size of the books in it), but it has flown by! So fast in fact that I don't want it to end. I am in awe at how much this series has gotten under my skin! I've tried to read other things in between, instead of just binge reading, but I've found that I have trouble getting into anything else because all I can think about is continuing the series. And I know I'm going to have a book hangover from this series! It's definitely special, and it's going to be hard to read something that compares after this!  <br><br>I have to say I was kind of underwhelmed with the reveal of Snape being the Prince. I mean, it made sense after Hermione explained it, but there wasn't really a big revelation there. It was just kind of like, Oh, I'm the Half Blood Prince...and then was barely mentioned again even though the book is named after him and the Prince's book was a major part of the whole story.  <br><br>Also DUMBLEDORE OMG. I had trouble believing it at first, which is ridiculous - I remember his death very clearly in the movie, so I *knew* he was dead but even still, it didn't seem real! I still can't get over it. I did eventually start crying when they were all talking about it, and again at his funeral. I CANNOT DEAL. *sobs*  <br><br>FINALLY, Harry and Ginny get together! I didn't realize how late in the series it happened. I kept waiting for it! Also, I kinda wanted to bash Ron's and Hermione's heads together. They clearly have the hots for each other!   <br><br>Something I absolutely love about this series is that there is never a love triangle between Ron, Hermione, and Harry. Harry and Hermione are never more than just best friends. It's so rare to see platonic love in stories, and I wish there was more of it! Boys and girls CAN just be friends, people. I love that Harry and Hermione prove it. And it's absolutely beautiful! They are as close as brother and sister and I love it so much! I think their friendship is one of my favorites in fiction. I want a platonic friendship as deep as they have.  <br></p>   Favorite quotes <br><em>  "And now, Harry, let us step out into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure."</em><br><br><br><b>This review was originally posted on Novel Heartbeat. To see a breakdown of my assessment, please visit the full review <a href="http://novelheartbeat.com/2015/11/review-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince-by-j-k-rowling/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</b></span>  <a data-text-id="15989191291495987722" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div       </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1704691728" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12358959338870450402">This might be a disappointment to some of HP fans, for the lack of action in it, and might be a trophy to the other fans.<br /><br />As I said, it's the least action-packed book in the series by far, it wasn't a physical activity what Harry was going through, but a mental one. He had a lot of things going on, questions he asked himself repeatedly, but this time he had to squeeze his mind for answers before it's too late.<br /><br />I would like to think that after knowing Voldemort's past we all now understand him a li</span>  <span id="freeText12358959338870450402" style="display:none">This might be a disappointment to some of HP fans, for the lack of action in it, and might be a trophy to the other fans.<br /><br />As I said, it's the least action-packed book in the series by far, it wasn't a physical activity what Harry was going through, but a mental one. He had a lot of things going on, questions he asked himself repeatedly, but this time he had to squeeze his mind for answers before it's too late.<br /><br />I would like to think that after knowing Voldemort's past we all now understand him a little bit better, for this book was all about Tom Riddle's history and what are the theories Professor Dumbledore made from Tom's behaviors.<br /><br />Now, after finishing The Half-Blood Prince, I have to read The Deathly Hallows, which is an easy thing to start doing, because I'm eager to know what would happen next, and a very hard mission to accomplish, because I also don't want it to end, I don't want to leave Hogwarts *sob*.</span>  <a data-text-id="12358959338870450402" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1704691728">  <td itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1007693698" />    <a title="Carolina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30366554-carolina"><img alt="Carolina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466992777p2/30366554.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1007693698?book_show_action=false">Nov 11, 2016</a>      <a title="Carolina" class="user" name="Carolina" href="/user/show/30366554-carolina">Carolina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788478889914" href="/book/show/10611639-harry-potter-y-el-misterio-del-pr-ncipe">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30366554-carolina?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30366554-carolina?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30366554-carolina?shelf=a-jk-rowling">a-jk-rowling</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30366554-carolina?shelf=leer-al-menos-una-vez-en-la-vida">leer-al-menos-una-vez-en-la-vida</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30366554-carolina?shelf=series-y-sagas">series-y-sagas</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30366554-carolina?shelf=b-para-los-no-tan-peque%C3%B1os">b-para-los-no-tan-pequeños</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1007693698" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer188093426776855458">Definitivamente el libro más emocionante y doloroso <s>hasta ahora</s>. Yo ya presentía la tragedia desde el primer capítulo y aún así sentí que el corazón se me partía en mil pedacitos al final. La historia es todavía más oscura que las anteriores y donde (igual que Harry, que es de lo que más me gusta de estos libros) nos vamos enterando de todo lo que nos llevó hasta ese punto. Es una historia totalmente trágica y triste.<br><br>De los detalles que más me emocionan es que tiene mayor importancia uno de mis</span>  <span id="freeText188093426776855458" style="display:none">Definitivamente el libro más emocionante y doloroso <s>hasta ahora</s>. Yo ya presentía la tragedia desde el primer capítulo y aún así sentí que el corazón se me partía en mil pedacitos al final. La historia es todavía más oscura que las anteriores y donde (igual que Harry, que es de lo que más me gusta de estos libros) nos vamos enterando de todo lo que nos llevó hasta ese punto. Es una historia totalmente trágica y triste.<br><br>De los detalles que más me emocionan es que tiene mayor importancia uno de mis profesores favoritos desde el principio de la saga: <b>Snape</b>. Como dije en <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/1118028.Harry_Potter_Y_La_Piedra_Filosofal__Harry_Potter___1_" title="Harry Potter Y La Piedra Filosofal (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling">La Piedra Filosofal</a>, nunca supe bien que fue lo que me hizo elegirlo como mi profesor favorito (quizá el que fuera Jefe de <i>mi</i> Casa), pero realmente me molestaba que aunque aparecía seguido, no fuera importante para la historia. Y con este libro quedé más que satisfecha en este punto. Ni que decir de <s>mi amado y eterno crush potterico</s> Draco. [Les juro que a pesar de considerar que Slytherin es la mejor Casa que existe, y ser fan de Draco y Snape, no pertenezco al lado oscuro XD]<br><br>Realmente hubo cosas con las que sentía que me moría de tristeza (quizá exagero, pero sí fue deprimente) y otras que me encantaron. Este libro me tuvo al borde de las emociones, del llanto y del asiento desde el principio.<br><br>Para ver el resto de la saga <b>  <i> Harry Potter</i></b>:<br><br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/1118028.Harry_Potter_Y_La_Piedra_Filosofal__Harry_Potter___1_" title="Harry Potter Y La Piedra Filosofal (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1266722221s/1118028.jpg" alt="Harry Potter Y La Piedra Filosofal (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1301209236s/1016902.jpg" alt="Harry Potter y la cámara secreta (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a> <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/72429.Harry_Potter_Y_El_Prisionero_De_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_" title="Harry Potter Y El Prisionero De Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1451104139s/72429.jpg" alt="Harry Potter Y El Prisionero De Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1007693698" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1007693698" ref="like" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=6u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1007693698u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1007693698" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1007693698, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">comment</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1007693698?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=8">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1007693698' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1007693698' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1007693698, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1087526213" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1087526213" />    <a title="ellemaddy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/34871872-ellemaddy"><img alt="ellemaddy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476541603p2/34871872.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1087526213?book_show_action=false">Aug 24, 2016</a>      <a title="ellemaddy" class="user" name="ellemaddy" href="/user/show/34871872-ellemaddy">ellemaddy</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9781408855706" href="/book/show/22844202-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=the-motherfucking-best">the-motherfucking-best</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=childhood-reads">childhood-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=always-makes-me-happy">always-makes-me-happy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=gives-me-goosebumps">gives-me-goosebumps</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=read-2015">read-2015</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34871872-ellemaddy?shelf=own-a-copy">own-a-copy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1087526213" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9789018669867584099"><i>“As he lay there, he became aware suddenly that the grounds were silent. Fawkes had stopped singing.<br />And he knew, without knowing how he knew it, that the phoenix had gone, had left Hogwarts for good, just as Dumbledore had left the school, had left the world … had left Harry.” </i><br /><br />Goodness, I got goosebumps. The last fifty pages were super intense.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is my third favourite from the series and I have my reason. In this book Snape finally got what he wanted aka the D</span>  <span id="freeText9789018669867584099" style="display:none"><i>“As he lay there, he became aware suddenly that the grounds were silent. Fawkes had stopped singing.<br />And he knew, without knowing how he knew it, that the phoenix had gone, had left Hogwarts for good, just as Dumbledore had left the school, had left the world … had left Harry.” </i><br /><br />Goodness, I got goosebumps. The last fifty pages were super intense.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is my third favourite from the series and I have my reason. In this book Snape finally got what he wanted aka the DADA post meanwhile Harry has taken a private lesson with Dumbledore to learn more about Voldemort’s background and childhood. Voldemort, despite being a villainous piece of shit, is actually an interesting character. Unlike most villains in children’s books (is Harry Potter even a children book, though? It’s more, YA, i think?) Voldemort is actually dangerous and well.. a villain. He kills, he tortures, he steals, and he done it so well. He actually act like a true villain and to read about his childhood and his history, it was quite a ride. In this book we’re also introduced to the Horcrux (which will lead to a satisfying but devastating conclusion in the next book) and that Harry actually had came across the Horcrux before (the diary in chamber of secret). So near the ending of the book Dumbledore and Harry went off to find one of the Horcrux and when they got back to Hogwarts they found the dark marks glowing bright. Then the worst thing happen, Snape killed Dumbledore. If you haven’t read book 7 you will be furious because all your worst suspicion about Snape finally came true. (But if you have read book 7 you will understand that killing Dumbledore wasn’t easy for him nor was it his decision). I was so sad when Hagrid found Dumbledore’s death (his death itself wasn’t that sad for me). Hagrid had always said about how much of a good man Dumbledore was, he trusted him, looked up to him, loved him even. I don’t like to think about how devastating it was for Hagrid to be the one who had to carry Dumbledore away, to hold his lifeless body. I know, I know, I’m getting melancholic, a bit emotional too, but it’s bound to happen everytime I talk about something Harry Potter related.<br /><br />Once again I have to say that I’m glad I got on the HP bandwagon when I was a kid. This feeling I am feeling right now isn’t something I could feel towards books I read just recently. I can’t quite describe it. Sometimes it is sadness, longing, and joy all mixed into one which I can only relate to something I love from my childhood. Is it nostalgia? Yes, i think it is. And this book is literally perfect. I couldn't find a single flaw at all and I probably will never change my mind about this.<br /><br />An Update:<br /><br />Last read December 9-11 2015<br />Listened to the audiobook 22-24 august 2016<br />Cried about 384746 times.</span>  <a data-text-id="9789018669867584099" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1087526213">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1087526213" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1087526213u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1087526213'><a id="like_count_review_1087526213" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1087526213?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">6 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1087526213" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1087526213" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=6u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=8u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1087526213u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1087526213" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1087526213, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1753317954" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15789223403712789656">My heart hurts. I've never identified with Harry as much as this book. Glad to see Ginny be more.. Ginny and the twins were always a pleasure when encountered. <br /><br />This is one of the very few times I wish I'd never seen the movies or just read the books sooner because it must have been a real experience to not know the reasons behind Snape's actions in this book. <br /><br />5 stars for obvious reasons.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1277538097?book_show_action=false">May 19, 2015</a>      <a title="Banny Carolina" class="user" name="Banny Carolina" href="/user/show/19835637-banny-carolina">Banny Carolina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439784542" href="/book/show/49852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19835637-banny-carolina?shelf=le%C3%ADdo-en-ingl%C3%A9s">leído-en-inglés</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1277538097" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15264277710942823420"><b>Perfection</b><br><br>I just read the last one hundred or so pages like<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1432075464ra/14897513.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And then I closed the book like<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1432075957ra/14897543.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Because my emotions were in a roller coaster and it was amazing.</b><br>Rowling just made me feel everything in this book, I was loving, laughing, crying, sobbing and the book moves in a perfect pace it never bored me, in fact I didn't want it to end.<br>Before going there, to <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Dumbledore's death <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> and all the pain I like just to say how much I love the "minor" characters in this series for</span>  <span id="freeText15264277710942823420" style="display:none"><b>Perfection</b><br><br>I just read the last one hundred or so pages like<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1432075464ra/14897513.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And then I closed the book like<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1432075957ra/14897543.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><b>Because my emotions were in a roller coaster and it was amazing.</b><br>Rowling just made me feel everything in this book, I was loving, laughing, crying, sobbing and the book moves in a perfect pace it never bored me, in fact I didn't want it to end.<br>Before going there, to <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Dumbledore's death  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> and all the pain I like just to say how much I love the "minor" characters in this series for they all written in a manner that makes it impossible not to get attached to them. Tonks! Lupin! and even though Luna and Neville didn't do much in this book I still love them. I also love the couples, they were so cute and it was funny to watch them being in love.<br><br><b>Now</b><br><br>Harry and Dumbledore have such a beautiful bond and Dumbledore is one of myy favorite charactersever so <i> I was a mess!</i><br><br><blockquote>“He accused me of being Dumbledore's man through and through."<br>"How very rude of him."<br>"I told him I was."<br>Dumbledore opened his mouth to speak and then closed it again. Fawkes the phoenix let out a low, soft, musical cry. To Harry's intense embarrassment, he suddenly realized that Dumbledore's bright blue eyes looked rather watery, and stared hastily at his own knee. When Dumbledore spoke, however, his voice was quite steady. <br>"I am very touched, Harry.” </blockquote><br><br><blockquote>“It's going to be all right, sir," Harry said over and over again, more worried by Dumbledore's silence than he had been by his weakened voice. "We're nearly there ... I can Apparate us both back ... don't worry ..."<br>"I am not worried, Harry," said Dumbledore, his voice a little stronger despite the freezing water. "I am with you.” </blockquote><br><br><i>A mess</i> and yet I can tell this is one of my new favorite books.</["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="15264277710942823420" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1714931653?book_show_action=false">Aug 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Ashley" class="user" name="Ashley" href="/user/show/23211212-ashley">Ashley</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9781408855942" href="/book/show/22037471-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1714931653" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11372486625899278906"><b>In a nutshell:</b> Harry’s adventures continue as he embarks on quests with Dumbledore in hopes to destroy Voldemort and is helped in Potions class with a battered old textbook... once owned by a potions master who refers to himself as “the Half-Blood Prince.” <br /><br /><b>Recommendation:</b> This is obviously a must-read for people of all ages. <br /><br />Do I really need to write a plot synopsis of this one? Probably not... So I won’t write one. I’ll just say this book is amazing and I’m so glad I finally actually read it be</span>  <span id="freeText11372486625899278906" style="display:none"><b>In a nutshell:</b> Harry’s adventures continue as he embarks on quests with Dumbledore in hopes to destroy Voldemort and is helped in Potions class with a battered old textbook... once owned by a potions master who refers to himself as “the Half-Blood Prince.” <br /><br /><b>Recommendation:</b> This is obviously a must-read for people of all ages. <br /><br />Do I really need to write a plot synopsis of this one? Probably not... So I won’t write one. I’ll just say this book is amazing and I’m so glad I finally actually read it because I didn’t read it when it came out when I was younger. I read the first 5 and then I just stopped reading them for some stupid reason?<br /><br /><blockquote>  <i>“Dumbledore's man through and through, aren't you Potter?" <br />"Yeah I am," said Harry. "Glad we straightened that out.”</i></blockquote><br /><br />All I’ll say is if anyone only saw the movies... please read the books. There are so many things that I forgot about like Hermione’s house-elf liberation organization or the fact that Dobby appears more frequently than just in Harry Potter and The Chamber of Secrets. But I guess you can’t fit EVERYTHING into a 2-hour movie. <br /><br />Honestly these books are disguised as children and young adult books but I think people of all ages should read the series because I think it’s amazing for everyone really. Everyone can take some from these books. And that’s as far as I’ll go really because I know so many people have written about the series. </span>  <a data-text-id="11372486625899278906" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1714931653">  <td An all round amazing character!!!!!!! <br /><br />FAVOURITE LINES:<br />'there's no need to call me sir professor'<br />'ronil wazlib'<br /><br />OVERALL DEFINITELY ONE OF MY FAVOURITES FROM THE SERIES. amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780545582995" href="/book/show/17347380-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40281618-lisa-burgess?shelf=re-read">re-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1407582762" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5163416842382958839">Wow, ich hatte den Band gar nicht als SOOOO gut in Erinnerung, wie ich ihn jetzt doch fand. Ich verstehe gerne Zusammenhänge, Hintergründe und warum Dinge passieren, daher war dieser Band gerade in Sachen Voldemorts Vergangenheit großartig zu lesen. <br /><br />Im Gegensatz zum Film finde ich im Buch Ginny und Harry als Paar sehr toll. Ich hätte gerne von mehr Abenteuern gelesen, die sie beide gemeinsam bewältigen. <br /><br />Was ich bei JKR sehr liebe, sind ihre zusammenhängenden, hm, Showdown Szenen. In Band 5 war e</span>  <span id="freeText5163416842382958839" style="display:none">Wow, ich hatte den Band gar nicht als SOOOO gut in Erinnerung, wie ich ihn jetzt doch fand. Ich verstehe gerne Zusammenhänge, Hintergründe und warum Dinge passieren, daher war dieser Band gerade in Sachen Voldemorts Vergangenheit großartig zu lesen. <br /><br />Im Gegensatz zum Film finde ich im Buch Ginny und Harry als Paar sehr toll. Ich hätte gerne von mehr Abenteuern gelesen, die sie beide gemeinsam bewältigen. <br /><br />Was ich bei JKR sehr liebe, sind ihre zusammenhängenden, hm, Showdown Szenen. In Band 5 war es der Kampf im Ministerium, in Band 6 alles ab dem Moment, wo Harry und Dumbledore den Horkrux suchten. Es liest sich immer wie ein einziger langer Atemzug und ich kann vor Aufregung nicht aufhören zu lesen. Keine Pausen, kein "Ach, und es verging wieder eine Woche", sondern halt ein durchgängiges oh gott oh gott so much is happening. <br /><br />So. Und nun schaue ich gleich den Film und starte morgen Band 7, miep.<br /><br />Edit:<br />Eins noch: Gerade die letzten Szenen mit Harry und Dumbledore haben mich viel zu sehr an Gandalf und Moria erinnert. Und die Inferi im Wasser waren wir die Toten in den Dead Marshes oder wie die in HdR nochmal hießen. Naja. Das nagt etwas an mir.</span>  <a data-text-id="5163416842382958839" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/918877449?book_show_action=false">May 07, 2015</a>      <a title="Sasha Santiago" class="user" name="Sasha Santiago" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24393349-sasha-santiago?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer918877449" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11082973678534379925">THIS BOOK. This is without a doubt my favorite in the series. I absolutely loved learning about Voldemort before he was The Dark Lord. Everything about this book was amazing. Ugh and the death (let's keep it vague in case there are those people who have not read this series or seen the movies...they are still out there believe it or not) hurt me so much more than I expected. Gah can't wait to finish this series and to learn more about Snape (I hope!). I don't think there is really much for me to</span>  <span id="freeText11082973678534379925" style="display:none">THIS BOOK. This is without a doubt my favorite in the series. I absolutely loved learning about Voldemort before he was The Dark Lord. Everything about this book was amazing. Ugh and the death (let's keep it vague in case there are those people who have not read this series or seen the movies...they are still out there believe it or not) hurt me so much more than I expected. Gah can't wait to finish this series and to learn more about Snape (I hope!). I don't think there is really much for me to say about this book that hasn't already been said, so I'll just leave here with just two of my many favorite quotes from this book. <br /><br />ps. I find Harry and Ginny way cuter in the books than in the movies lol. <br /><br /><i> 'I am not worried, Harry,' said Dumbledore, his voice a little stronger despite the freezing water. 'I am with you.' </i><br /><br /><i> "...whether in a month, a year, or in ten, he felt his heart lift at the thought that there was still one golden day of peace left to enjoy with Ron and Hermione." elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_434781763" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/434781763" />    <a title="Dara" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13656026-dara"><img alt="Dara" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445383470p2/13656026.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/434781763?book_show_action=false">Nov 04, 2014</a>      <a title="Dara" class="user" name="Dara" href="/user/show/13656026-dara">Dara</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439784542" href="/book/show/49852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13656026-dara?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13656026-dara?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13656026-dara?shelf=read-2014">read-2014</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13656026-dara?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13656026-dara?shelf=series">series</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer434781763" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4551993147560969693">I love this book from start to finish. After the events of <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix__Harry_Potter___5_" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (Harry Potter, #5) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a>, it's nice to settle down to a relatively quiet year a Hogwarts for Harry.<br /><br />The biggest improvement over OOTP is that Harry is no longer moody and irritable. It's nice to have a happy, stable main character for a change. Hermione continues to shine, Ron is entertaining as ever, and learning about Voldemort's history is fascinating.<br /><br />Rowling dives into teen romance now that the trio is 16/17 years old</span>  <span id="freeText4551993147560969693" style="display:none">I love this book from start to finish. After the events of <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/2.Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix__Harry_Potter___5_" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (Harry Potter, #5) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a>, it's nice to settle down to a relatively quiet year a Hogwarts for Harry.<br /><br />The biggest improvement over OOTP is that Harry is no longer moody and irritable. It's nice to have a happy, stable main character for a change. Hermione continues to shine, Ron is entertaining as ever, and learning about Voldemort's history is fascinating.<br /><br />Rowling dives into teen romance now that the trio is 16/17 years old and she mostly handles it well. Some of Hermione's actions feel out of character but overall, it's done well.<br /><br />This is probably tied for my #2 favorite book in the series with <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a>. I don't think I'll ever tire of reading it.<br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="4551993147560969693" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1715274276?book_show_action=false">Aug 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Danni class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747581086" href="/book/show/93124.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1715274276" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2939432290820078992">So I suppose 3rd times the charm applies to this book. (Get it? Charm?) anyways, after 2 or 3 failed attempts over 2 or 3 years now I have finally completed book 6 for the first time. I must say I enjoyed it a lot, and only got bored a couple of times and I don't know whether or not that's due to the fact that J.K. Enjoys longwinded chapters/books or the fact that, because I had see the movie a while ago, I already knew what to expect of the book and its ending. I know that doesn't help but I</span>  <span id="freeText2939432290820078992" style="display:none">So I suppose 3rd times the charm applies to this book. (Get it? Charm?) anyways, after 2 or 3 failed attempts over 2 or 3 years now I have finally completed book 6 for the first time. I must say I enjoyed it a lot, and only got bored a couple of times and I don't know whether or not that's due to the fact that J.K. Enjoys longwinded chapters/books or the fact that, because I had see the movie a while ago, I already knew what to expect of the book and its ending. I know that doesn't help but I was like 12 when it came out and at the time I had no desire to even try reading the books (for reasons still unknown to me). I think once I finish Deathly Hallows I will be doing a discussion video of sorts because often I'm asked why I don't rate all the HP books 5 stars or why it took me so long to read them etc. So yeah. Overall good book, 3.5/5 stars. And onto Deathly Hallows which is even bigger than this one. Oh boy. </span>  <a data-text-id="2939432290820078992" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/81225206?book_show_action=false">Aug 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Lyndsay" class="user" name="Lyndsay" href="/user/show/3047395-lyndsay">Lyndsay</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780439784542" href="/book/show/49852.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3047395-lyndsay?shelf=own-read">own-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3047395-lyndsay?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3047395-lyndsay?shelf=audiobooks">audiobooks</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer81225206" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11355037181165679144">The sixth book has always been my favorite book, and this time was no different. I love this book because we learn more about the Horcruxes and we get to see all those glimpses of Voldemort's past. I obviously don't like Voldemort, but I think learning a villain's backstory is so interesting. I also love this book because Harry u0026amp;amp; Ginny finally get together (they are and always have been my #1 OTP). I always cry at the end, when Harry breaks it off with her and this time was no different. I</span>  <span id="freeText11355037181165679144" style="display:none">The sixth book has always been my favorite book, and this time was no different. I love this book because we learn more about the Horcruxes and we get to see all those glimpses of Voldemort's past. I obviously don't like Voldemort, but I think learning a villain's backstory is so interesting. I also love this book because Harry u0026amp; Ginny finally get together (they are and always have been my #1 OTP). I always cry at the end, when Harry breaks it off with her and this time was no different. I really loved listening to this one for some reason. Maybe because this one is my favorite book in the series and I was just constantly craving the story, I don't know, but this audiobook was just so good. I'm pretty far down on the list for the 7th one, so it'll be a bit before I can finish the series. But that's okay, because there are so many other books to read in the meantime. </span>  <a data-text-id="11355037181165679144" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review81225206">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link81225206" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=81225206u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_81225206'><a id="like_count_review_81225206" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/81225206?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">6 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_81225206" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_81225206" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=6u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=9u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=81225206u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_81225206" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 81225206, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer1358089055u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1358089055" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13022459958156354986">This was my least favorite of the series, but I still give it a solid 4 stars. <br><br>I am a confirmed and unrepentant PotterHead, so I was surprised that this one didn't hold me like the others (especially 4 u0026amp; 5 ... also 7, all of which ROCKED HARD) had.<br><br>What I loved in 6 were: Snape and the Inferius.<br><br>Inferius, because come on, zombies are SUPER COOL (Yeah!!!!) in whatever avatar.<br><br>Snape, because <i>SIGH</i>, he gave up so much for love. He made a huge mistake, and then spent his entire life making up for it</span>  <span id="freeText13022459958156354986" style="display:none">This was my least favorite of the series, but I still give it a solid 4 stars. <br><br>I am a confirmed and unrepentant PotterHead, so I was surprised that this one didn't hold me like the others (especially 4 u0026amp; 5 ... also 7, all of which ROCKED HARD) had.<br><br>What I loved in 6 were: Snape and the Inferius.<br><br>Inferius, because come on, zombies are SUPER COOL (Yeah!!!!) in whatever avatar.<br><br>Snape, because <i>SIGH</i>, he gave up so much for love. سيأتي ليظهر شخص من ضحاياهم الكثيريرين ليثور ويثأر ! وفولدمورت لا يختلف عنهم ، فقد كان دائما يب</i></b></span>  <span id="freeText10785152086525933886" style="display:none"><a elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1413127708" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1413127708" />    <a title="Kate" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/44342637-kate"><img alt="Kate" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473149431p2/44342637.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1413127708?book_show_action=false">Oct 16, 2015</a>      <a title="Kate" class="user" name="Kate" href="/user/show/44342637-kate">Kate</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1413127708" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7101573437660864899">Noooo! I'm so sad this book is over. This was by far the most emotional Harry Potter book so far, in my opinion. All the bickering, love, tragedy, humor, anger and excitement! I'm looking forward to reading the last book of this series but I'm also contemplating waiting to read it for a few weeks.. Just so it won't be over so soon!<br />Even though I grew up with the movies, I never managed to read the books until this year. When I was younger reading just wasn't particularly interesting to me. And ev</span>  <span id="freeText7101573437660864899" style="display:none">Noooo! I'm so sad this book is over. This was by far the most emotional Harry Potter book so far, in my opinion. All the bickering, love, tragedy, humor, anger and excitement! I'm looking forward to reading the last book of this series but I'm also contemplating waiting to read it for a few weeks.. Just so it won't be over so soon!<br />Even though I grew up with the movies, I never managed to read the books until this year. When I was younger reading just wasn't particularly interesting to me. And even when I started to develop an interest for books when I was around 13/14 I never really cared about Harry Potter. But now everything has changed and I am obsessed and oddly enough I'm already bummed out about finishing Harry Potter because I don't want it to end.</span>  <a data-text-id="7101573437660864899" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3716761252623129427"><i> <blockquote>Can you marry a book? Because I want to marry this one!</blockquote> </i><br><u>The three stages of reading <b>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince </b>:</u><br>1)Laugh so hard I couldn't breath<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1395008210ra/8934961.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>2) Read maniacally<br><img EVERYONE'S FUTURE RIGHT NOW!</b><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1465162463ra/19321617.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br></span> Kamjou</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title=" 9788008944960" href="/book/show/1251658._">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31254457-sara-kamjou?shelf=%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%AA%D8%B2%DB%8C">فانتزی</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1536874399" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18232664103235496438">هر چند نمیتوانم بگویم کدام جلد هری پاتر جلد مورد علاقهام است و گویی بخواهی بگویی کدام بچهات را ببشتر دوست داری همینقدر غیرممکن به نظر میرسد اما جلد ششم به نحو عجیبی شاید عمیقترین جلد مجموعه هری پاتر باشد.<br />وقتی برای بار سوم میخواندمش مثل بار اول حالم بد بود و هری... خب هری بزرگ شده است.<br />-------------------------------------<br />جملات ماندگار:<br />وقتی با مرگ یا تاریکی مواجه میشیم فقط از ناشناختههاست که میترسیم نه چیز دیگه.<br />...<br />بخشیدن کسایی که کار اشتباهی کردن، خیلی راحتتر از بخشیدن کسایی هست که درست میگفتند.<br />..</span>  <span id="freeText18232664103235496438" style="display:none">هر چند نمی‌توانم بگویم کدام جلد هری پاتر جلد مورد علاقه‌ام است و گویی بخواهی بگویی کدام بچه‌ات را ببشتر دوست داری همین‌قدر غیرممکن به نظر می‌رسد اما جلد ششم به نحو عجیبی شاید عمیق‌ترین جلد مجموعه هری پاتر باشد.<br />وقتی برای بار سوم می‌خواندمش مثل بار اول حالم بد بود و هری... خب هری بزرگ شده است.<br />-------------------------------------<br />جملات ماندگار:<br />وقتی با مرگ یا تاریکی مواجه می‌شیم فقط از ناشناخته‌هاست که می‌ترسیم نه چیز دیگه.<br />...<br />بخشیدن کسایی که کار اشتباهی کردن، خیلی راحت‌تر از بخشیدن کسایی هست که درست می‌گفتند.<br />...<br />پیری که جوان رو دست کم بگیره ابله و فراموشکاره.<br />...<br />بسیار مهم است که کسی بجنگد و دوباره بجنگد و به جنگیدن ادامه بدهد زیرا فقط در این صورت است که می‌تواند پلیدی را دور نگه دارد، گو اینکه هیچگاه به کلی ریشه‌کن نمی‌شود.</span>  <a data-text-id="18232664103235496438" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer1430689723" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13934922806674942013">I bawled like a baby in the last pages. This was the most emotionally touching book of the series. I am not a huge Dumbledore fan but his death marks the end of an era! <br /><br />Also Snape - poor, poor Snape!<br /><br />Malfoys find out that anyone can be victims of the dark side, irrespective of blood status. Not feeling so good about it now, are you? <br /><br />Dear (sexist jerk) Ron, Ginny is not your property. Nor is Hermione. Both can do whatever they like in their lives. So please stop acting like an entitled prick. Is t</span>  <span id="freeText13934922806674942013" style="display:none">I bawled like a baby in the last pages. This was the most emotionally touching book of the series. I am not a huge Dumbledore fan but his death marks the end of an era! <br /><br />Also Snape - poor, poor Snape!<br /><br />Malfoys find out that anyone can be victims of the dark side, irrespective of blood status. Not feeling so good about it now, are you? <br /><br />Dear (sexist jerk) Ron, Ginny is not your property. Nor is Hermione. Both can do whatever they like in their lives. So please stop acting like an entitled prick. Is that clear? Yes? Thank you.<br /><br />Dear Tonks, get over it already! There are many fish in the sea. <br /><br />Well, that's all. I just wish I hadn't given the other books 5 stars because this definitely merits a higher rating. </span>  <a data-text-id="13934922806674942013" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return crazy how well J.K Rowling has written this series. Every time I read it I'm suprised to see so many things come together after a few books. I have only completely read this book 1 or 2 times and I forgot soo many things! I feel like this isn't a real spoiler anymore but.. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[The ending was heartbreaking, after all these years I still feel so sad he had to die even though it makes a more realistic story. Every time I read it I'm suprised to see so many things come together after a few books. I have only completely read this book 1 or 2 times and I forgot soo many things! the last book, I think I haven't read that once since it came out in 2007 so I'm very excited. :D</span>  <a data-text-id="7564670511878844922" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1123144314" />    <a title="Ashley *Hufflepuff Kitten*" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten"><img alt="Ashley *Hufflepuff Kitten*" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471208025p2/29787548.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1123144314?book_show_action=false">Jan 19, 2015</a>      <a title="Ashley *Hufflepuff Kitten*" class="user" name="Ashley *Hufflepuff Kitten*" href="/user/show/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten">Ashley *Hufflepuff Kitten*</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780747581109" href="/book/show/155104.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten?shelf=i-own-it">i-own-it</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten?shelf=written-review">written-review</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten?shelf=showy-offy-pretty-pretty">showy-offy-pretty-pretty</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29787548-ashley-hufflepuff-kitten?shelf=2015">2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1123144314" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7711643854883265788">13Jan15<br />I always seem to forget how draining the final few chapters are. But I'm so glad I read this again, because there were so many moments that I'd forgotten about -- the flashbacks/memory scenes, the absolutely hilarious bits, and so forth. Reading these books really is like coming home.<br /><br />BEST COVER. This book may or may not be the reason behind my purchasing the entire British hardback set.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr id="freeTextContainer9326949568362646395"><br />I think this book is probably better than the 3 stars I gave it, but I'm not sure because I also think I read most of it in my sleep when I had jet lag. Someday I'll re-read it and see how I feel then. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="reviewTextContainer1173676824" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1016461101808886433">WOW, the ending is so much sadder than I remember it being.. I can't even imagine how people who had to wait for the release of Deathly Hallows must have felt right now. I diving into it at once!</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_772008623" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/772008623" />    <a title="هــالــه بــاقــر" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/20923443"><img alt="هــالــه بــاقــر" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471746543p2/20923443.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/772008623?book_show_action=false">Dec 01, 2013</a>      <a title="هــالــه بــاقــر" class="user" name="هــالــه بــاقــر" href="/user/show/20923443">هــالــه بــاقــر</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Mass Market Paperback 9789771433002" href="/book/show/7810058">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20923443?shelf=novels">novels</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer772008623" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12499829004601522852"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1385925554i/7260241.jpg" width="300" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>فصل الأمير الهجين شكل وجهة نظر جديدة لي وكانت بمثابة نقطةِ فاصلة في عالم قراءة الكتب لدي فرغم عدم توجهي لمطالعة كتب تحولت لأفلام وذلك لغياب فقرة التشويق فيه جاء هاري واستعمل سحره في عالمنا وخرق القوانين والقى بتعويذة التحكم التي لن تود التخلص منها ابداً <br><br>أما المؤلفة فهي عظيمة عبقرية إذ تسألت كثيراً كيف لها أن تصف احداث خيالية ومعارك واجواء عالم هوجوورتس فجاء جوابها صادقاً فهي تأخذ بيدك وتساعدك على ركوب احدى المكانس الطائرة لتحلق بك في عالم كل شيئ يصبح فيه ممكناً حيث يتسع الأفق والقدرة على رسم ابع</b></span>  <span id="freeText12499829004601522852" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1385925554i/7260241.jpg" width="300" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>فصل الأمير الهجين شكل وجهة نظر جديدة لي وكانت بمثابة نقطةِ فاصلة في عالم قراءة الكتب لدي فرغم عدم توجهي لمطالعة كتب تحولت لأفلام وذلك لغياب فقرة التشويق فيه جاء هاري واستعمل سحره في عالمنا وخرق القوانين والقى بتعويذة التحكم التي لن تود التخلص منها ابداً <br><br>أما المؤلفة فهي عظيمة عبقرية إذ تسألت كثيراً كيف لها أن تصف احداث خيالية ومعارك واجواء عالم هوجوورتس فجاء جوابها صادقاً فهي تأخذ بيدك وتساعدك على ركوب احدى المكانس الطائرة لتحلق بك في عالم كل شيئ يصبح فيه ممكناً حيث يتسع الأفق والقدرة على رسم ابعاد وصور جديدة ورغم صعوبة مهمتها فهي لا تبرز المعضلة التي تواجهها بل تجعلك تعتقد أن هذا الأسلوب من اسهل اساليب كتابة الفانتازيا وهنا تكمن موهبة رولينغ فهي تكون أبطال ملحمة بكل جوارحها وتعطي الحياة للشخصيات على الورق وتمييز الكل بخواص وطبيعة حياة متفردة وفي خضم مئات الشخصيات يأتي تكوين الحدث و الأساس ووضع تفاصيل العقدة والصراع والحل وتغرق كل هذه الوصفات في بحار التشويق و الإثارة السحرية لتكسر بذلك قاعدة ( يموت التشويق في الرواية بعد تحولها لفلم سينمائي ) <br><br><br> ** الأحداث ** <br><br>هاري و الأمير الهجين الفصل السادس في السلسلة وهي تمثل بداية النهاية لمغامرات هاري و رون وهرميون بل كل عالم هوجوورتس ضد فولدمورت الذي يُعلن عودته بشكل رسمي ويحيط جو الكأبة و الخوف والهلع بالعالم السحري ليبدء هاري مشوار الغوص في ذكريات وماضي توم ريدل مع الباس دمبلدور سعياً في البحث عن أي شيئ يساعدهم في القضاء على سيد الظلام بينما اكلوا الموت في حالة نشاط واستعداد لحشد القوى وتكوين فريق قوي لبدء المعركة.<br><br><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1385925554i/7260242._SX540_.jpg" width="300" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><img width="300" height="250" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><br>ويشهد الفصل ايضاً تطوراً في الجوانب العاطفية للأبطال فبعد دخولهم لسن المراهقة وإزدياد المخاطر من حولهم تصقل مشاعرهم وتزداد نضجاً ليعبروا جسر الطفولة ليقفوا على ممر الأحاسيس المضطربة وإكتشاف النصف الاخر الذي يكمل روحهم فتتكون الثنائيات هاري وجيني ورون مع هرميون ليمثل بذلك الخطوة الأولى في صعود جبل التحديات والفوضى وصولاً للحرب التي تنشب في مقدسات الموت لبجزء السابع و الاخير في السلسلة <br><br><br>أظن إنه قد حان الوقت لجودريدز لتجديد انظمتها وخاصة في التقييم فأنا اجد امامي معجزة ادبية راقية تجسد سنوات من عمر الكاتبة ومتابعي الرواية والفلم تذوقوا فيها المرح و السعادة و الجديد الغير المألوف واستخرجوا دروس في الصداقة و الثبات على الموقف لذلك خمس نجوم امر مهين للرواية و للإبداع الموجود في طياتها , تحية للسيدة جي كي رولينغ لوهبها البشرية نوعاً نادراً مدهشاً من الأدب سيظل محفوراً في تاريخ الفن و الإنجاز كمنارة ومثال يحتذي به اخرون جيلاً بعد جيل <br><br>مئة نجمة وينصح به لكل من شاهد الفلم وظن أن الرواية ستكون خالية من التشويق بل ستفاجأ بكون الكتاب اروع واقوى وافضل <br><br>سعيدة لكون 2013 تم توديعه بجزء من افضل اجزاء بوتر <br><br></b></span>  <a data-text-id="12499829004601522852" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr
