 </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1786337871" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1786337871" />    <a title="Heartbrekker" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/34613428-heartbrekker"><img alt="Heartbrekker" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469180437p2/34613428.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1786337871?book_show_action=false">Oct 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Heartbrekker" class="user" name="Heartbrekker" href="/user/show/34613428-heartbrekker">Heartbrekker</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34613428-heartbrekker?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34613428-heartbrekker?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34613428-heartbrekker?shelf=paranormal">paranormal</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34613428-heartbrekker?shelf=hit-me-in-the-honey-nut-feelios">hit-me-in-the-honey-nut-feelios</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34613428-heartbrekker?shelf=audiobooks">audiobooks</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1786337871" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6802884179444445016">I'm... I'm not crying. I'm not laying on the edge of my bed, completely immobilized and struggling to breathe. Really. I'm not. <br /><br />But I have to say that this book is probably my favourite of all the books in this series, even despite the inevitable death of one my most favourite and cherished characters. The last half was so intense that I couldn't stop plowing through it till the end. It was both an emotional ride and, somehow, immensely powerful. <br /><br />Now, excuse me while I stare at the ceiling for t</span>  <span id="freeText6802884179444445016" style="display:none">I'm... I'm not crying. I'm not laying on the edge of my bed, completely immobilized and struggling to breathe. Really. I'm not. <br /><br />But I have to say that this book is probably my favourite of all the books in this series, even despite the inevitable death of one my most favourite and cherished characters. The last half was so intense that I couldn't stop plowing through it till the end. It was both an emotional ride and, somehow, immensely powerful. <br /><br />Now, excuse me while I stare at the ceiling for the next couple of hours in complete despair.</span>  <a data-text-id="6802884179444445016" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1786337871">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1786337871" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1786337871u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1786337871'><a id="like_count_review_1786337871" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1786337871?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">10 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1786337871" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1786337871" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=10u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=10u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1786337871u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1786337871" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1786337871, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">comment</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/1786337871?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=10">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1786337871' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1786337871' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1786337871, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_22339308" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/22339308" />    <a title="Rebecca" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/779390-rebecca"><img alt="Rebecca" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1206212520p2/779390.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/22339308?book_show_action=false">Nov 30, 2014</a>      <a title="Rebecca" class="user" name="Rebecca" href="/user/show/779390-rebecca">Rebecca</a>          added it                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/779390-rebecca?shelf=made-into-movies">made-into-movies</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/779390-rebecca?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer22339308u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer22339308" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5870577869691155291">I don't really know what I think of the beginning, since the first two (clearly important) scenes are done outside Harry's frame of reference. The whole point of the books has been that we're in limited 3rd person POV - we find things out when Harry does. That's been the clearly established rule for 5 books, I don't understand why we're changing it in the 6th. Obviously the point of being an author is that you make the rules, but once you've made your own rules you're supposed to abide by them</span>  <span id="freeText5870577869691155291" style="display:none">I don't really know what I think of the beginning, since the first two (clearly important) scenes are done outside Harry's frame of reference. The whole point of the books has been that we're in limited 3rd person POV - we find things out when Harry does. That's been the clearly established rule for 5 books, I don't understand why we're changing it in the 6th. Obviously the point of being an author is that you make the rules, but once you've made your own rules you're supposed to abide by them until you've also created an exception. That can be done more easily with substantive rules - you can have vampires wander around in direct sunlight eating garlic for all I care, if you say why you're doing it. But a style rule that's been clearly established isn't supposed to be broken, unless you need information that CAN'T be conveyed any other way, and I don't see why she couldn't have conveyed the information in those scenes later in the book in the usual way. Okay, yes, it's clearly important that we know about the Unbreakable Vow, but Harry found out about it anyway, so I'm not sure why we had to know about it when we did. The point could have been to introduce Narcissa and use Bellatrix again, but I'm not sure why we care. Or I guess it could have been that we suspect Snape, which would definitely be fun and games, but I'm suspicious of that clearly planted suspicion. My best guess is that we need to know not only THAT Snape made the Unbreakable Vow, but WHAT he vowed to do, and that must have been the most convenient way to do it. <br /><br />Also, I would like to veto love triangles. I know, I know - we have a bunch of 16 year olds of the two genders in constant close quarters, it would be more shocking if we DIDN'T have triangles. But it's woeful to have to read it for a million billion pages. And Ron really can be a spectacular McAsshat when he wants to. (<i>Lavender</i>? <i>Really</i>? I have nothing against her, but <i>really</i>?) Although I worry about where she's going with Ron and Hermione - they FIGHT. A LOT. And I don't think that would change that much, no matter what happens...it hasn't been the "bickering of unspoken passion" all this time. I think Ron started the snarking of move around Year 4, but Hermione has been thoroughly...Hermione until this year. Also, I kind of like her with Viktor Krum, because it was FUNNY. Although I am surprisingly myself by being a supporter of Harry-Ginny. I heart Ginny and I think she would work well with him. I mean, if it goes bad it will go VERY VERY BAD, as Harry himself as pointed out, but maybe it won't go bad. Maybe there will be ONE THING in this ENTIRE SERIES that doesn't end up going bad. <br /><br />....Or she could be the one who dies at the end of book 7 WAH VETO.<br /><br />One disadvantage of being a Johnny (jill?) come lately is that I knew that Dumbledore died, just like I knew that Sirius died, but I managed to block that out with the supreme conviction of someone who believes that the bad ending will have worked itself out by the time she gets there. Unfortunately, it did not, and I am deprived of Dumbledore as I was deprived of Sirius, and yea verily I cried. I cried harder for Sirius than for Dumbledore, though I'm not sure why - probably because why Dumbledore's death wasn't a shock, how it happened was, and I was too busy screaming "WHAT THE F!" at the book to really be emotionally wracked. I had to go back and read it twice just to make sure I really understood what had just happened, because it seemed like there was just no way. <br /><br />So the end.....W. T. EEEEEEFFFFFFFF. I mean, what WAS that? Was it an Imperious Curse? Was it the consequences of the Unbreakable Vow? Or have Ron and Harry been right all this time? And it's so utterly bizarre because earlier in the book I'd been thinking about how even though Snape doesn't always like it, in the end he does usually seem to do what's right, like when he made Lupin the serum or when he tried to teach Harry Occlumency-whatever, even though he doesn't like it, and that was what had me convinced that Dumbledore was right in trusting him. And I'd thought that maybe if Harry just sucked it up and apologized to Snape and actually tried being polite it might help - like if he'd had sorry for his accidental disemboweling of Malfoy. I mean, yes, Malfoy was trying to use the Cruciatus on him, but I'd been thinking if Harry just manned up and said to Snape, "Professor, I'm sorry I did that," without making excuses, that might make a different. But then after all of that it turns out that HOLY MOTHER OF JESUS HOWARD CHRIST ON A POGO STICK SNAPE BETRAYED THE POTTERS???? and I seriously rethought that idea.<br /><br />And then...and then after ALL of that, has he really been still working for Voldemort this ENTIRE TIME? I mean, I'd wondered if everyone circling you for all those years going Dumbledore trusts you but we don't and we just want to make that VERY VERY CLEAR could eventually crack you, and then--wha--wha--what? <br /><br />And Dumbledore DIED FOR A FAKE HORCRUX AND WHO THE FUDGE IS R.A.B.?? <br /><br />My brain has just waved a tiny white flag and crawled into the corner to cry. Dear J.K. Rowling: please cease and desist phunking with my heart.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="5870577869691155291" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review22339308">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link22339308" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=22339308u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_22339308'><a id="like_count_review_22339308" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/22339308?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">5 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_22339308" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_22339308" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=5u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=10u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=22339308u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_22339308" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 22339308, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;); return false;">5 comments</a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a href="/review/show/22339308?book_show_action=falseu0026amp;from_review_page=10">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_22339308' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/22339308/comments?reverse=true">View all 5 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_22339308' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 22339308, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_458212362" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/458212362" />    <a title="Jocelyn " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/11898426-jocelyn"><img alt="Jocelyn " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445810458p2/11898426.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/458212362?book_show_action=false">Oct 31, 2015</a>      <a title="Jocelyn " class="user" name="Jocelyn " href="/user/show/11898426-jocelyn">Jocelyn </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11898426-jocelyn?shelf=cheap-thriller">cheap-thriller</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11898426-jocelyn?shelf=entertaining-but-not-much-else">entertaining-but-not-much-else</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11898426-jocelyn?shelf=unimpressed">unimpressed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11898426-jocelyn?shelf=disappointed">disappointed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11898426-jocelyn?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer458212362" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11200996485459383800">Somewhere between a 2.5 and a 3.<br /><br />As I said in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/404582564">my review of The Deathly Hallows,</a> the Harry Potter series has long left me unimpressed. However, I will say that in retrospect, this is a fairly entertaining read and Rowling should receive credit for that.<br /><br />There is something about HP despite its lack of quality that makes me want to bury my head in these books and live there. Perhaps even more so than Percy Jackson, which I rate to be superior to these books because Riordan is much more structurally c</span>  <span id="freeText11200996485459383800" style="display:none">Somewhere between a 2.5 and a 3.<br /><br />As I said in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/404582564">my review of The Deathly Hallows,</a> the Harry Potter series has long left me unimpressed. However, I will say that in retrospect, this is a fairly entertaining read and Rowling should receive credit for that.<br /><br />There is something about HP despite its lack of quality that makes me want to bury my head in these books and live there. Perhaps even more so than Percy Jackson, which I rate to be superior to these books because Riordan is much more structurally consistent and in control of his writing. Although Rowling's tone is often wobbly, you can see that she's still managed to build the atmosphere of HP from childish and charming into something more dark and mature--the fact that we sense it, regardless of the technical failings, surely exemplifies that. We grow alongside Harry, having fun with all his adventures as well as encountering all the classic marks of the Hero's Journey--encountering of death, first experiences of grief, that sense of conflict we all feel when we realize that not all is right with the world. The characters, although rather unsubtle, feel real in such a way that the story makes sense, even if the world-building and exposition don't. The predictability of the cliche stereotypes and archetypes Rowling uses for her characters is compensated for by genuine, sympathetic psychological motivations she puts behind them. And the social/political commentary regarding the Ministry of Magic and the hierarchy of Hogwarts is fairly well done, if not completely original. I always got the feeling that Rowling had some important observations to make about the world, but lacked the eloquence to articulate them as effectively as the story demanded.<br /><br />Which brings me to my major problem with this book, and this series as a whole. Rowling is rarely in control of her writing. The prose, although charming and entertaining, has a bit of a hit-and-miss feel with the adverbs and heavy-handed descriptors. And as many people have pointed out, the last-minute plot devices <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Horcruxes <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> are badly foreshadowed--if at all--in the rest of the series, making it feel as if Rowling cares more about her world as a source of cheat tools than a well-developed setting. And besides the more specific failings, there's really not much of a better way I can put it: you can <i>feel</i> Rowling's lack of confidence every step of the story. It's there, not just in the technical components, but also in her authorial voice. In my experience, there is a difference between sensing the presence of the author because the story feels self-assured, and sensing the presence of the author because she's constantly slipping and sliding. Rowling for me falls decidedly into the latter.<br /><br />And I don't really buy the "it's for children" argument either. I first read this series when I was twelve, and my general impression has remained unchanged. I had trouble figuring out why HP was so hugely popular because it seemed utterly unremarkable to me at the time, but looking back and rereading this, I think I know why. For all the sloppiness of these stories, the emotional content is extremely well grounded; and it makes sense for Rowling, under all the pressure of millions of fans trying to second-guess her every move, that she would try to attach herself to the characters, and even if she overdid it, the character development is the main redeeming quality of this series. Even the introduction of the <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Horcruxes <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>--a common plot device in fantasy stories--is rather nicely smoothed out because it progresses alongside the character reveals of Horace Slughorn, who is quite a realistic depiction of an adult who has failed to fully confront his conscience. At least Rowling attempts to address her literary weaknesses, although she doesn't succeed in hiding them.<br /><br />I know this review might seem insulting to the hardcore HP fans out there, but trust me: I get it. At least I think I do. Rowling has imagination, she has talent, she has some relevant things to say about the world and she says them in a way that makes it easy for the target audience to draw some valuable things--most specifically the ability to identify with the characters and the struggle of growing up without self-centered justification. Maybe if I was a little less skeptical as a twelve year old I might have been pouring over these books until they fell to pieces in my hands. As it is, however, I will continue to think of HP not as a classic destined to withstand the test of time, but as a semi-successful writing experiment on Rowling's part that managed to spark the imaginations of millions of kids--even if I wasn't one of them.</span>  <a data-text-id="11200996485459383800" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review458212362">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks"> Rivero" href="/user/show/8429859-ale-rivero">Ale Rivero</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788478889914" href="/book/show/10611639-harry-potter-y-el-misterio-del-pr-ncipe">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1767603322" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9473765371135514018">Este es otro de los libros de la saga para agarrar pañuelos. <br />Además, empezamos a ver cambios más drásticos en la personalidad de los personajes, justamente por todo el drama que han debido pasar. <br />La historia en sí se está volviendo mucho más oscura previendo lo que sí o sí va a tener que pasar tarde o temprano. <br />La relación de Dumbledore y Harry llega a su máximo apogeo, y es obvio que el desenlace es algo que nadie quería ver. <br />Por otro lado, las 'traiciones' y los intentos de asesinato están a l</span>  <span id="freeText9473765371135514018" style="display:none">Este es otro de los libros de la saga para agarrar pañuelos. <br />Además, empezamos a ver cambios más drásticos en la personalidad de los personajes, justamente por todo el drama que han debido pasar. <br />La historia en sí se está volviendo mucho más oscura previendo lo que sí o sí va a tener que pasar tarde o temprano. <br />La relación de Dumbledore y Harry llega a su máximo apogeo, y es obvio que el desenlace es algo que nadie quería ver. <br />Por otro lado, las 'traiciones' y los intentos de asesinato están a la orden del día y traen malos presagios que hasta la profesora Trelawney llega a ver. <br />Una dura y gran aventura se avecina y nuestros personajes se preparan para enfrentar lo que sea. <br />Puede que este sea un libro lleno de misterio desde el inicio, pero también está plagado de pistas macabras que nos hacen comprender un poco más cómo se ha creado Voldemort y lo que lo rodea. <br />En definitiva, este no va a ser el más entretenido de la saga, porque encierra mucho dolor, pero de todas maneras sigue siendo fantástico. Muy recomendable.</span>  <a data-text-id="9473765371135514018" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1064445921" />    <a title="Sara (Freadom Library)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/24190242-sara-freadom-library"><img alt="Sara (Freadom Library)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471024861p2/24190242.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1064445921?book_show_action=false">Aug 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Sara (Freadom Library)" class="user" name="Sara (Freadom Library)" href="/user/show/24190242-sara-freadom-library">Sara (Freadom Library)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/16356129-harry-potter-and-the-half-blood-prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=witches-warlocks-spellcasters">witches-warlocks-spellcasters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=high-fantasy">high-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=middle-grade">middle-grade</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/24190242-sara-freadom-library?shelf=read-july-2016">read-july-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1064445921" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17897883201498250114">This review was originally posted at <a target="_blank" href="https://freadomlibrary.wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">https://freadomlibrary.wordpress.com/</a><br /><br />MINI REVIEW <br /><br /><b>Critically</b><br /><br />Plot – 5 out of 5 stars<br /><br />Writing Style – 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br />Characters – 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br /><b>Emotionally</b><br /><br />I still can’t wrap y head around everything that happened in this book and it’s not even the end yet! The plot is dark. Harry is back at Hogwarts and things are supposed to be back to normal but sinister plans are brewing at Hogwarts. Worst summary ever to be honest but shit gets really dark you guys. Everyo</span>  <span id="freeText17897883201498250114" style="display:none">This review was originally posted at <a target="_blank" href="https://freadomlibrary.wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">https://freadomlibrary.wordpress.com/</a><br /><br />MINI REVIEW <br /><br /><b>Critically</b><br /><br />Plot – 5 out of 5 stars<br /><br />Writing Style – 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br />Characters – 4 out of 5 stars<br /><br /><b>Emotionally</b><br /><br />I still can’t wrap y head around everything that happened in this book and it’s not even the end yet! The plot is dark. Harry is back at Hogwarts and things are supposed to be back to normal but sinister plans are brewing at Hogwarts. Worst summary ever to be honest but shit gets really dark you guys. Everyone knows Voldemort is actually back and people are disappearing left and right or dying or going to jail for things they didn’t do. It slowly but surely starts to affect the students at Hogwarts and everyone is choosing sides. My favorite part about this book was finally figuring out some things about Voldemort and to get some answers about his actions and why he became the way he did. Especially after all the instances where you think he’s finally dead and gone, but he just keeps kicking! It’s nice to finally have some answers even though it wasn’t the most pleasant of discoveries. Honestly, I just want him gone for good. Those last few chapters though completely broke my heart. I was totally devastated over what happened! I knew something bad was gonna happen, I knew things were going to collide in a way that would mean pain and heartache but I did not think that that was going to happen! It’s still insane to me. I haven’t wrapped my head around it completely. Harry has grown up. Like a lot. There’s such a huge contrast between the boy he started out as the man he is becoming now. He’s sad and vulnerable but as determined as always. I love him, I really do and I think he has the biggest heart and the best intentions considering how much pain he’s been through. But he started developing these obsessive tendencies that were annoying. I understand why he acted that way and he was completely right but god, it was just so annoying and frustrating. I just wanted to shake him! I feel really bad saying this but I don’t know what Ron is for. I feel like I don’t know him enough and it’s been six books! He just feels like such a shallow character. I like him; I just don’t feel like I understand who he is or his motivations. Hermoine is my boo but she got a bit annoying for me as well. However, she’s so powerful and smart. Those boys would be lost without her, I promise you. I don’t usually mention this character but I have to say that I felt really bad for Draco in this book. He’s always been a huge pain in the ass and an arrogant little shit head but he’s placed in such a horrible position. He has such high expectations placed on his shoulders and he’s trying so hard to be brave but he’s not ready at all. It broke my heart a little bit. But he’s still an ass.</span>  <a data-text-id="17897883201498250114" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1064445921' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1064445921, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1418839851" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1418839851" />    <a title="Nessia" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/48014530-nessia"><img alt="Nessia" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445901629p2/48014530.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1418839851?book_show_action=false">Mar 11, 2016</a>      <a title="Nessia" class="user" name="Nessia" href="/user/show/48014530-nessia">Nessia</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/48014530-nessia?shelf=books-in-other-languages">books-in-other-languages</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(u0026#39;reviewTextContainer1418839851u0026#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1418839851" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6943332902601418194">Harry Potter and the half-blood prince is an inspiring and captivating novel . I'd like to share the parts that were most interesting.<br />The novel begins with Snape . Snape,who is trusted by Dumbledore,and presents the reader with a paradox.<br />Snape takes upon himself the task that was bestowed upon Draco Malfoy by Voldemort .<br />Next,Harry potter is fetched from the Dursley's by none other than Dumbledore and brought to an old acquaintance of Dumbledore,whom Harry has to convince to teach at Hogwarts.<br />Mea</span>  <span id="freeText6943332902601418194" style="display:none">Harry Potter and the half-blood prince is an inspiring and captivating novel . I'd like to share the parts that were most interesting.<br />The novel begins with Snape . Snape,who is trusted by Dumbledore,and presents the reader with a paradox.<br />Snape takes upon himself the task that was bestowed upon Draco Malfoy by Voldemort .<br />Next,Harry potter is fetched from the Dursley's by none other than Dumbledore and brought to an old acquaintance of Dumbledore,whom Harry has to convince to teach at Hogwarts.<br />Meanwhile,Dumbledore tells Harry of his ownership of Sirius's home,private lessons(with Dumbledore),Dumbledore escorts Harry to the weasley's and from there he travels to Hogwarts.<br />Due to sighting Malfoy in a dark arts shop and other reasons,Harry suspects that Draco is now a death eater.<br />The instructor Harry convinced to teach Professor Slughorn at Hogwarts takes up potions and Snape becomes the dark arts professor. Harry doesn't have a potions book and borrows one from slughorn,which happens to be the property of the Half blood prince. Herein he leaves many new spells and excels in potions.<br />Dumbledore shares memories that shed light upon Voldemort's life and rise to power.<br />Harry notices Dumbledore's blackened hand,(which Dumbledore dismisses when asked),and later discovers that it is due to an Horcrux object.<br />There are few attempts to curse Dumbledore,with the sender unknown.it is quite unfortunate that students become cursed ,rather than the attempts being foiled altogether.<br />Harry began do develop feelings about Ron's sister:Ginny Weasley.<br />Harry discovers Riddle's obsession with Horcruxes in Dumbledore's lessons and is bequeathed to request the memory from slughorn (regarding Horcruxes).<br />Harry than discovers that Malfoy is spending much time in the requirements room,which he eventually used to bring in death eaters.<br />Harry discovers that Voldemort has split his soul by means of Horcruxes.<br />Harry discovers that Snape told Voldemort about the prophecy and led to the murder of his parents.<br />Dumbledore takes Harry with him upon a mission to destroy a horcrux and Dumbledore becomes weakened due to drinking a liquid that would allow them to retrieve the horcrux.<br />Upon their return,they discover that death eaters have entered Hogwarts and that Draco wants to kill Dumbledore. Snape then comes and kills Dumbledore and (the half blood prince aka Snape) the flee.<br />To Harry's dismay,the Horcrux is a fake and had been retrieved already.<br />In conclusion,this novel has been an amazing read.due to all of the occurrences.</span>  <a data-text-id="6943332902601418194" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_57439813" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/57439813" />    <a title="Dev Null" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2351084-dev-null"><img alt="Dev Null" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1243221760p2/2351084.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/57439813?book_show_action=false">Jul 29, 2014</a>      <a title="Dev Null" class="user" name="Dev Null" href="/user/show/2351084-dev-null">Dev Null</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2351084-dev-null?shelf=teen-fantasy">teen-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2351084-dev-null?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer57439813" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer58135200135079620">I feel like I'm desperately looking between the mad Potter fans and the legion of Harry-haters for some niche in which to be trendily different but...<br /><br />Ho-hum.<br /><br />It wasn't bad; it wasn't great. It still sucks you through it somewhat compellingly, but part of that is that its just plain so easy to read. I felt like smacking sixteen-year-olds doing the teen angst thing - think I got my lifetime's supply from Buffy or something - but I'm sure that's all very realistic; real teenagers make me feel like t</span>  <span id="freeText58135200135079620" style="display:none">I feel like I'm desperately looking between the mad Potter fans and the legion of Harry-haters for some niche in which to be trendily different but...<br /><br />Ho-hum.<br /><br />It wasn't bad; it wasn't great. It still sucks you through it somewhat compellingly, but part of that is that its just plain so easy to read. I felt like smacking sixteen-year-olds doing the teen angst thing - think I got my lifetime's supply from Buffy or something - but I'm sure that's all very realistic; real teenagers make me feel like that too sometimes. Just because its realistic doesn't necessarily make it interesting to read though. The big reveal is fairly obvious, so that you pretty much see it coming from halfway through the book; hmmm... who could the slightly evil expert potion-maker from Hogwarts past be? And Malfoy (gasp!) turns out to be up to no good... now _there's_ a surprise. Actually the whole series is starting to remind me of the X-files, with Harry playing the part of young Mulder in a dress. First, Harry/Mulder acquires a tiny scrap of inconclusive evidence and builds an incredibly complex conspiracy theory on it which ends up blaming his enemies. Everyone around him fails to believe him because his evidence is scanty and hes obviously biased, but in the end, he turns out to be right anyways. The moral of the story is apparently that you should persecute people you don't like mercilessly regardless of fact, because in the end they will turn out to be behind whatever might be going wrong in your life. And meanwhile, after the 5th or 6th time its happened, you want to scream at Ron/Hermione/Scully to just BELIEVE him instead of being reasonable because facts or no facts is he EVER wrong? Dumbledore dying was very sad, but Harry breaking up with Ginny to keep her safe had no emotional impact, since he does it in such a condescending way - never even asks her opinion - and we'd barely seen them together in any case.<br /><br />The first ones were aimed at kids but appealed to all of us because we all, deep-down, still like to think we're a bit of a kid. These ones are aimed at teenagers. Who wants to be a teenager again?</span>  <a data-text-id="58135200135079620" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review57439813">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_57101074" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/57101074" />    <a title="Scortia" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/2348226-scortia"><img alt="Scortia" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_50x66-632230dc9882b4352d753eedf9396530.png" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/57101074?book_show_action=false">May 23, 2009</a>      <a title="Scortia" class="user" name="Scortia" href="/user/show/2348226-scortia">Scortia</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer57101074" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14364109571134994809">I still have no idea why most people love this book. It read like a 13 year old fanfiction writer teeny-bopper wrote it. The only redeeming parts were the very beginning and ending parts with Snape. Snape was well handled, that was about it. OotP ended with a GREAT setup for book 6 but instead we get a really bad, trivial teen romance storyline. Yes, I think OotP was great, and most people hate it, I have no idea what other readers are thinking! <br /><br />Let's see. Tom is... dum dum dum... just an EVIL K</span>  <span id="freeText14364109571134994809" style="display:none">I still have no idea why most people love this book. It read like a 13 year old fanfiction writer teeny-bopper wrote it. The only redeeming parts were the very beginning and ending parts with Snape. Snape was well handled, that was about it. OotP ended with a GREAT setup for book 6 but instead we get a really bad, trivial teen romance storyline. Yes, I think OotP was great, and most people hate it, I have no idea what other readers are thinking! <br /><br />Let's see. Tom is... dum dum dum... just an EVIL KID. Really? Way to give him motivation. With the prejudices of the magical community, Tom could have been given so many motivations beyond just being the wizard equivalent of Demian. I was expecting so much more. The Horcrux adventures were dull... I didn't realize this was an RPG. There was a severe lack of any interesting adult character scenes... this was why I loved OotP so much. The Order was interesting and captivating. PoA pulled me into the series because of the adult backstory it presented... the adults are far more interesting than the kids when they are presented properly. Hermoine being a mopey puppy in love. Ron just making out constantly. DRACO CRYING IN BATHROOMS!? Draco doesn't feel sympathy for others... if anything he'd only be worried about failing at his mission, and that wouldn't cause tears. He's a self-serving weasel, he would only worry about his own interests. This was maybe the only time Rowling tried to give character growth to a child character in this novel and she failed miserably at it.<br /><br /><br /> The end of book 6 was miserable. Tonks and Remus are essentially destroyed as interesting characters. I literally threw the book at the love confession. It was so tacked on, so poorly handled, so UNNECESSARY. Most of this book was unnecessary. The franchise ended with OotP for me. I don't know why poor writing isn't more easily recognized. I guess people hold a blind eye towards anything negative associated with this series.</span>  <a data-text-id="14364109571134994809" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review57101074">  <td elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1470514677" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1470514677" />    <a title="Allison" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5978375-allison"><img alt="Allison" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476549196p2/5978375.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1470514677?book_show_action=false">Dec 31, 2015</a>      <a title="Allison" class="user" name="Allison" href="/user/show/5978375-allison">Allison</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5978375-allison?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5978375-allison?shelf=read-2015">read-2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1470514677" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3807536942590855033">I just wrote a full review for this book and then Goodreads did something weird and I lost it all. I'm too lazy to try to rewrite it word for word so you can have a list instead.<br /><br />1. I miss some of the whimsy and newness that we had in the first four books. Everything is getting darker and more morbid and there is so much more at risk. I love this, of course, but I wish there could have been more moments of fun and more snippets of education apart from those that are directly related to the storyl</span>  <span id="freeText3807536942590855033" style="display:none">I just wrote a full review for this book and then Goodreads did something weird and I lost it all. I'm too lazy to try to rewrite it word for word so you can have a list instead.<br /><br />1. I miss some of the whimsy and newness that we had in the first four books. Everything is getting darker and more morbid and there is so much more at risk. I love this, of course, but I wish there could have been more moments of fun and more snippets of education apart from those that are directly related to the storyline (so dark!!!).<br /><br />2. Ginny and Harry's relationship did not seem organic to me. Hermione and Ron have been built up throughout all of the books, but Harry's feelings of jealousy and desire just showed up. Their kiss and relationship did not have me convinced as to any feelings between the two.<br /><br />3. Book!Ginny continues to be great. Fred and George are my favorites. Neville... what a sweetheart. The side characters are so important to me. Luna!!! I adore them.<br /><br />4. Snape continues to be nothing but trash to me. I will never be convinced that Snape was ever anything but a bully, a murderer, an all-around bad egg. I mean, I could feel a little bad when James was being a jerk to him while they were at school, but, really??? He has become nothing but evil. UGH.<br /><br />5. Some parts were just too long. The Pensieve magic was interesting and those memories were important, but I think something in the execution was lacking. I wasn't as captured by those scenes as I wanted to be.<br /><br />This series continues to be amazing, but these later books just don't touch the greatness that is books 3 and 4 for me.</span>  <a data-text-id="3807536942590855033" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/34546637" />    <a title="Joyzi" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1591538-joyzi"><img alt="Joyzi" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1410669310p2/1591538.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/34546637?book_show_action=false">Dec 26, 2010</a>      <a title="Joyzi" class="user" name="Joyzi" href="/user/show/1591538-joyzi">Joyzi</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">harry potter fans</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Joyzi by: </span>      my friends at school  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=children-s">children-s</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=watched-it">watched-it</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=books-to-movies">books-to-movies</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=read-more-than-once">read-more-than-once</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=political-intrigue">political-intrigue</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=banned">banned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=book-series">book-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1591538-joyzi?shelf=author-brit">author-brit</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer34546637" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14674703858732170873"><b>***SPOILER ALERT***</b><br /><br />This book was really amazing it even made me cry. Even if I know a lot of spoilers which my friend have told me about Snape being the Half Blood Prince, Snape killed Dumbledore, Ginny and Harry being together, about the horcrux was a fake, my friend actually told me the summary of this book. <br /><br />I think even if I know a lot of what was going to happen I still find it painful to read it especially the part when Dumbledore was killed and Hagrid was talking to Harry and Hagrid doesn'</span>  <span id="freeText14674703858732170873" style="display:none"><b>***SPOILER ALERT***</b><br /><br />This book was really amazing it even made me cry. Even if I know a lot of spoilers which my friend have told me about Snape being the Half Blood Prince, Snape killed Dumbledore, Ginny and Harry being together, about the horcrux was a fake, my friend actually told me the summary of this book. <br /><br />I think even if I know a lot of what was going to happen I still find it painful to read it especially the part when Dumbledore was killed and Hagrid was talking to Harry and Hagrid doesn't know at that moment that Dumbledore was already dead. It was really painful for me and i cried at that point because it was like suddenly the most person that you think the greatest of them all and actually the one wizard that Voldemort feared was dead. To think that Snape killed him and that the horcrux was fake i feel really terrible that it all ended that way. <br /><br />I think that this ending was more depressing than when Sirius Black was killed on the Order of the Phoenix. There were so many questions that really need answers. That would make you after reading this book think, be nervous about what would possibly happen.<br /><br />I really felt that this was a good book and hope that the movie would not disappoint me. I saw a trailer of it wherein the burrow was burned it's not in the book though. I can't wait to buy "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hollows." Really Harry Potter series made me hooked that i truly recommended everyone to read this book. <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="14674703858732170873" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review34546637">  <td elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1277935817" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1277935817" />    <a title="Amanda NEVER MANDY" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36873041-amanda-never-mandy"><img alt="Amanda NEVER MANDY" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470689139p2/36873041.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1277935817?book_show_action=false">Dec 16, 2015</a>      <a title="Amanda NEVER MANDY" class="user" name="Amanda NEVER MANDY" href="/user/show/36873041-amanda-never-mandy">Amanda NEVER MANDY</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36873041-amanda-never-mandy?shelf=harry-plopper">harry-plopper</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36873041-amanda-never-mandy?shelf=2015">2015</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1277935817" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9564491716958678190">Book six brought my slowly budding love for Mr. Snape to a head. Don’t get me wrong, I am all about the good guy winning and I am totally rooting for the main character to find his prize at the bottom of the 80’s cereal box. <b>BUT</b> it doesn’t mean I can’t be crushing on a little side action while things are reaching their boiling point. Apparently this girl has a soft spot for the tall, dark and greasy type. Money says it’s probably his sharp-wit and angry demure that sold me, though I imagine the</span>  <span id="freeText9564491716958678190" style="display:none">Book six brought my slowly budding love for Mr. Snape to a head. Don’t get me wrong, I am all about the good guy winning and I am totally rooting for the main character to find his prize at the bottom of the 80’s cereal box. <b>BUT</b> it doesn’t mean I can’t be crushing on a little side action while things are reaching their boiling point. Apparently this girl has a soft spot for the tall, dark and greasy type. Money says it’s probably his sharp-wit and angry demure that sold me, though I imagine the oozing with backstory could be a likely candidate as well.<br /><br />All kidding aside, I am keeping a close eye on Snape not only because he is my favorite character but because deep down I feel he is at heart a noble guy. How will I feel if I’m wrong? He will still hold a place in my favorite character category because there is just so much to him as a character. He is honestly one that I would love to hear more of a backstory on (fingers crossed the next book covers that).<br /><br />So a lot has happened here and I am ready to face everyone’s fate (as horrible as it might be) in the final installment of this epic series. Wish me luck.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="9564491716958678190" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter id="reviewTextContainer1393629257" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2947368801592472016"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442429213p8/1237257.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Joseph's super nice comment on my review for book #4 makes me feel bad that I dropped the ball for doing commentary on the rest of the series. Oh well! Maybe next time, because, OF COURSE, there will be YET ANOTHER reread at some point!<br><br>The four "commentary" (a.k.a. “obsessing over the details”) <em>Harry Potter</em> posts can be found on my Harry Potter shelf or you can view them on my blog:<br><br><a href="https://isniffbooks.wordpress.com/2015/08/20/obsessing-over-the-details-in-harry-potter-and-the-goblet-of-fire/" rel="nofollow">Goblet of Fire</a>(#4)<br><a href="https://isniffbooks.wordpress.com/2015/08/05/obsessing-over-the-details-in-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/" rel="nofollow">Prisoner of Azkaban</a>(#3)<br><a href="https://isniffbooks.wordpress.com/2015/07/29/obsessing-over-the-details-in-harry-potter-and-the-chamber-of-secrets/" rel="nofollow">Chamber of Secrets</a>(#2)<br><a href="https://isniffbooks.wordpress.com/2015/07/22/obessessing-over-the-details-in-harry-potter-and-the-sorcerers-stone/" rel="nofollow">Sorcerer’s Stone</a>(#1)<br><br><br>read from either Sept 4 or 5, 20</span>  <span id="freeText2947368801592472016" style="display:none"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/photos/1442429213p8/1237257.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Joseph's super nice comment on my review for book #4 makes me feel bad that I dropped the ball for doing commentary on the rest of the series. Oh well! Maybe next time, because, OF COURSE, there will be YET ANOTHER reread at some point!<br><br>The four "commentary" (a.k.a. “obsessing over the details”) <em>Harry Potter</em> posts can be found on my was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer886483620" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17243065149380856651">Me encantaría leer toooooooda la historia de lord Voldemort, lo que se relata en este libro es muy fascinante.<br />Dumbledore sin duda es de mis personajes favoritos, la sabiduría que tiene es demasiada, ¡Aprendes mucho de él!. Me dolió su pérdida pero no, no fue en vano.<br />Como todos hasta el momento odio a Severus, pero se viene el siguiente libro y ahí cambia la cosa.<br />Lord Voldemort es de mis villanos favoritos, sea lo que sea, es uno de los grandes.<br />La fidelidad del ED y de la Orden del Fénix para pro</span>  <span id="freeText17243065149380856651" style="display:none">Me encantaría leer toooooooda la historia de lord Voldemort, lo que se relata en este libro es muy fascinante.<br />Dumbledore sin duda es de mis personajes favoritos, la sabiduría que tiene es demasiada, ¡Aprendes mucho de él!. Me dolió su pérdida pero no, no fue en vano.<br />Como todos hasta el momento odio a Severus, pero se viene el siguiente libro y ahí cambia la cosa.<br />Lord Voldemort es de mis villanos favoritos, sea lo que sea, es uno de los grandes.<br />La fidelidad del ED y de la Orden del Fénix para proteger a Harry y al mundo mágico es mucha, el amor que se inicia con algunos personajes es muy bello, los valores que se ven en HP deberíamos practicarlos más.<br />Esta relectura hace que recuerde cosas que tenía olvidadas de esta hermosa saga con la que inicie en el maravilloso mundo de la lectura, en particular este libro es el 3er favorito de la serie. u0026lt;3<br /><br />"La grandeza inspira envidia, la envidia engendra rencor y el rencor genera mentiras"<br />-Lord Voldemort<br />"Lo único que nos da miedo cuando nos asomamos a la muerte y a la oscuridad es lo desconocido"<br />-Albus Dumbledore<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="17243065149380856651" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; id="reviewTextContainer882225422" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7198315771551470810">Post-reading: It's hard for me to believe that I have just one book left to read in this series. I have no idea when I will pick up Deathly Hallows, either during spring or summer break, but I will finish this series this year.<br /><br />I am mad at myself for taking a million years to listen to this book, but I really enjoyed it. Because of how long it took me to read it, I know that I can't give an accurate view of this book, but I would say that it is right in the middle for my favorites in the series.</span>  <span id="freeText7198315771551470810" style="display:none">Post-reading: It's hard for me to believe that I have just one book left to read in this series. I have no idea when I will pick up Deathly Hallows, either during spring or summer break, but I will finish this series this year.<br /><br />I am mad at myself for taking a million years to listen to this book, but I really enjoyed it. Because of how long it took me to read it, I know that I can't give an accurate view of this book, but I would say that it is right in the middle for my favorites in the series. I didn't have any problems with it, it just took me forever to read.<br /><br />~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br /><br />What I Think (or think I know) Pre-reading:<br />*This book is basically Voldemort's biography.<br />*Snape might be the Half-Blood Prince<br />*Draco deals with lots of angst and character development.<br /><br />And what I know is true:<br />*<a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Dumbledore, sadly, dies near the end of the book. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />*Snape's dream of becoming the Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher comes true.</span>  <a data-text-id="7198315771551470810" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return title="Paperback 9780747584681" href="/book/show/840699.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22595921-mariana?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1591957149" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4757009094009821086">This fucked me up<br /><br />EDIT (A FEW HOURS LATER)<br /><br />Ok, so...I was spoiled for one big thing in this book <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[HOW CAN DUMBLEDORE BE DEAD <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> but I was still in tears when it happened and even more shocked with the person who made it happen...<a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[I seriously don't know what to think of Snape. Is he good, is he bad? Because at the moment I think he's pretty shitty and awful!! <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />Basically, I'm at this point where I don't know if I want to read the last book or cr</span>  <span id="freeText4757009094009821086" style="display:none">This fucked me up<br /><br />EDIT (A FEW HOURS LATER)<br /><br />Ok, so...I was spoiled for one big thing in this book <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[HOW CAN DUMBLEDORE BE DEAD <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> but I was still in tears when it happened and even more shocked with the person who made it happen...<a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[I seriously don't know what to think of Snape. Is he good, is he bad? Because at the moment I think he's pretty shitty and awful!! <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />Basically, I'm at this point where I don't know if I want to read the last book or cry forever and stay inside the story. Because, I know once I read the last book, that'll be it. It's done. It's gone. I'm so attached to it...But I need to know how it ends. So pray for my mental health please, because I'm going to be seriously damaged internally and will probably never get over it and cry everyday for the rest of my life. Ok, I'm gonna end this now. My heart is already aching.</span>  <a data-text-id="4757009094009821086" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1591957149">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1591957149" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1591957149u0026amp;resource_type=Reviewu0026amp;return_url=%2Fbook%2Fshow%2F1.Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1591957149'><a id="like_count_review_1591957149" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1591957149?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">5 likes</span></a>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1591957149" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1591957149" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=falseu0026amp;format=jsonu0026amp;lc=5u0026amp;rating%5Bpage%5D=10u0026amp;rating%5Brating%5D=1u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_id%5D=1591957149u0026amp;rating%5Bresource_type%5D=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>u0026nbsp;u0026middot;u0026nbsp;<a id="commentLink_1591957149" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(u0026#39;reviewu0026#39;, 1591957149, true, u0026#39;u0026#39;);
